content.text: Local Policy Practice and Local Policy Research : Unit of the Working Group on Local Policy and Political Science on the occasion of the Congress of the German Association for Political Science, Bonn 1977. The publication provides an overview of new research approaches of German local policy research. It combines deficit analysis and inventory of previous research on local policy with descriptions of approaches and questions of new research perspectives of application-oriented local policy analysis. Research strategies and instruments such as organizational development, action research and planning tests are discussed on their applicability. Alternative research approaches to the urban movement and self-organization, criticism of the new approaches as well as discussion of institutional, personnel and curricular prerequisites for successful innovation and research transfer into local practice complement the volume.
content.title_en: Local Policy Practice and Local Policy Research : Unit of the Working Group on Local Policy and Political Science at the Congress of the German Association for Political Science, Bonn 1977

content.text: Remote sensing of pollution of the sea : proceedings of the international colloquium ; Univ. of Oldenburg, Oldenburg (FRG) March 31 - April 3, 1987. At the Oldenburg Colloquium on the investigation and monitoring of marine pollution using remote sensing techniques, scientists from the disciplines concerned and representatives of the competent authorities gathered to exchange information on the current state of pollution, particularly in the area of coastal waters, on the underlying transport processes and on the various sensor techniques used to monitor it. - Within the colloquium, a workshop on newly developed tools to combat pollution from oil was held. <dt.>
content.title_en: Remote sensing of pollution of the sea : proceedings of the international colloquium ; Univ. of Oldenburg, Oldenburg (FRG) March 31 - April 3, 1987

content.text: Prospects for East-West European transport : International seminar Paris 6th - 7th December 1990. The volume gives a comprehensive overview of the current East-West transport links and planned projects. The role of the United Nations Economic Commission for Europe is outlined.
content.title_en: Prospects for East-West European transport : International seminar Paris 6th - 7th December 1990

content.text: Technology and social change : Negotiations of the 23rd German Sociological Day in Hamburg 1986. From the foreword: The Hamburg Sociological Day 1986 is intended for a wide range of sociological technology research to demonstrate the solution of the conventional conception of technology as a socially exogenous factor of social change and the consequent almost compelling reduction of empirical and theoretical questions on the effects of a technique which can only be described in descriptive terms as necessary and possible.
content.title_en: Technology and social change : Negotiations of the 23rd German Sociology Day in Hamburg 1986

content.text: Antifouling in the sea - hazards caused by marine paints? : 21 January 1993, Hotel Faldernpoort, Emden : SDN colloquium. At a colloquium of the German North Sea Coast Protection Association the problem of antifouling was addressed. It dealt with the possible ecological consequences of marine paints, which represent a major threat to marine ecology due to the extreme toxicity of the active substance Tributyltin.
content.title_en: Antifouling in the sea - hazards caused by ship paints? : 21 January 1993, Hotel Faldernpoort, Emden : SDN colloquium

content.text: Learning processes with digital tools support : perspectives from the didactics of natural sciences subjects. Publishing info: Computers, interactive whiteboards, smartphones or tablets offer new possibilities for science teaching. Students are trained in the use of technology – best prerequisites for using them in teaching? Studies show that Germany is clearly behind the scenes when it comes to using digital media or computers in school lessons compared to other countries. What is the problem? What is the technical didactic value of digital tools? What are the current theoretical discussions, experiences and results from the didactics of natural sciences subjects? The three editors Dr. Jenny Messinger-Koppelt (Project Manager Natural Sciences, Joachim Herz Stiftung), Prof. Dr. Sascha Schanze (Institute for Didactics of Natural Sciences, Leibniz University Hannover) and Prof. Dr. Jorge Groß (Didactics of Natural Sciences, Otto-Friedrich University Bamberg) have published a new book on these issues.
content.title_en: Supporting learning processes with digital tools : Perspectives from the Didactics of Science

content.text: Digital economy and sharing economy: economic ethical and moral economic perspectives. Sharing (can) is the new having (want)? So it sometimes seems that when one looks at the ever-increasing number of publications on the sharing economy. Not a few already speak of another industrial revolution, which is possible through the progressive digitization of the economy and not least through the Internet. The basic idea is captivating: Through the Internet information about the temporary availability of goods is almost unlimited and very inexpensively available, with digital goods even their proliferation is subject to this logic. So, exchange and sharing solve the exclusive claim to ownership? Does even the long-awaited dream of a world come true, in which possessions are not only available to a few, but to many - perhaps almost all - people? Can this one day even the pursuit of ownership be overtaken by many, which is severely criticized by others since Adam Smith is considered ethically preferable? Or are only old-known economic findings offered here in new packaging?
content.title_en: Digital economy and sharing economy : ethical and moral economic perspectives

content.text: The first nature conservation associations were founded more than 100 years ago and the acquisition of land by associations to secure threatened areas has been a long time ago. After German reunification in 1990, for example, in the context of the sale of former state property of the GDR, there was also the sale or free transfer of nature reserves (so-called national natural heritage), in which nature conservation foundations and associations as new land owners took on a wide range of obligations. Many of the achievements of nature conservation go back to this continuous voluntary use. These facts were the reason for the BfN to hold a conference on the island of Vilm in 2015, at which various foundations, associations and associations explicitly presented their successes in land and area protection. This volume summarizes the results of the conference and thus makes it known to a wider audience.
content.title_en: Area and protected area management by foundations, associations and associations

content.text: Big Data – in the catch of data cracks: the (un-)secret power of algorithms. The beautiful new digital world has its price. Pays for the transfer of personal data – when shopping, driving a car, chatting and surfing. The intelligent algorithms necessary for this are a potential danger for a free society. They analyze, forecast and calculate us. Big Data and Data Mining are the business models of the future.What does this mean for politics, economics, journalism and political communication? Do fundamental rights and human dignity have to be defended against the digital revolution? Do we need new laws and an ethics of algorithms? And how do politics, media and free democracy work under the conditions mentioned above?Experts from various disciplines of science, journalism and politics discuss these forward-looking and socially relevant questions.With contributions byJohanna Haberer, Yvonne Hofstetter, Sabine Leutheusser-Schnarrenberger, Klaus Mainzer, Daniel Moßbrucker, Peter Schaar, Michael Schröder, Axel Schwanebeck and Thomas Zeilinger
content.title_en: Big Data – in the catch of data crackers: the (un-)secret power of algorithms

content.text: The current crisis in Europe: theological attempts to answer. "European societies are currently undergoing a profound change that is questioning European integration itself. Already the debates about the soul of Europe", a European constitution, the possible inclusion of Turkey and the position of Islam in Europe have made it clear that the cultural and (civil) religious dimension is gaining in importance. In the current discussions about a 'new foundation of Europe' this is even more true. It is about the foundations of solidarity and cohesion, about peaceful coexistence in a post-secular society, about the understanding of public reason. The volume poses the associated challenges in order to develop a theological answer to the crisis of Europe."
content.title_en: The present crisis in Europe: theological attempts to answer

content.text: Trading data in the digital economy: legal concepts and tools : Münster Colloquia on EU law and the Digital Economy III. "Digitalisation is one of the most important topics of the new century. It is changing our society as fundamentally as our economy. Business data collection leads to an enormous amount of data that is blood in the veins of the digital economy. Many current, but above all future business models that are intended to drive innovation and create economic growth are based on the use of these data. The volume analyses legal concepts and instruments relating to the topic of data trading. It documents the amounts and results of the "Munster Colloquium on Trading Data in the Digital Economy". This helps the band to address the challenges of data trading, especially at European level.
content.title_en: Trading data in the digital economy: legal concepts and tools : Münster Colloquia on EU law and the Digital Economy III

content.text: Place architectures : Continuity and change of public urban spaces from the 19th century to the present. Publishing info: The place is still a place of social self-confirmation, where monument sets, image falls and other social and political activities take place. The contributions of this anthology are devoted to urban planning theoretical considerations and concrete historical developments of different urban spaces. Since the work of authors such as Camillo Sitte, August Schmarsow and Albert Erich Brinckmann, art-historical urban and space research has been founded on the fruitful examination of the disciplines of urban design, urban planning and urban planning with architectural space. Against this background, the viewing horizon of the contributions extends to the 21st century and also focuses on current tendencies of globalization and commercialization of architecture and public space.
content.title_en: Square architectures : Continuity and change of public urban spaces from the 19th century to the present

content.text: Inclusive transitions: (Inter)national perspectives on inclusion in the transition from school to further education, training or employment. Educational transitions from compulsory school to further education, training or employment for people with different needs for support are neuralgic points on which success or failure can be reflected. The present collection of the 2016 conference addresses the possibilities of support for people with different needs for support and with which theoretical and research approaches the transition process can be empirically grasped. Educational biographical aspects are addressed as well as the question of differences in educational transitions. The common starting point is an intersectional understanding of inclusion, which takes into account the relationship between disability and non-hindery as well as other factors of social inequality and takes into account in the reflection on heterogeneity in educational transitions. This title is deposited in the open access on the document server pedocs of the DIPF.
content.title_en: Including transitions : (Inter)national perspectives on inclusion in the transition from school to further education, training or employment

content.text: Mastering "Grand Challenges" : the contribution of technology assessment. The dazzling concept of the Grand Challenges is in all its mouths and grounds for a critical examination of this research-led concept. The book contributions are devoted to the topic in both theoretical terms and with regard to the domains of health, digitalization and environment
content.title_en: Mastering Grand Challenges: the contribution of the Technology Assessment

content.text: Made in Germany - Politics with Things : the German Werkbund around 1914. "The Werkbundarchiv - Museum der Dinge has been publishing its own series of publications since 2012 under the title 'Schaukasten'. In the series, individual objects or ensembles, selected collection areas as well as topics relevant to the content are presented and discussed. Thus, the reader is to be able to acquire the collection on the product culture of the 20th and 21st century piece by piece. The fourth volume examines the strategies of the German Werkbund before the First World War with the historical reference point of the 'Deutsche Werkbund-Exhibition Cöln 1914'. The transformation of the designation of origin 'Made in Germany' into a quality label is the subject of the discussion and critically questions the ideas of a 'national modernism'. At the Werkbund debates of the time and on the basis of selected objects of Werkbund artists and Werkbund companies can be read off the distortions in the context of the social and cultural transformation processes of Germany to a modern industrial state on a historical micro level"-Publisher's website
content.title_en: Made in Germany - Politics with things : the German Werkbund around 1914

content.text: Image processing for medicine 2018 : Algorithms - Systems - Applications ; Proceedings of the workshop from 11 to 13 March 2018 in Erlangen. In recent years the workshop 'Image processing for medicine' has established itself through successful events. The aim is again in 2018 to present current research results and deepen the discussions between scientists, industry and users. The contributions of this volume - some of them in English - cover all areas of medical image processing, in particular imaging and acquisition, machine learning, image segmentation and image analysis, visualization and animation, time series analysis, computer assisted diagnosis, biomechanical modelling, validation and quality assurance, image processing in telemedicine and many more. In recent years the workshop 'Image processing for medicine' has established itself through successful events. The aim is again in 2018 to present current research results and deepen the discussions between scientists, industry and users. The contributions of this volume - some of them in English language - cover all areas of medical image processing, in particular imaging and acquisition, machine learning, image segmentation and image analysis, image analysis, visualization and image analysis, computer analysis and animation.
content.title_en: Image processing for medicine 2018 : Algorithms - Systems - Applications ; Proceedings of the workshop from 11 to 13 March 2018 in Erlangen

content.text: The Age of Coal : a European History : Catalogue book for the exhibition of the Ruhr Museum and the German Mining Museum at the Kokerei Zollverein 27 April to 11 November 2018. 2018 is "Schicht im Schacht" (layer in the shaft). Then the last German coal mines close in Bottrop and Ibbenbüren. This concludes an era in which coal has decisively determined the history of Europe. This farewell is the occasion for the Essen Ruhr Museum and the Deutsche Bergbau-Museum Bochum to review the European history of coal in the industrial age. The richly illustrated catalogue for the exhibition illustrates the emergence of coal, the mining industry, the underground world, the energetic, material, economic and social dimensions of coal and finally the political and ecological effects up to the current structural change
content.title_en: The Age of Coal : a European History : Catalogue book for the exhibition of the Ruhr Museum and the German Mining Museum at the Kokerei Zollverein 27 April to 11 November 2018

content.text: Leibniz - Garten - Landschaft. Verlagsinfo: Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz (1646IBM1716), philosopher, mathematician, historian and diplomat, spent the last forty years of his life in Hannover. Because of this outstanding significance for the city, a Leibniz-Foundation professorship was established at Leibniz Universität Hannover from 2010 to 2017, whose task was to research Leibniz's work and to mediate it to a wider public. In cooperation with the Leibniz Foundation Professorship with the Center for Gardening and Landscape Architecture (CGL) of Leibniz Universität Hannover and the Friends of Herrenhäuser Gärten e.V., a Matinee "Leibniz IBM Garten IBM Landschaft?" took place on 3 November 2016. This was probably the first international event, which was explicitly dedicated to the subject area of gardens, gardening and landscape culture in connection with Leibniz's life and work. The Matinee brought together scientists and scientists from different disciplines: philosophy and history, the history of architecture, literature and landscape architecture as well as the history of garden art and culture. With volume 7 of the garden houses, the landscape can be made accessible to the public?
content.title_en: Leibniz - Garden - Landscape

content.text: History of yesterday for Germans of tomorrow? : The experience of National Socialism and historical-political learning in the (post-)migration society. About the contribution of historical memory for the democratic stabilisation of a (post-)migration society is not only thought in Germany, since 2015 refugees have come to the country in large numbers. But since then a question is all the more urgent: How can the necessarily national-historical self-critical examination of National Socialism become open and relevant to people of other origins beyond the national-historical reference framework, without requiring historical identity or decoupling National Socialism from its German origin. The volume gathers impulses on the discourse on these questions, mediates orienting for educational practice and encourages to reflect on the havoc of historical-political learning and the relation of the present as well as on the future tasks of the concentration camps.
content.title_en: History of yesterday for Germans of tomorrow? : the experience of National Socialism and historical-political learning in the (post-)migration society

content.text: Political futures in the 20th century: parties, movements, upheavals. Politics is always oriented towards the future, at least in its mediation. However, the contemporary history of the future as a political category has not yet been systematically illuminated. This volume opens up future designs of political parties and movements, future communication and time politics in the 20th century. The contributions explain how liberals, SPD and political Catholicism competed with revolutionary national socialist and communist futures of the interwar period in the 1920s, and they show who has communicated the orientation of the now, the necessity of political planning or the warning of imminent crises since the 1960s. By looking at competing political futures, the band develops new perspectives on the temporality of party, movement and democracy history and on changing horizons of expectation in the upheavals of the 20th century that radiate into the present.
content.title_en: Political Futures in the 20th Century : Parties, Movements, Changes

content.text: Reformation and the Peasant War. "The peasant war is inseparably linked to the Reformation. The uprising from the south-west of the empire spread like a fire and reached its peak in Thuringia with the Battle of Frankenhausen in May 1525. The causes of the revolt are very different regionally and in terms of status. However, it is clear that the ideas of a "better world" that circulated by means of flight notes were increasingly well received in the rural and urban environments. The public-led controversy on questions of social justice, religious renewal and autonomous self-determination were manifold. These aspects are addressed in this volume. At the same time, he problems the social, economic and political conditions in the Thuringian-Central German region at the time of the peasant war." (Verlagsinformation)
content.title_en: Reformation and Peasant War

content.text: Innovation in Outer Space: International and African Legal Perspective : 5th & 6th Luxembourg Workshops on Space and Satellite Communication Law. The volume presents the results of two workshops on the
content.title_en: Innovation in Outer Space: International and African Legal Perspective : 5th & 6th Luxembourg Workshops on Space and Satellite Communication Law

content.text: Layers : furniture design from classicism to modernity. Includes examples of furniture made of laminated wood (18th and 19th centuries) including Jean-Joseph Chapuis, Michael Thonet, Jean-Pierre Moïse Guichard; explanations on methods such as layer glue, stick glue -- furniture made of plywood (19th century) and plywood and laminated wood in the modern (20th century) with examples such as brothers Thonet, John Henry Belter, brothers Rasch, Alvar Aalto, Walter Gropius, Marcel Breuer (Long Chair B.C.1, Short Chair B.C.2, Nesting Chair and Nesting Table B.T.2, Cut-out Chair, Occasional Table and others) -- Technical requirements Historical overview of veneering and processing such as saws, knives (shaft veneer, knife veneer), drive (scutter mill, pedals and horsework, steam machine), glue (animal glue, wet glue, wet glue);
content.title_en: Layers : Furniture design from classicism to modernity

content.text: Design and Mimesis: imitation in nature and culture. Nature often serves as a model for design – at the same time, animals and plants sometimes observe mimetic behaviors that would distinguish them as creative beings. So are nature and culture contrasts, as often mentioned in the history of mind and culture? Numerous concepts and theories of design are based on the distinction between involuntarily become and willfully created, between natural and man-made. Currently, topics such as designer plants and animals, patents on genomes, sustainability, climate change, energy transition and animal ethics are discussed and evaluated as challenges both of the present and the distant future. The authors of the volume show the role played by mimesis as imitation of nature in design. In the contributions, as diverse topics as the design of virtual spaces are treated, e.g. in computer games, the sustainable production and disposal of clothing or the imitation of animals and their behaviour in contemporary performance art.
content.title_en: Design and Mimesis : Imitation in nature and culture

content.text: The European Union has several crisis phenomena that have had a negative impact on its acceptance and capacity for action. From a constitutional perspective, it is clear that the fundamental legal values of the EU itself, but also of the constitutional states that are united within it, are no longer accepted everywhere. The contributions of this volume take this up and examine the constitutional values of the EU as well as systemic changes of the constitutional system in individual Member States. To this end, the character of the Union as a legal community is first discussed. Regarding the Member States, the application of the so-called legal state procedure in the case of Poland as well as the important role of the Venice Commission is examined. On the conflict between state constitutional autonomy and the integration into the EU, the Member State of Hungary, the country of exit from the UK and the accession aspirant Turkey are presented and analysed.With contributions by Prof. Dr. Armin von Bogdandy, Dr. Hüseyin Çelik, Prof. Dr. Christoph Grabenwarter, Prof. Dr. Gábor Halmai, Prof. Dr. Stefan Kadelbach, L.M. (Viginia), Dr.
content.title_en: Constitutional crises in the European Union

content.text: Current developments in the implementation of the Water Framework Directive: Documentation of the 22nd Leipzig Environmental Law Symposium of the Institute for Environmental and Planning Law of the University of Leipzig and the Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research - UFZ on 30 and 31 March 2017. The documentation of the 22nd Leipzig Environmental Law Symposium on 30 and 31 March 2017 is dedicated to the current developments in the implementation of the Water Framework Directive, taking into account recent groundbreaking judicial decisions. The conference volume also examines the impact on the state of the water in Germany as a whole, in particular with regard to the successes achieved in Germany and the ongoing need for action, as well as the current case law on water law and its implementation in practice and the possible consequences. The concrete effects on industry and agriculture, for example in the form of micro-pollutants, are also examined in more detail. This volume is aimed at all those who are concerned with the implementation of the Water Framework Directive and who want to inform themselves about practical innovations in this field.
content.title_en: Current developments in the implementation of the Water Framework Directive : Documentation of the 22nd Leipzig Environmental Law Symposium of the Institute for Environmental and Planning Law of the University of Leipzig and the Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research - UFZ on 30 and 31 March 2017

content.text: Prepared for the future? : Safety and health in the fire brigade : Documentation of the FUK Forum "Security" 2017 : Hamburg, 04.-05.12.2017. The conference volume for the conference 7th FUK Forum "Security" 2017 entitled "Face-ready for the future? Safety and health in the fire brigade" has been published in book form. From 4 to 5 December 2017, around 300 participants in Hamburg discussed numerous topics of the present and future in the field of safety and health in the fire brigade service: The use of the fire brigade is dangerous and will remain! In addition, new dangers are added, which needs to be prepared.
content.title_en: Prepared for the future? : Safety and health in the fire brigade : Documentation of the FUK Forum "Security" 2017 : Hamburg, 04.-05.12.2017

content.text: Nationalization of the world? : European models of state and non-European processes of power. The central question is: Has Europe succeeded in exporting its specific political culture - the national power state - to the rest of the world? The individual contributions about the USA and Latin America, South and East Asia, the Islamic world and sub-Saharan Africa can certainly present success stories. Much more frequently, however, there has been a crisis in the state system, so that often "; state failure"; or even "; state decay"; is spoken.
content.title_en: Nationalization of the world? : European models of state and non-European processes of power

content.text: The open access book combines technical, economic, medical and ethical reflections on care robots. The majority of care robots, currently still using prototypes, support or replace human care workers or caregivers. They bring the necessary medicines and food to the sick and elderly, help to lay down and set up or alert emergency services. The benefits of care robots are continuous usability and consistent quality of service. Disadvantages are cost intensity (if possible amortization) and complexity of requirements. Under the scientific direction of Prof. Dr. Oliver Bendel, representatives of various scientific disciplines met in September 2017 in the context of a Ladenburg discourse by the Daimler and Benz Foundation to talk about the current and future use of care robots and to identify research potential. The authors also answer questions from business, medicine and information ethics: Who bears responsibility for incorrect care and care by the machine? To what extent can they support or endanger the patient's personal and informational autonomy? Is the robot a relief or a counter-representant for care workers? Answers must be found by science and society. The Ausik robot's content of the care robots is also employed in the field of care robots.
content.title_en: Maintenance robots

content.text: Europe – sold and seduced? : Social-ethical reflections on challenges of European integration. Will the stabilisation of monetary union sell the soul of the European integration project? Are EU Member States being populistly seduced and placed against Europe? Paralyzing bureaucracy, strengthening right-wing populism, dispute and disagreement in the trade and currency area, Brexit and refugee debate: numerous crises plague the 'old continent', and the once so emerging peace and integration project seems to have to reinvent itself. In addition to an analysis of the crises and their origins, it is important to put the foundations and valid concepts of European identity and solidarity to the test and at the same time to advance the search for solutions at various levels. Are there and what would be common European values? What are the reasons for growing populism in Europe? How can the crises be evaluated in a social-ethical way and what solutions are there?
content.title_en: Europe – sold and seduced? : Social-ethical reflections on challenges of European integration

content.text: Realtime and security: Realtime 2018. With its 2018 workshop on "Realtime and security", the GI/GMA/ITG Technical Committee for Realtime Systems provides scientists, users and manufacturers with a forum where new trends and developments on the following program priorities are presented: Embedded systems, real-time communication, performance control and evaluation, logistics and real-time as well as functional security. Reports on current applications and training round off the publication Embedded systems -- Real-time communication -- Performance control and evaluation -- Real-time and safety -- Functional security
content.title_en: Real-time and security : Real-time 2018

content.text: Network integration of electric mobility 2018 : Merging paths 3. International ATZ conference. Network infrastructure -- Applications -- Standardization -- Market development -- Framework conditions -- Charging infrastructure -- Storage technology The main content of the conference volume for the ATZlive event Network integration of electric mobility 2018 are the following questions: When can electricity grids store volatile wind and solar energy? How are the electricity transmission networks designed? Can peak load situations be covered? The conference is an indispensable platform for the knowledge and thought exchange of researchers and developers of all companies and institutions looking for answers to these questions. The content Network infrastructure.- Applications.- Standardisation.- Market development.- Framework conditions.- Charging infrastructure.- Storage technology. The target groups executives and engineers at automotive manufacturers, suppliers, development service providers - research institutions and universities - employees at telecommunications services, IT companies, energy suppliers and network operators - All institutions dealing with electric mobility The organiser ATZlive stands for top quality, high level in terms of technical information and is part of the Springer Fachmedien Wiesbaden GmbH, the German project of the Springver Science GmbH.
content.title_en: Network integration of electric mobility 2018 : Merging paths 3. International ATZ Conference

content.text: The NewGa is a new book that describes opportunities and risks for employees and managers in a modern working environment. Superior developments such as demographic change, increasing digitalization and globalization, as well as the associated change in values change the organizational environment and thus also the understanding of work. The authors focus on people and discuss the impact these changes have on the work of individuals, how satisfied employees are with their work content and environments and how they want to work in the future. Furthermore, they investigate the framework conditions, structures, office forms and models organizations must develop in future in order to make the workplace of the future productive, motivating and healthy. The future competence requirements for the employees are considered and the leadership role in the New Work is analyzed. The division of the contributions into three different headings - scientific contributions, practice reports and personal views - enables a diverse reading access to the topic. The content The journey to New Work How we want to work in the future New Work - New Leadership - The office of the future - there is still this? The editor Prof. Dr. Sebastian Förwa is an application of the Work School of the University of Applied Sciences.
content.title_en: Future of Work - Perspective Human : Current Research and Good Practices

content.text: Authenticity as a capital of historical places? : the longing for the immediate experience of history. Between educational offers and 'Battlefield tourism': What role does authenticity play in the mediation of history? Historical places such as memorial and memorial sites are attributed in many ways authenticity. But what is the authenticity of these places that are subject to permanent changes? The importance of authenticity varies from place to place, as is the authenticity of various forms. It plays a role in educational offers and in educational work, but is also used in city tours. The contributions are devoted to these thematic fields and always keep in mind how authenticity ascriptions and expectations are served or deconstructed.
content.title_en: Authenticity as a capital of historical places? : the longing for the immediate experience of history

content.text: The exponential acceleration of the miniaturization and performance of computers, as well as the increasing use of "artificial intelligence" in the course of the so-called "Fourth Industrial Revolution", which also faces the development of mass surveillance instruments, are the main challenges facing the industry. The idea of the SIPE Congress, whose results are published, was to analyse these new developments among lawyers and discuss them as far as possible, and to go beyond the data protection law, without neglecting the new ones. The chapters are arranged according to three topics: Renewal of the legal principles questions on ICT; Administrative law of the new ICT; and Governance by algorithms.
content.title_en: Public law in the face of the challenges of information and communication technologies beyond data protection

content.text: The material culture of the city in the late Middle Ages and early modern times. "The 'material turn' has now also achieved research on pre-modernism. In this collection, scientists from the fields of history and art history investigate the material culture of the city. This new methodical approach leads to completely new results in relation to such traditional sources as chronicles, Rödel, invoices and oath books. He directs attention to artifacts owned by citizens and advice, whether they are preserved as objects or only documented in writing. Thus, the contributions shed new light on aspects of urban culture: they investigate the role of urinants and death shields, ask about the importance of material qualities of clothing, discuss upholstery, wall paintings and glass windows in council halls as media of urban communication." (Verlagsinformation)
content.title_en: The City's Material Culture in the Late Middle Ages and Early Modern Times

content.text: Robots in society: technical possibilities and human responsibility. Alin Albu-Schäffer, From torque-controlled robot arms to intrinsically yielding humanoid robots -- Jochen J. Steil, robot learning without limits? Learning robots and ethical questions -- Oliver Bendel, The programmed moral -- Catrin Misselhorn, Moral machines in care? Basics and a roadmap for a morally learning old-age care system -- Hartmut Hirsch-Kreinsen, Autonomous system in the industrial world -- Johannes Weyer, Autonomous technology out of control? Possibilities and limits of controlling complex systems in real-time society -- Norbert Lammert, Robot ethics. On the role of politics The book considers the use of robotics in health, business and work from an interdisciplinary perspective. More and more independent robots are entering our everyday lives. Already today they assume a variety of tasks, e.g. in the manufacturing industry or medicine? These machine systems operate at an ever-reversible pace independent of human control. To an increasing extent, they are able to engage in ethical challenges and to change our lives.
content.title_en: Robots in society : Technical possibilities and human responsibility

content.text: Cross-sectional problems of environmental and planning law : Legal protection and environmental audits : Documentation of the 23rd Leipzig Environmental Law Symposium of the Institute for Environmental and Planning Law of the University of Leipzig and the Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research - UFZ on 22 and 23 March 2018. The documentation of the 23rd Leipzig Environmental Law Symposium on 22 and 23 March 2018 is dedicated to the current interdisciplinary aspects of environmental law and focuses on the areas of legal protection and environmental audits. The conference volume deals with the developments of the Environmental Law Agency Act. The coordination of environmental impact assessments with other environmental law audits has been considered from a legal perspective. The legal protection against spatial planning plans and procedural errors are also examined. The conference volume contains contributions on the supplementary procedure as well as on the claim and reality of the Strategic Environmental Assessment. This volume is aimed at all those who are concerned with legal protection and environmental assessments of environmental and planning law and want to inform themselves about practical innovations in this field.
content.title_en: Cross-cutting problems of environmental and planning law : Legal protection and environmental assessments : Documentation of the 23rd Leipzig Environmental Law Symposium of the Institute for Environmental and Planning Law of the University of Leipzig and the Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research - UFZ on 22 and 23 March 2018

content.text: Migration in urban regions of the new Länder: Workshop in the context of the project "Migration in the Metropolitan Area Berlin, Brandenburg" on 16 October 1996 at IRS Erkner; Documentation. The individual contributions are slightly revised presentations of an IRS workshop, whose aim was to discuss the global and local migration movements in terms of their causes and consequences and to examine them on the basis of selected examples from East Germany. Compared to the normal processes of urban development, the abrupt socio-economic cuts, changes in the power of disposal over resources, the changed living situations of the affected population and the upheaval in the political-administrative system have a lasting impact on the socio-demographic development of the urban regions. The superposition of these various processes creates a multi-layered, often contradictory picture of migration events, which so far only unfailingly merges into a new trend of East German urban development. The contributions, which are about the two main areas of content "Semimental, social and economic aspects of migration" and "migration tendencies in selected urban regions in selected urban regions, are supplemented by a summary of the new Länder of the discussion.
content.title_en: Migration in urban regions of the new Länder : Workshop in the context of the project "Migration in the Metropolitan Area Berlin, Brandenburg" on 16 October 1996 at the IRS Erkner ; documentation

content.text: Regional cooperation - necessity and challenge of municipal politics. The publication is prompted by two specialist conferences on local policy, whose aim was to present and discuss relevant cooperation approaches at the local and regional level. The publication is initiated by the editors' comments on the problem and question of "regional cooperation". Two contributions to new perspectives of regional cooperation in the area of enterprise are followed by examples of regional production links as well as in legal areas. The first of the three main thematic sections presents the experiences of the institutionally established examples of regional urban-remote cooperation, which are already considered classic. The second main part addresses new forms of municipal cooperation through the development and implementation of joint projects, whose strategic approach is directed towards complex forms of cooperation and perspectives. The third and last main part deals with examples of sectoral cooperation, which are explicitly characterized by a regional dimension. Examples of joint settlement development (housing) and free space security (regional parks), management of public transport in interconnected systems and intermunal industrial areas are presented.
content.title_en: Regional cooperation - necessity and challenge of local policy

content.text: Contributions to psychological acoustics : results of the fifth Oldenburg Symposium on Psychological Acoustics. The volume summarizes the contributions of the 5th Symposium of Psychological Acoustics. The main focus of the discussion is a) noise in residential areas, b) the assessment of noise nuisance (volume and harassment), c) the dependence of the volume on the duration and frequency of the noise event. The Oldenburg Symposia understand the psychological acoustics in terms of quantitative and qualitative parameters for the recording of physical and subjective dimensions of the noise event.
content.title_en: Contributions to Psychological acoustics : results of the fifth Oldenburg Symposium on Psychological Acoustics

content.text: The annual working talks of the local youth aid experts in the southern German region serve to discuss basic planning problems and to examine current problem solving. They are designed as an inter-communal exchange of experiences, which is designed by the participants themselves (without speakers). The exchange of working papers, conceptual considerations and practical experiences as well as the documentation of these annual meetings serves the daily work in the youth offices and has already led to a large number of further cooperations between the South German cities. The 4th annual meeting on 14 May 1990 in Wiesbaden was devoted to the topic "Children in the City". It should draw attention to the need to draw attention more frequently and intensively to the interests of a minority of speechless - children and their parents - and to fight for their consideration. That this is already happening was known, as it happens, to the meeting. The publication contains the discussion contributions of the annual meeting.
content.title_en: Children in the city : Conference documentation

content.text: Beam-guided combustion systems : technical implementation and potential estimation of the second generation of direct gasoline injection; 6 tables. Major differences to today's combustion processes - potential of the beam-guided combustion process in terms of fuel consumption, emissions and costs - synergies with other technologies such as variable valve drive or charge - challenges to the applicateur - combustion room development - key components injection valve and fuel pump: design solutions - ignition systems for beam-guided combustion systems. The gasoline-direct injection has not achieved significant market penetration so far, as the expected consumption savings could not be implemented and the system costs are still extremely high. Significant improvements in terms of costs and benefits can be achieved by the beam-guided combustion process, which is currently under development. The volume of topics provides an insight into the technology and enables potential estimates of consumption, emissions and costs
content.title_en: Beam-guided combustion systems : technical implementation and potential assessment of the second generation of direct gasoline injection; 6 tables

content.text: Ethik ; 2: Technik - Umwelt - Ethik : zur ethiklichen Verantwortung des Ingenieurs für die ökologische Beschäftung der Technik; [Documentation of the University Didactic Seminar at Ulm University of Applied Sciences for Ethics Commissioner at the University of Applied Sciences in Baden-Württemberg and interested professors on 12 and 13 December 1991]. This publication is dedicated to the topic of technology and ethics. It documents the 2nd Ethics Seminar, which took place in July 1991 at the University of Applied Sciences in Ulm. Overview of the structure: A. Welcome (Kren) B. Introduction (Liebig) C. On the relationship between technology and nature (Kümmerer) D. The ethical responsibility of the engineer towards the environment (Hubig) E. Wertstoffsammlung, -sortierung und -verwertung. Konzepte und Wiersch (Wiersch) F. The pros and counter-ethik-Leitrates for engineers and natural scientists (Detzer) G. Limits of freedom of science: reflections on the topic: "Freeness and responsibility of scientists" (Dettiger-Klemm) H. content.text: Protection of nature and landscape in the municipalities : prevention, compensation and replacement of intervention projects ; documentation of the seminars on 30 September in Berlin and 13 November 1991 in Leipzig. In two seminar events in Berlin and Leipzig in September and November 1991, the German Institute for Urban Studies, with the support of the Federal Research Institute for Nature Conservation and Landscape Ecology, tried to provide initial assistance in the application of the natural protection instruments at the municipal level: the seminars should first of all show the requirements and possibilities of prevention, compensation and replacement of intervention projects according to § 8 BNatSchG; the tension in which nature conservation and landscape maintenance in the populated area must move in cooperation with the construction management planning; different application examples, procedures and procedures from municipalities of the old federal states; first examples of application from the new federal states, where typical questions and problems could be discussed, as well as finally suggestions and assistance measures can be provided, as despite the enormous planning and action pressure, despite often still lacking or insufficient planning basis nature conservation can and must be operated.
content.title_en: Protection of nature and landscape in the municipalities : prevention, compensation and replacement of intervention projects ; documentation of the seminars on 30 September in Berlin and 13 November 1991 in Leipzig

content.text: 30 years of intervention in nature protection legislation: balance sheet and outlook; results of the conference of the same name on 27 October 2006 at the Federal Office for Nature Conservation in Bonn. The intervention regulation in nature protection law is now 30 years. It is one of the most important and successful instruments of nature conservation in Germany. The basic requirements of the Federal Nature Conservation Act include the principle of land cover, the preventive effect, the polluter pays principle (costs are to be borne), the prohibition of deterioration (maintaining the status quo, in some ways implementing the sustainability principle) and the decision-making sequence (priority of prevention before compensation and compensation before replacement). Against this background, the experience with the intervention regulation shows significant successes in nature and landscape. [...] (Source: DLR press release)
content.title_en: 30 years of nature protection regulation: balance sheet and outlook; results of the conference of the same name on 27 October 2006 at the Federal Office for Nature Conservation in Bonn

content.text: Fairs, taxes, rules for biogas production: 15 November 2007, Convention Center, Messe Hannover. With the help of suitable and sufficient MSR technology (measurement-control rules), some biogas plants could be operated even more efficiently. However, the need for a minimum measuring equipment is not sufficiently aware of many plant operators, planners and manufacturers. Also in the field of research & development there is still a need for action, so that the great potential for efficiency increase with the help of appropriate MSR technology is fully realised. The funding focus of the FNR fairs, taxes, rules for biogas production is to intensify research in this field. At the technical meeting on 15 November 2007, experts from the industry took stock of what has been achieved and agreed on future action requirements (source: FNR).
content.title_en: Fairs, taxes, rules for biogas production : 15 November 2007, Convention Center, Messe Hannover

content.text: The origin of a world religion / Markus Groß/Karl-Heinz Ohlig (ed.) ; 1: From the Koranic movement to the early Islam. "Western Islamic research is currently exclusively oriented towards Arabic-philologically. It does not apply methods that are standard in historical sciences, nor does it take into account the oriental languages that left their mark in the Koran, nor does it take into account the numerous references to religious history. Obviously, however, the Koran addresses listeners who stood in these living traditions and responds to actively represented positions. It is impossible to interpret and understand him without recursing on these guidelines. If this hardship of research is not done, the Koran becomes the mere projection surface of its own ideas – whether Muslim or Western "scientific" manner. He himself then sinks in the dark – the opposite of his postulated canonical validity. This volume offers a series of historical and philological studies that make possible a new view of the early Islam history and the the the theology of the Korean movement." (Verlagsinformation)
content.title_en: The Origin of a World Religion / Markus Groß/Karl-Heinz Ohlig (ed.) ; 1: From the Korean Movement to the Early Islamic Movement

content.text: The origin of a world religion / Markus Groß; Karl-Heinz Ohlig (ed.) ; 2: From the Korean movement to the early Islam. "The authors are concerned with the beginnings of today's world religion Islam by means of sources that everyone can check, to elaborate and analyze, simply to know what it actually was then. Here, a special focus is on the Koran, because, finally, by the year 800, Islam emerged from the circles of its producers and followers as an independent religion. Our previous limitation to the first three or four centuries of Islamic time has to be relaxed a little, however, because the intensive occupation with the sources shows more and more clearly that many peculiarities of Islam have only found their shape in much later times and only since Saladin from a Sunni Islam as we know it today can be spoken of – when examining the respective contemporary sources – Koran, coins, inscriptions, archaeological testimonies, literature, language history – is increasingly evident that the "real ." The story has been different than the Islamic legends—all these are the most common examples of the history.
content.title_en: The Origin of a World Religion / Markus Groß; Karl-Heinz Ohlig (ed.) ; 2: From the Korean Movement to the Early Islamic Movement

content.text: Migrations to Germany and their impact on Baden-Württemberg : regional planning consequences ; regional planning conference 1993 from 28 to 30 April 1993 in Überlingen. The upheavals in Germany and Europe were the reason for the regional planning conference 1993 to place immigration to Germany and Baden-Württemberg at the center of the regional planning conference. In the lectures and workshop groups the topic of immigration is analysed, described and evaluated from different perspectives. The change of spatial networks Perspectives for urban landscapes in Switzerland and Baden-Württemberg as well as the social and spatial aspects of immigration to Germany are discussed. Another topic is the problem of small-scale population projections for purposes of planning in Baden-Württemberg. The final paper presents the state of strengthening of the regions in Baden-Württemberg with special consideration of the Stuttgart region. In the workshop groups, individual aspects are further deepened by theses papers and discussions.
content.title_en: Immigration to Germany and its effects on Baden-Württemberg : regional planning consequences ; Regional Planning Conference 1993 in Überlingen from 28 to 30 April 1993
