content.text: Modern living: furniture design and living culture of modernism. The topic of living was closely linked to the development of the New Building from the beginning. The book examines in 19 articles the development of the New Living in the areas of furniture design, living culture and furniture production from the 1920s to the 1950s. Programmatic publications in the tradition of Werkbund and Bauhaus, including "How do I set up my home?" by Wilhelm Lotz (1930) or "Good living" by Hans Eckstein (1956), provided modernist interiors with chrome-plated steel tube furniture in Ludwig Mies van der Rohe's style, including bourgeois home. In 19 articles, the volume examines the development of the "New Living" in the areas of furniture design, living culture and furniture production and investigates the related debates. Using examples from Europe and the USA, they span a arc from the 1920s to the 1950s. The publication was created in the context of the Mies van der Rohe research talks of the DFG project "Work List of Furniture and Furniture Projects of Ludwig van Rohinstitut München" in the German Institute of Art History and Design.
content.title_en: Modern living : furniture design and living culture of the modern

content.text: Art in the library : on the history of the art library and its collections; [on the occasion of the exhibition Art in the library, on the history of the art library and its collections, which will be shown from 1 July to 21 August 1994 in the new building of the art library ...]. New construction and reopening of the art library Berlin were the occasion for an exhibition on the history of this important collection of art-scientific books, graphic and photographic documents on applied art. The extensive catalogue documents the exhibition, which includes the topics ornamentation, architectural drawing, costume history, artistic photography, poster art, advertising, usage graphics and book art. Numerous illustrations, detailed comments. Like the library itself a treasure trove for artisans, graphic artists, designers of all directions.
content.title_en: Art in the library : on the history of the art library and its collections ; [on the occasion of the exhibition Art in the library, on the history of the art library and its collections, which will be shown from 1 July to 21 August 1994 in the new building of the art library ...]

content.text: Sustainable land management in the North German lowlands. Climate change and the globalization of markets are increasingly affecting our society. Sustainable land management has to take these developments into account. It has to refocus and design its goals and measures in such a way that it can flexibly react to changing conditions. In the joint project "NaLaMa-nT" the conditions were analysed for the North German lowlands in the model regions Diepholz, Uelzen, Fläming and Oder-Spree, model-based developments were estimated, adaptation needs in the agriculture, forestry and water management were identified and transsectoral criteria and indicators of sustainable land management were identified. The results provide decision-making aid to compensate for potential conflicts of interest and to initiate adaptation measures as well as transsectoral sustainability monitoring. They create resilient foundations for spatial planning and decisions in companies, administrations and politics.
content.title_en: Sustainable land management in the North German lowlands

content.text: Film and fashion, fashion in film: [on the occasion of the exhibition "Film and fashion in film" at the German Film Museum, Frankfurt/Main, from 2 March to 1 April 1990]. Regine Engelmeier/Peter W. Engelmeier (ed.): "Film and fashion - fashion in film". Prestel Verlag, Munich 1990. 248 pp., 372 ills., born, 78,- DM
content.title_en: Film and fashion, fashion in film: [on the occasion of the exhibition "Film and fashion in film" at the Deutsches Filmmuseum, Frankfurt/Main, from 2 March to 1 April 1990]

content.text: The German Empire lost its colonies in 1918, and German colonial history was not yet complete. Economically, the colonies had never been given great importance, yet their possessions were linked to wishes, hopes and fantasies that had an impact on the German's self-image and culture. They were incorporated into literature, film, advertising and legislation. The volume shows how colonialism changed the ideas of "races" and "foreigners" between 1884 and 1945, thus changing the self-image of the Germans - as men, women, whites, citizens.
content.title_en: Imaginative : on the cultural history of German colonialism

content.text: Fair price for mobility: Road charges as a tool for managing traffic flows: 2. Greifswalder Forum Umwelt und Verkehr 2006. The Greifswalder Forum "Environment and Transport" aims to develop perspectives for a sustainable, economically sensible, socially acceptable and environmentally sound transport policy. In this second volume the question of the fair price for mobility is asked. The focus is on the environmental economic demand for an internalisation of external costs of road traffic, in particular through road charges. The German system with a satellite-based electronic toll ("Toll Collect") is analysed in terms of history and perspective as well as in the environmental policy instruments and the right to refinancing of public roads. The focus is on central problems associated with road charges, such as questions of data protection, public procurement or public-private partnerships.
content.title_en: Fair price for mobility : Road charging as a tool for managing traffic flows : 2. Greifswalder Forum Environment and Transport 2006

metadata.authors: Schmidt, Szabolcs; Rodi, Michael; Schulz, Gerhard

content.text: Children with mentally ill parents : Clinic and research : with 55 tables. The danger of children with mentally ill parents has been brought into the focus of attention of clinic and research. The book summarizes the current state of knowledge. When children live with parents who suffer from psychosis, depression or alcohol addiction, they are exposed to an increased risk of developing a mental illness themselves. Hospitalians and researchers are involved in early detection and prevention. The view of pathogens on healthy maintenance factors (resilience) is broadened. The book provides an overview of the clinical developments of work with affected families and the current state of research on risk and protection factors, family functionality, quality of life and evaluation.
content.title_en: Children with mentally ill parents : Clinic and research : with 55 tables

content.text: Psychoanalysis, neurobiology, trauma. The interest in a dialogue between psychoanalysis and neuroscientists has increased considerably in both the scientific community and in the media and in the wider public. As Nobel Prize winner Eric Kandel repeatedly emphasizes, both disciplines complement each other in a fruitful way, as they explore the same from different perspectives - namely the human mind and psyche. In order to define the wide field thematically, a topic of high relevance and topicality was chosen, on which the knowledge of both sides is far advanced and convergence points already emerge: the trauma. The research results of modern neurobiology on trauma are extremely fascinating and promising from a psychoanalytic and psychiatric point of view. However, for neuroscientists too, the rich clinical experiences of psychoanalysts with trauma patients are revealing. An integration of knowledge of both disciplines allows an in-depth understanding of the functioning of the human mind in general as well as new insights about extrem traumatizations and their therapy. In this book, experts of both areas present and planned research projects and treat them with impressively-mindedness.
content.title_en: Psychoanalysis, neurobiology, trauma

content.text: Protestant Church Building with Future? : a conference of the Evangelical Academy Hofgeismar in cooperation with the EKD Institute for Church Building and Ecclesial Art in the present at the Philipps University Marburg and the Evangelical Church Building Day. The Evangelical Church in Germany is currently pursuing an ambitious reform program. The external cause is numbers. The existing church structures must be adapted to declining revenue and decreasing members. In an aging society, this is a problem that not only affects the church. Social systems must be adapted to the changed age structure. The infrastructure of the cities and regions must be intelligently shrinked. The Protestant Church tries to understand the challenge as an opportunity for intelligent transformation. It wants to respond to the figures with a quality leap, both in terms of content and in their organizational form. What is the significance of the church buildings in the reform process? This question was the occasion for a conference of the EKD Institute for Church Building in Marburg in cooperation with the Evangelical Academy in Hofgeismar. The conference contributions are now collected in this second volume from the KBI series, publications of the Kirchbau Institute.
content.title_en: Protestant Church Building with Future? : a conference of the Evangelical Academy Hofgeismar in cooperation with the EKD Institute for Church Building and Ecclesial Art in the Present at the Philipps University Marburg and the Evangelical Church Building Day

content.text: Air pollution control and urban climate : 1. Intermunicipal exchange of experiences on environmental protection on 4.5.1984 in Regensburg ; report. The publication documents papers and discussions of the exchange of experiences organized by the Difu. The event is part of the work carried out by the Institute in the field of municipal environmental protection reporting. Within the framework of a research activity supported by the Federal Environment Agency Regensburg is a model for the development of municipal environmental protection reports, since development work is still to be done, especially for medium-sized cities in this area.
content.title_en: Air pollution and urban climate : 1st Inter-Communal exchange of experiences on environmental protection on 4.5.1984 in Regensburg ; report

content.text: Deviance as a risk : new perspectives on the handling of deviating behaviour, delinquency and social abnormality. Deviance is increasingly interpreted as a social risk. The consequences are ambivalent: on the one hand, measures to combat deviance seem to be blurred, as they are preventive and expansive. On the other hand, the rule of law currently limits (still) an increase in risk attributions and risk controls. In addition, risks are usually still associated with specific (edge) groups. In view of this complex situation, the volume provides an interim balance and differentiation: it deals with the current status of attribution, control and treatment of risks in various thematic contexts.
content.title_en: Deviance as a risk: new perspectives on how to deal with deviating behaviour, delicacy and social dissuasiveness

content.text: The Infant - Binding, Neurobiology and Genes : Basics for Prevention, Counselling and Therapy. Internationally renowned researchers and clinicians discuss the latest findings from binding research and neurobiology as well as the influence of genes and relationship experiences on the emotional, psychological, cognitive, social and neurobiological development of foetuses and infants.
content.title_en: The Infant - Binding, Neurobiology and Genes : Basics for Prevention, Advice and Therapy

content.text: Fortifications in Gardens - Gardens in Fortresses. Volume 6 of the series "Fortress Research" gathers contributions from the international symposium "Fortressings in Gardens - Gardens in Fortresses", which was jointly organized in 2011 by the Bavarian Administration of State Palaces, Gardens and Lakes, the Prinz-Albert-Gesellschaft e.V. and the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Fortsforschung e.V. - - The essays illustrate the manifold relationships between garden art and fortification from the 17th to the 20th century. For example, princes practiced in fortress construction with installations such as in Rosenau or Osborne House. Rosenborg Castle in Copenhagen and the Franconian castle Zwernitz still illustrate today how fortification and gardening could form a semantic and architectural unity as a whole-work. - - On English country seats in Hampshire, the phenomenon of combining fortress construction works and royal garden appeared for the first time. In the Baroque period, small architectures in the form of garden festivals were installed in Paris.
content.title_en: Fortresses in Gardens - Gardens in Fortresses

content.text: Monuments made of iron and steel: Documentation on the 18th Cologne conversation on architecture and conservation of monuments in Duisburg, 19 May 2014. The Institute for Building History and Conservation of Monuments at the Faculty of Architecture at the Cologne University of Applied Sciences is pleased that 170 participants have found their way to the 18th Cologne meeting in the building hall of the Eisenwerke Meiderich, the present-day Landschaftspark Duisburg-Nord, and that the Cologne talks are so well received. After the 17th conference could deal with the topic of "monument promotion", the focus of this conference is on the technology of preserving monuments made of iron and steel. The spectrum of the objects in focus is very broad. These include door fittings and gate gratings as well as roof structures or even entire industrial plants. Their preservation represents a very special challenge and it is intended to try to address some aspects of this conference. If one talks about monuments made of iron and steel, then one is talking about a whole group of materials.
content.title_en: Monuments from Iron and Steel : Documentation on the 18th Cologne Talk on Architecture and Monument Conservation in Duisburg, 19 May 2014

content.text: The main principle of spatial planning is "equality living conditions". It can be understood as a spatial dimension of the self-image of the Federal Republic of Germany as a social state. One of the tasks of the welfare state is to ensure so-called general services - and in principle independent of the location of the respective place. The topics are wide-ranging, from the securing of local services and social infrastructure services to the technical infrastructure of the disposal and flood protection. Transport and mobility, but also health care are becoming increasingly important in an ageing society. However, less the challenges that the numerous actors face in the context of the security of general services are to be discussed. Rather, current research results are to be adapted to technical, socio-economic and participatory problems and implemented into practice. This includes the further development of the methodological approach in the collection and evaluation of data bases and their quality standards for supporting political decisions.
content.title_en: General services in spatial development: security, governance, networking, qualities

content.text: The strategy of the preservation of the city renewal seems to be the program for the 21st century, as far as the future is concerned. This assessment is the basic principle of all the contributions of this book: in the last decades of the last century the foundation stone for the urban development of the future has been laid. This time was pioneering and 'New Founder'. The coming decades, if they want to be successful, will further develop and refine the principle of the preservation of the city renewal, but they cannot fundamentally call it into question."--
content.title_en: Urban renewal: a program for the 21st century

content.text: Both in between and in between : Areas of experience of art: [this book goes back to a conference of the Collaborative Research Center 626 "Aesthetic Experience in the Sign of the Disintegration of the Arts" at Freie Universität ...]. Aesthetic spaces of experience can be understood as spaces between the two sides of the real and the imagined space. In the 20th century, the demarcation of the arts has often led to different spatial concepts meeting within the same artistic work. What qualities and potentials result from this is the question which the volume is pursuing. - The contributions discuss spatial experiences between presence and absence, self- and world-relations, between sensual experience and mental reflection, between immersion and distancing. Thus, they are an expression of a complexity that not only characterizes the relationship between the arts and the social life world to which artistic work today refers.
content.title_en: Both in between : Areas of experience of art : [this book goes back to a conference of the Collaborative Research Center 626 "Aesthetic Experience in the Sign of the Disintegration of the Arts" at Freie Universität ...]

content.text: Macht, Ohnmacht, Knecht : Performance practice, interpretation and reception in the music theatre. The terms Power, Power, Chance are particularly suitable to describe the tension in the music theatre. Who has the power over the performance? Can chance reign? This topic was addressed by a conference of the research project on the music theatre in the Collaborative Research Center "Cultures of the Performative" of the Freie Universität Berlin in cooperation with the Akademie der Künste. The publication sheds light on strategies in the music theatre between power exercise and power deprivation. Scientists, opera directors, composers, dramaturgen, musicians reflect on various constellations of power, powerlessness and chance. With essays and discussion contributions by such as Sebastian Baumgarten, Stephanie Bender, Barbara Beyer, Christa Brüttle, Stefan Drees, Björn Gottstein, Boris von Haken, Carl Hegemann, Nele Hertling, Hans-Joachim Hespos, Peter Konwitschny, Sandra Leupold, Gerard Mortier, Michael von zur Mühlen, Georg Nutzdorf, Matthias Sandi Reb, Dr.
content.title_en: Power, powerlessness, chance : performance practice, interpretation and reception in the music theatre

content.text: The city's history was shaped by Fritz Schumacher in Hamburg, Ludwig Hoffmann and Martin Wagner in Berlin, Theodor Fischer in Munich or Ernst May and Martin Elsaesser in Frankfurt: they all played a decisive role in shaping the city's image and have become outstanding figures in the city's history. - - The preconditions for this were not easy, because these cities were in a period of radical changes. The rapid population growth catapulted them into the league of major cities and metropolises. Cities and municipalities, which did not want to be overturned by this development, saw themselves as being responsible not only for accompanying this process but for actively controlling it - by designing a concrete urban vision as a guiding principle. In addition to the infrastructural basic care, urban construction and urban development were again discussed as aesthetic and structurally cultural challenges around 1900. - This volume provides an overview of the tasks and ideas of the city's architects of this time and asked their services for their common use as a means of today's municipal planning.
content.title_en: Designing a big city : Town builders in Germany

content.text: The city development of Stuttgart School. The so-called "Stuttgart School" has been almost exclusively documented, interpreted and criticized as an architectural teaching. The most important exponents of the various epochs such as Bonatz, Schmitthenner and Döcker have shown a remarkable urban development work. The contributions gathered in this book deal with the hitherto widely ignored role that urban development has played in the so-called "Stuttgart School". The core of the reworked lectures are the symposium "Stuttgart Stadtbau-Schule?", which was organized on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the Stadtbau Institute in December 2013 at the University of Stuttgart. The contributions look back on the university urban development teaching in Stuttgart from its beginnings until the last generation change of the city development teachers in the early 1990s. The work and impact of the protagonists are also addressed to the urban development of Stuttgart.
content.title_en: The urban development of the Stuttgart School

content.text: Toxicology - roots and change. The contributions of this volume are mainly based on lectures by two symposia from calendar events, which convey a wide range of relevant topics beyond toxicology as well as a historical and prospective reflection of the subject. The Toxicological Center with its postgraduate study of toxicology at the Institute of Legal Medicine of the Medical Faculty of the University of Leipzig and the Society for Toxicological and Forensic Chemistry organized these symposia.
content.title_en: Toxicology - Roots and Change

metadata.authors: Symposium Toxicologia in foro aus Anlass des 70. Geburtstags von Prof. Dr. Rudhard Klaus Müller; Symposium zur Toxikologiegeschichte

content.text: Art in the Nazi State : Ideology, Aesthetics, Protagonists. "The volume summarizes the results of a series of events that took place in the topography of terror in Berlin from January to June 2015. It was dedicated to the state-sponsored and celebrated art in the "Third Reich". The contributions are concerned with various aspects of the genres of fine art, theatre and dance, film, architecture and music in an overview and in exemplary deepening." -- Preface
content.title_en: Art in the Nazi state : ideology, aesthetics, protagonists

content.text: The belief in creation before the challenge of creationism. An intensive debate is currently being held on world development, evolutionism and the belief in creation. It concerns not only basic theological and scientific questions, but also their treatment in biology and religious education. The current discussion about creation and evolution in the school has clearly shown how little the corresponding questions are actually clarified. The present volume, which dates back to a symposium at the Ev.-theol. Faculty of the University of Tübingen in June 2008, takes up this debate and brings theologians and non-theologists into conversation with each other.
content.title_en: Creature Faith before the Challenge of Creationism

content.text: 20 years of garden heritage maintenance : Location determination : Documentation on the 20th Cologne conversation on architecture and conservation of monuments in Cologne, 11 May 2015. ... On the occasion of our 20th Cologne meeting, we would like to give you a look back not only on the development of the last 20 years of garden heritage maintenance in the Rhineland, but also to shed light on current problems, topics and groups of monuments from the large area of garden heritage maintenance, which are currently particularly challenging and occupied. All those who are active in garden heritage maintenance today - and who contribute their experiences, we would like to offer a plenary session for further training and for professional information exchange, in order to discuss the current location of garden heritage maintenance ... (From the introduction of Ludger J. Sutthoff)
content.title_en: 20 years of garden conservation : Location determination : Documentation on the 20th Cologne Talk on architecture and conservation in Cologne, 11 May 2015

content.text: Between pride and prejudice : Postwar churches in the Rhineland : Documentation on the 4th Rheinisches Tag für Denkmalpflege in Düren, 10 May 2015. ... in no region of Germany were more churches built after the Second World War than in the Rhineland. We can name around 1200 independent churches - without chapels and monasteries, without the many rebuilt or extended church buildings of older eras - ... Overall this genus is also in the view of the monument preservation, which is about the preservation of typical and important historical building phenomena. Because the reconstruction phase in the Federal Republic of Germany, especially in the Rhineland is not conceivable or completely narrated without the modern church construction. Today, the churches once with pride, often also by the parishioners with financial support and in voluntary work, have come into the years and must be renovated ... (From the greeting of Andrea Pufke).
content.title_en: Between pride and prejudice : Postwar churches in the Rhineland : Documentation on the 4th Rheinisches Tag für Denkmalpflege in Düren, 10 May 2015

content.text: Cozyness? : [Lectures of the Symposium Cozyness?, organized by the Weißenhof Institute at the State Academy of Fine Arts Stuttgart in cooperation with the Chair of Building and Design History in November 1995]. Living - quality of living - cultural history. More Keywords: Physiognomy of the hotel room (Hotel) - Disneyland, Disney-Syndrome
content.title_en: Cozyness? : [Lectures of the Symposium Cozyness?, which was organized by the Weißenhof Institute at the Staatliche Akademie der Bildenden Künste Stuttgart in cooperation with the Chair of Building and Design History in November 1995]

content.text: End and completion : eschatological perspectives in the Middle Ages; with a contribution to the history of the Thomas Institute of the University of Cologne on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the foundation of the Institute. Under the general theme "End and completion. Eschatological perspectives in the Middle Ages" the 32nd Cologne Mediaevist Conference took place in September 2000 at the University of Cologne. About 250 medieval researchers from various disciplines and 17 countries participated. The 39 contributions, which contain the present volume, were summarized in 10 topics. Starting with more general essays on the eschatological orientation of the medieval spirit world, the volume deals in a series of contributions the historical-political dimension of eschatological ideas and motives. The art sciences and philosophy are also extensively represented.
content.title_en: End and completion : eschatological perspectives in the Middle Ages; with a contribution to the history of the Thomas Institute of the University of Cologne on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the foundation of the Institute

content.text: Economic policy issues ahead of EU accession: Report on an Ifo-IfW Symposium held in Budapest on 9-10 July 2001. The book contains 11 articles dealing with economic policy issues of the accession of some Eastern European countries to the EU, which were discussed at the ifo/ifW Symposium on 9-10 July 2001 in Budapest. A focus of the lectures and discussions was the question of how Eastern European and especially Hungarian economic policy must change, especially in the area of structural, regional and labour market policies, so that countries can benefit from EU accession. Some lectures also addressed the preparations in East Germany for EU enlargement. In detail, the school and higher education system were addressed.
content.title_en: Economic policy issues ahead of EU accession: Report on an Ifo-IfW Symposium held in Budapest on 9-10 July 2001

content.text: Remote sensing by satellite and aircraft images for spatial planning: Colloquium 2000 of the LAG Bayern in Bayreuth. Remote sensing offers a wide range of area-related data, which represent important sources of information for spatial planning. The technical progress in sensor technology as well as in electronic image processing continues, therefore new answers to questions about the use of satellite data of the latest generation are needed. Example is to be examined how spatial information from remote sensing can be kept in mind and how it can be used in practice. The possibilities of integrating remote sensing data into existing computer systems must be more favored.
content.title_en: Remote sensing by satellite and aircraft images for spatial planning : Colloquium 2000 of the LAG Bayern in Bayreuth

content.text: The conference includes the following articles: Rusch-Feja, Diann/Theers, Ralf: Introduction. International developments and global pressure on educational institutions and their information provision. - HAUPTVORTRÄGE (Diepold, Peter: Towards an Internet-based, integrated information and communication system Education. - Hobohm, Hans-Christoph: Quality and customer satisfaction as management criteria for information institutions). - WORKSHOPS (Rost, Friedrich: Concrete proposals for improving the quality of content development for the "CD EDUCATION". - Bambey, Doris: Reflections on networking and presentation of educational terminology. Discussions and conceptual approaches for CD education. - Rusch-Feja, Diann/Richter, Christian: Structure of information sources by means of metadata on the example of the German educational server. - FORUM. NEW WENTICTIONS IN THE CHILITY OF THE CHILITY.
content.title_en: Steps to improve the quality of education information systems: pragmatic approaches to increasing the acceptance of online and offline services; 5th GIB conference 1 and 2 October 1997 in Halle

content.text: Regional development and transport - Regional colloquium Nordthuringen; Academy for Spatial Research and Planning. The first part of the volume presents the transport principles and objectives of the Regional Planning Plan for the Regional Planning Community Nordthuringen, which is currently under preparation. Subsequently, the status and further progress of the largest transport project in Norththuringen, the BAB 38, is reported. In connection with the presentation of a transport network in Norththuringen, the main argument is for improved and tactured public transport services on road and rail with a uniform tariff. The final contribution deals with spatial alternatives in transport. This is mainly about the need for a new (sustainable) planning understanding.The second part focuses on regional and local initiatives. At the beginning, the concept of the plan region Nordthuringen for transport development and location development is presented in regional terms. Subsequently, representatives of the cities Nordhausen, Mühlhausen and Leinefelde represent how the networking of long-distance and local transport with local passenger transport is addressed and how these concepts are reflected in regional activities.
content.title_en: Regional development and transport - Regional colloquium in Northern Thuringia; Academy for Spatial Research and Planning

content.text: Psychography. The psyche has become the epitome of the peculiarity and identity of man, although it is deeply anchored in neuroanatomical structures, biochemical processes and genetic dispositions and is subject to constant historical change. This volume writes the story of this permanently restless difference as part of a general media history: handwriting and electrical circuits, film and calculators, literature and institutions have significantly shaped the understanding of the psyche. Thus, the psyche does not turn out to be separated from its research, which produces what it describes: it is the powers of media technology, administration and phantasms that awaken the appearance that man is a souled being.
content.title_en: Psychographs

content.text: Telling yourself : Autobiography - Autofiction - Authorship. Note International Hölderlin Bibliography: "The debates on Bayreuth's Germanist Day were so lively and productive that panel leaders decided to publish the contributions (Preface)
content.title_en: Telling Yourself : Autobiography - Autofiction - Authorship

content.text: Data - to whom do they belong, who stores them, who can access them?. The fact that the practice of Big Data has not redeemed the Internet promise that the data is accessible to all has been proven. Rather, few know everything and make it money. This is the basis of the contributions of this academically oriented, science-oriented, yet accessible collection volume. Two contributions deal with the legal nature of the data from a legal point of view and the regulatory need at EU level, e.g. the balancing between a data ownership right vs. extended access right. It goes on with regulatory and antitrust issues, then with big data and economic innovation potential. Two further deals with the final application of Big Data in water management and in genomics. All authors are identified experts in their field of expertise, so that weighing and factually informed judgments are formulated apart from the too highly enthusiastic tones and the warning voices on the one hand.
content.title_en: Data - who owns it, who stores it, who is allowed to access it?

content.text: Case studies of municipal environmental impact assessments: 6. Intermunicipal exchange of experiences on environmental protection on 16 and 17 October 1986 in Berlin; Report (version as at 10 March 1987). The report contains papers and discussions of the 6th Intermunicipal exchange of experiences on environmental protection on the topic "case studies of municipal environmental impact assessments" on 16 and 17 October 1986 in Berlin. This exchange of experiences of municipal practitioners is in connection with the continuation of the "Difu-Arbeitshilfe 6: Gemeinden Umweltberichtungen" (Difu-Arbeitshilfe 6: Kommunaler Umweltberichten) which has been published by the German Institute for Urban Studies and is supported by the German Federal Environment Agency and a model project for consulting the city of Regensburg in the preparation of an environmental protection report. The public tender for the model project "Testphase: Kommunale Umweltberichtungen" (Test Phase: Municipal Environmental Protection Reports) has found a lively response, especially in the middle cities, and made clear that solutions to the urban environment need to be developed in the medium cities.
content.title_en: Case studies of municipal environmental impact assessments: 6. Intermunicipal exchange of experiences on environmental protection in Berlin on 16 and 17 October 1986; Report (version as at 10 March 1987)

content.title_en: Driver assistance systems with mechanical perception

The following are illustrated: Theoretical and experimental soil mechanics -- Vibro-Hypoplasticity -- Foundations under load -- Influence of the surface friction - Moment-Functional compression tests with Berlin sand -- Execution and evaluation of fission tests with cohesive soils -- Possibilities and limits of soil mechanical 1g model tests -- Soil dynamics and dynamic-Bau the Time-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Functional-Fun-Functional-Fun-Fun-Fun-Functional-Functional-Functional-Fun-Fun-Fun-Fun-Fun-Fun-Fun-Functional-Functional-Functional-Fun-Fun-Fun-Fun-Fun-Fun-Fun-Functional-Fun-Fun-Functional-Fun-Fun-Fun-Fun-Fun-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-Fin-
content.title_en: Developments in soil mechanics, soil dynamics and geotechnics : Festschrift zum 60. Geburtstag von Univ.-Professor Dr.-Ing. habil. Stavros A. Savidis

content.text: (Zu-)Hören intziplinär. Do we listen to the ears or with the brain? How do listening and mindfulness hang together? Can singing be practiced by listening? Why did auto mechanics use a stethoscope? What are the differences and similarities between the 'hearing' and 'hearing', two types of audition that are essential for a wide variety of human processes of perception and knowledge? These and other questions are investigated in (zu-)Hören interdisciplinary scientists from a wide range of research and application areas. While the critical interdisciplinary discussion from a medical, psychological, educational, linguistic and scientific point of view illustrates the overlaps of perception and function between the 'hearing' and 'hearing', which in various social and cultural contexts shows the senses and the cognition, the musicological contributions also illustrate that the modes of '(zu-)Hören' are constants of our cultural history, but that in various ways have been expressed in music science and in other ways.
content.title_en: (To)Listen interdisciplinary

content.text: The volume combines the contents and results of two scientific workshops. The first dealt with international tourism and the following selected aspects: motives and trends, sustainability, virtualization and tourism destinations as spaces for adventure. The second workshop focuses on one of the most striking trends in modern tourism, the leisure and adventure worlds. These could in the future gain a far-reaching social influence in many ways (cultural, technological, urban planning, economic, ecological etc.). What experiences have been made in the different countries in this market segment? What cultural, traffic and economic consequences are evident - these are some of the questions that have been addressed from the perspective of theory and practice.
content.title_en: Experience Worlds and Tourism

content.text: Service-oriented architectures: opportunities and challenges in the flexibilization and integration of business processes. Basics -- Service-oriented architectures — concept and methodological challenges -- Systematization of the benefits of SOA -- Integration of service-oriented IT architectures into business architecture -- Modelling and SOA design -- Business process modelling using software services based on EPC -- Business process modelling for service-oriented architectures -- Modeling Service-oriented architectures — A comparison of Axiomatic design with the structured analysis of DeMarco -- Flexibilization of business processes -- Quality assurance of service-oriented architectures -- Model driven derivative of semantic aspects in service-oriented architectures -- Electronic markets in SOA-based business processes -- Application potentials of intelligent agents in service-oriented architectures -- Process controlling and monitoring -- Service-oriented process controlling — Business-based economicity calculations for the use of service-oriented architectures -- Business-based bisbilibility monitoring in service-oriented architecture systems -- Businessestudies focused on the use of service-oriented architecture systems.
content.title_en: Service-oriented architectures: opportunities and challenges in the flexibilisation and integration of business processes

content.text: The seismographic function of the public in the changing world. In the public sphere, the constant problematization of the social order is a matter of attention. Which actors with which topics receive attention in what way depends on social structural and cultural restrictions and opportunities as well as on attention strategies. The sum of restrictions and opportunities to public resonance determines the seismographic function of public communication. However, there is still no more comprehensive theoretical reflection or a broadly supported empirical research on the comprehensive question of how modern society can develop.
content.title_en: Seismographic function of the public in the changing world

content.text: Future Engineering Sciences – Future Germany : Contributions from a 4ING conference and the first joint plenary meeting of the 4ING Faculty Days on 14 and 15 July 2008 at RWTH Aachen University. Despite the outstanding importance of engineering sciences for the German business and science location, there is a lack of engineers. At a conference organized jointly by politics, business and science (14/15 July 2008), a declaration of commitment on the future of engineering sciences was decided. This documenting the book together with all lectures, thus offering argumentative aids, facts, case studies and not least suggestions for the future of engineering education
content.title_en: Future Engineering Sciences – Future Germany : Contributions of a 4ING Conference and the first joint plenary meeting of the 4ING Faculty Days on 14 and 15 July 2008 at RWTH Aachen

content.text: Young people plan and shape lifeworlds: Participation as a response to social change. Against the background of social change and the opening to civil society and civil communities, youth researchers and practitioners discuss projects of participation of young people in Germany, Austria, Switzerland and Brazil. Thomas Ködelpeter is head of the Ecological Academy e.V., Linden and lecturer at the Universities of Klagenfurt/Ö. and Bayreuth. Ulrich Nitschke is head of the Service Centre Municipalities in the One World and the Department of Development-Related Education of the InWent gGmbh in Bonn and is responsible for the UN-Decade Education for Sustainable Development. Against the background of social change and the opening to civil society and civil communities, youth researchers and practitioners discuss projects of participation of young people in Germany, Austria, Switzerland and Brazil. The spectrum ranges from participation in the citizen's household, cross-generational projects to participation in planning processes and community development. The volume gives selected contributions to the International Conference "Young people shape their future with the Commune.
content.title_en: Young people plan and shape lifeworlds : Participation as a response to social change

content.text: Just War - Just Peace : Religions and Peace-Ethical Legitimizations in Current Military Conflicts. The book addresses the essential questions of war and peace from an ethical and religious perspective. The aim is to integrate the currently highly controversial doctrine of just war into the global context and to analyse current developments within and outside of this strongly influenced doctrine of Christianity. The current theoretical approaches of just war, counterconcepts such as the concept of just peace supported and co-formed by the two major churches in Germany, as well as concepts about war and peace in other world religions, are discussed. Especially with the world political changes after 1989/90, a systematic reflection of the criteria under which military interventions could be allowed, has become urgent again, not only in the Western European Christian context, but also especially in the global, multicultural and multireligious context.
content.title_en: Just War - Just Peace : Religions and Peace Ethical Legitimizations in Current Military Conflicts

content.text: Innovation by communication: Communication as an innovation factor for organizations. This volume documents the contributions of an interdisciplinary conference of the same name at the Technical University of Kaiserslautern. The focus of the conference was on the potentials of innovation in cultural and non-profit organizations that can be generated by strategic corporate communication. Starting from the need for an interdisciplinary management approach as well as specific skills of the management level and employees, authors from the fields of culture, media and communication theory, psychology, economics, law, administration and education are concerned with the topic. The approaches presented here raise awareness of the need for a more comprehensive and thus contemporary view and contribute to a new orientation. Professor Dr. Thomas Heinze was the managing director of the Institute of Cultural Management at the FernUniversität Hagen and is now Professore Ordinario at the Freie Universität Bolzano. Verena Lewinski-Reuter is a lawyer and cultural manager. She is currently working as a specialist and scientific lecturer, author and lecturer. Kerstin Steimle is a research assistant in the "Management of Kultur- und Non-Profit-Claut-C.
content.title_en: Innovation through communication: Communication as an innovation factor for organisations

content.text: Lifestyles in the cities : Concepts and methods. The book aims to clarify and concreteise the term "life styles". Cities, especially big cities, are places where lifestyleization is now consciously used to position and to define social and spatial boundaries.
content.title_en: Lifestyles in the cities : Concepts and methods

content.text: The health sector has developed into an important field of economic policy debate within a few years. Two development lines are interlocking. On the one hand, the health sector as a whole is becoming increasingly a health economy, where growth and development processes require an accompanying competition order. On the other hand, the internal core of the health sector, the solidarity-funded system of statutory health insurance, is subject to constant pressure for reform.The system of statutory health insurance is subject to the health policy debate despite greater opening clauses in favour of selective contractual options with established doctors and health insurance companies in most cases not to competition law, but to social law or competition law, as is the case with social courts. The question of how competition rules can be developed on the one hand and the guarantee of social security on the other hand dominates the health policy debate. In this context, the question of the analogy of the general competition law, whether it is in the area of merger control, is clearly addressed in the context of the social insurance sector.
content.title_en: Competition in health

content.text: Image processing for medicine 2011 : Algorithms - Systems - Applications Proceedings of the workshop from 20 - 22 March 2011 in Lübeck. In recent years the workshop "Image processing for medicine" has established itself through successful events. The aim is again in 2011 the presentation of current research results and the deepening of the discussions between scientists, industry and users. The contributions of this volume - some of them in English - cover all areas of medical image processing, in particular molecular imaging, visualization and animation, patient individual simulation and planning, computer assisted diagnosis, biomechanical modelling, image processing in telemedicine, image-supported robots, surgical simulators and many more.
content.title_en: Image processing for medicine 2011 : Algorithms - Systems - Applications Proceedings of the workshop from 20 - 22 March 2011 in Lübeck

content.text: The book documents a travelling exhibition that was shown in the context of the Year of Mathematics. It shows how Jewish mathematicians in all areas of mathematical culture played an increasing role in the German Empire and in the Weimar Republic. First, there was probably no field of academic culture of mathematics in which Jewish mathematicians were not active. From research and teaching on participation in the publishing world and in organizations such as the German mathematicians' cleansing up to the public discourse on mathematics, they were able to speak with their non-Jewish colleagues. As with these and with them they shaped the German-speaking culture of their particular subject matter. And this time-group was also diverse and varied.
content.title_en: Jewish mathematicians in German-speaking academic culture

content.text: Future developments in mobility: Business and technical aspects. Research on mobility has a very dynamic development and a broad thematic spectrum. The conference volume presents the contributions of the 3rd Science Forum Mobility, which took place at the University of Duisburg-Essen in July 2011.
content.title_en: Future developments in mobility: business and technical aspects

In the first place, conference reports of conferences of the Gesellschaft für Informatik are published, which are regularly, often in cooperation with other scientific societies, organized by the specialized committees of the Gesellschaft für Informatik. The selection of lectures is generally made by international program committees. The conference language is German.
content.title_en: Image processing for medicine 2012 : Algorithms - Systems - Applications. Proceedings of the workshop from 18 to 20 March 2012 in Berlin

content.text: Independent state institutions in democracy. In all differentiated societies, the organization and the fulfilment of collective tasks are to be accomplished. The delegation to specialized organizations represents an institutional response to the challenges associated with it. Known examples are central banks and competition authorities. Independent organizations are powerful actors who not only use knowledge and specialization advantages but also use their power against the interests of the members of society or prefer individual groups. In democratic systems, not only the questions of the concrete delimitation of tasks and the design of the institutions, but also those according to their legitimacy are posed. The suitability of independent institutions, their effectiveness and the examination of the necessity of accompanying rules form the content of this conference volume. This topic is examined theoretically, the discussion of conceptual questions and the information on empirical results. The contributions gain a special topicality through the developments around the European Central Bank.
content.title_en: Independent State Institutions in Democracy

content.text: Inter-District Virtuality: Virtuality in Interdisciplinary Discourse. How do virtual environments influence social coexistence and what is a "virtual production intelligence? What awareness functions do virtual enterprises use to recreate reality in virtual worlds? Do virtual companies have their own organizational cultures? How can virtuality be interpreted constructively? Virtuality has been determining our private life for years through the digital revolution, but also plays an important role in various scientific disciplines. It not only offers new possibilities and perspectives, but also gives rise to the consequences for science, business and society. This volume presents the results of an interdisciplinary conference on the topic of virtuality at RWTH Aachen University. The content · Virtual Reality · Virtualization (of social life) · Virtual Tools and Applications · Interdisciplinarity The target groups · Lecturers and Students of the Engineering, Nature, Humanities and Society Sciences as well as Medicine The editors Prof. Dr. rer. nat. Sabina Jeschke is Director of the Institute Association IMA/ZLW & IfU and Prodecanin of the Faculty of Mechanical Engineering and Humanities at RWTH Aachen University Aachen University Aachen.
content.title_en: Exploring Virtuality : Virtuality in Interdisciplinary Discourse

content.text: The fact that the perspective on the history of political ideas depends on the choice of an approach or method is not new in the political science sub-area of political theory. The current view of the classical approaches – such as the Cambridge School, the history of concepts or the analysis of discourse – was formulated in the 1960s and in the following decades. In this volume, the project is pursued with a view to a current assessment of the plurality of these approaches, their further theoretical and conceptual expansion and recent developments according to the classical approaches. An innovative comparative perspective is taken, in which the view of researching historians of ideas is taken with the question of the consequences of the approach chosen, for example, for the selection of sources, the questions to be asked and the methods of operation of the research of ideas. The question of the choice of an approach to the research of ideas is examined in this work as being a relevant and to the other controversial subject of contemporary political theory.
content.title_en: Approaches and Methods for Researching Political Thinking

content.text: Radical innovations in mobility: Technical and business aspects. Automotive Engineering -- Automotive Management -- Mobility Strategies -- Mobility Technologies -- Radical innovations. Radical innovations, especially in the transition to electromobility, pose major challenges for science and industry. There is a need for consistent and coordinated efforts at the interfaces of business and engineering research to implement them. In June 2013 in Duisburg, the discussion was held on the innovations needed, how they can be controlled and which mobility strategies are expected. The conference volume presents the contributions of the 5th Science Forum Mobility at the University of Duisburg-Essen. The content · Automotive Engineering and Management · Mobility Strategies and Technologies The target groups · Lecturers and students of the economics and engineering sciences with the focus on mobility, especially automotive management and automotive technology · Executives in companies and business consultants The editorial group is published by Prof. Dr. Heike Proff with the participation of Prof. Dr. Angelika Heinzel, Prof. Dr.-Ing. Holger Hirsch, Prof. Dr. Thomas Kaiser, Prof. Dr. Alexander Schmidt, Prof. Dr. Schönter Dr. Schulz Prof. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr.
content.title_en: Radical innovations in mobility : technical and business aspects

content.text: Protecting the enemy? : To a current controversy in the ethics of armed conflict. Military violence endangers people: opponents, civilians, own soldiers. Different military measures, however, endanger in different ways: some in a special way the opponents, some the own soldiers and some especially the civilians. Can such risks be weighed against each other? Who should bear the risks? The volume gathers various contributions mainly English-speaking authors, which deal with this problem, which is one of the most pressing in the military ethics of the present. It thus also introduces into the discussion about the ethics of the armed conflict in the Anglo-American area. With contributions by:Jeff McMahan, David Luban, David Rodin, Jeremy Waldron, Uwe Steinhoff, Robert G. Kennedy and Mary-Ellen O-Connell
content.title_en: Protecting the Opponent? : To a current controversy in the ethics of armed conflict

content.text: Main description: This volume contains papers held at the 2003 Annual Meeting of the Committee for Developing Countries of the Association for Social Policy in Hamburg. -- The focus is on the assessment of development cooperation (EC). A first focus is on the procedures used in the practice of the EC to evaluate projects. The methodology of two institutions active in the German EC is presented and a critical assessment is carried out regarding the appropriate consideration of various success criteria such as sustainability. -- A second focus is on the political-economic analysis of project evaluations, in which interdependence between different stakeholders with their own objectives is modelled, the results are empirically reviewed and suggestions for increasing independence and quality of evaluation are derived. -- The third focus, finally, is the provision of certain community-based services in developing countries, often supported by the EC, which are provided by certain Community-based services. Specifically, the studies cover systems of participatory resource management in irrigation projects in Ghana and community-based rural health insurance in Senegal. - The reading of the volume makes it extremely repetitive in terms of economic cooperation, the evaluation of the development of certain institutions and the evaluation of development.
content.title_en: The evaluation of development cooperation

content.text: MINT wins students: success factors of school projects in MINT. The career choice behaviour of school students in MINT (mathematics, computer science, natural sciences and technology) is a social issue. Against this background, numerous projects have been created that aim to inspire and long-term attract school students for MINT careers.The contributions of the volume discuss the reasons for the underrepresentation of girls and women in MINT and give concrete recommendations on which formats, advertising strategies and projects are successful in addressing school students.The content causes and consequences of career orientation projects.- Study and career choice behaviour of young women.- Increase the number of students in MINT courses.- MINT image.- Work with Role Models.- Raising awareness of teachers.- Voices from ministries and university management The target groups Teaching staff and students in the field of gender and diversity.- Practitioners from school projects in MINT from universities, companies, associations and public institutions.- Raising awareness of teachers.- Voices from ministries and university management.
content.title_en: MINT wins students : success factors of school projects in MINT

content.text: Company 4.0: Structural change in labour law through digitalization. The work addresses important aspects of labour law in a digital enterprise 4.0, including the new data protection law, and is therefore of vital importance both for scientific discourse and for the legal user in practice. Company 4.0 is an important part of the fourth industrial revolution that generates a new work 4.0 that is more connected, digital and flexible. The conference contributions cover, among others, the concept of employees and business, the design of personnel measures with the participation of the works council and the data protection law in the employment relationship after the entry into force of GDPR and BDSG 2018. Prof. Dr. Martina Benecke is the holder of the Chair of Civil Law, Trade, Labour and Economic Law at the University of Augsburg. Her research focuses on the entire labour law, in particular anti-discrimination law and labour law 4.0. With contributions by Mrs. Prof. Dr. Benecke on the topic "Current developments in labour law in the workplace 4.0 ,Prof. Dr. Martin Maties on the topic "The employee concept in the working world 4.0 ,Mr. Dr. Jens Günther on the topic "Digitalization of the working world – Changes in the workforce"Mr. Prof.
content.title_en: Company 4.0 : Structural change in labour law through digitalization

content.text: The new public: How bots, citizens and big data change journalism. Public change and digital revolution -- Television: Mobile and interactive -- Answers to fake news and filter bubbles -- How to continue with quality journalism?. What are the next stages of development in journalism and media? The main trends are outlined in this collection. It provides analyses on trends such as big data and digitalization, proposals and models for mobile journalism, viewer interaction and participatoryness. On the topic of fake news, he gives advice on verification and presents practical solutions. Finally, he provides practical examples and an outlook on quality assurance in journalism. The content Public change and digital revolution.- Television: mobile and interactive.- Answers to fake news and filter bubbles.- How to continue with quality journalism? The target groups Practitioners in journalism and media Students and prospective journalists Teaching at universities and in journalism The editor Dr. Gabriele Hooffacker is Professor for media-adäquate Content at the HTWKich University of Media.
content.title_en: The new public: How bots, citizens and big data change journalism

content.text: In the context of the International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, the International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, The International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, The International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, The International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, The International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, The International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, The International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, The International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, The International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, The International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, The International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, The International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, The International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, The International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, The International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, The International Conference on Discipline and Discipline, The International Conference on Discipline and Discipline.

content.text: The Department of Political Theory and the Department of Political Theory and the Department of Political Theory and the Department of Political Theory and the Department of Political Theory and the Department of Political Theory and the Department of Political Theory and the Department of Political Theory and the Department of Political Theory and the Department of Political Theory and the Department of Political Theory. The research is focused on the question of how to initiate and deepen the scientific exchange of researchers active in this field, and how to gather new ideas for an interdisciplinary and transdisciplinary discussion. The research focuses on a set of questions from different perspectives: What does the digital binary system and digitality do with the state, with statehoods, with government ways and forms of government? How do digital technologies and government technologies interact and converge? How can this phenomenon be conceptualized from political theory and sociology as well as from a politically oriented media (culture) science?
content.title_en: State, Internet and Digital Governmentality

content.text: Knowledge in Action: New Forms of Communication in the Knowledge Society. With the term of the Knowledge Society, time diagnoses emphasize the growing importance of (scientific) knowledge for all areas of social action. A still little researched consequence of this development is the need to communicate knowledge and translate for other fields of action. The volume examines the question of how different actors in the knowledge society manage and shape these communication requirements. In the first part, contributions are made that reconstruct and theoretically locate specific new forms and paradigms of knowledge communication. Here, the focus is on relevant examples from the spectrum of new forms of communication, such as science comics and novels. In the second part, mediated forms of communication are the focus, for example, on the exchange of knowledge on web-based question and answer platforms or YouTube. Finally, the communication and translation work of actors who mediate between different fields of knowledge and action is the focus.
content.title_en: Knowledge in Action : New forms of communication in the knowledge society

content.text: Facebook, Google & Co: Opportunities and risks. The Internet is changing our perception of privacy and public sphere. It opens up new spaces of social geographical and temporally delimited communication. This combines great social and individual opportunities, but also dangers. The challenges range from the emergence of media literacy in school (Edgar Wagner) to the handling of fan-pages of the public sector (Cornelia Weis) and changes in economic value-added models (Erik S. Meyers) to the processing of the digital legacy of a fulfilled online life (Mario Martini). The band investigates this wide range of questions. It is the result of the "1st Speyer Forum on the digital world of life" which took place in Speyer in April 2012. In addition to the view of fundamental questions of the relationship between private and public sphere (Heinrich Wolff and Harald Zehe) and the work of the data protection officer (Tilo Weichert) in applying the applicable law, the band also gives special attention to the perspective of future European privacy law (Rogall-Grothe) in this regard.
content.title_en: Facebook, Google & Co : Opportunities and Risks

content.text: The protection of the efficient agricultural enterprise. Are the special regulations in favour of agriculture still legal and practical? Agricultural law is characterized by the basic principle of maintaining the efficient farm. To this end, agricultural law regularly differs from the general legal system. Examples are found in the inheritance, environmental and family law. According to the Federal Constitutional Court, the deviations are justified by the public interest in the preservation of efficient farms in peasant families. The conference volume examines the scope and the limit of this principle. At the same time, concrete questions are addressed from the practical side. With contributions by Prof. Dr. Manfred Köhne (University of Göttingen), Prof. Dr. Albrecht Mährlein (FH Kiel), Fritjof Hans Mevert, Dr. Uwe Richter (Hessisches Landesamt für Bodenmanagement und Geoinformation), Andreas Peter (Bezirksregierung Arnsberg), Dr. Christian Busse (BMELV)
content.title_en: Protection of the efficient agricultural holding

content.text: Smart Service Engineering: Concepts and application scenarios for digital transformation. This collection presents innovative methods, concepts and tools for transforming classic services to so-called "Smart Services". Digitalisation, individualization and customer centricity create flexible and forward-looking models that are key to successful service innovations across the industry. Numerous examples illustrate the performance and practical feasibility of smart services as an essential component of new business models. The content Digital (R)evolution of classical services Service Engineering: Methods and tools Smart services for digital work Mobility Servitization: Potentials of new business models The target groups Dozierdeen and students of business administration, engineering and business informatics Decision makers from companies with a focus on service management The editor Univ.-Prof. Dr. Oliver Thomas holds the Chair of Information Management and Business Informatics at the University of Osnabrück. Univ.-Prof. Markus Nuettgens is the owner of the Chair of Business Informatics and Information Management at the University of Hamburg. Jun-Informatik.
content.title_en: Smart Service Engineering : Concepts and application scenarios for digital transformation

content.text: The law of the law is to promote and protect innovation. The challenge of the ongoing change is to continuously develop and promote an innovation-friendly climate and future technologies. On the other hand, technical innovations and innovative business models can also lead to threats to legitimate interests. The conference volume also has to respond to this issue if it wants to manage innovations sustainably. The conference volume documents the diverse presentations of the 4th conference GRUR Junge Wissenschaft – Colloquium on Industrial Legal Protection, Copyright and Media Law, in which young scientists from a wide range of perspectives deal with questions relating to the conference topic "Law as an infrastructure for innovation". With contributions by Dr. Lukas Abegg, LL.M.; Dr. Amit Datta; Dr. Stefan Holzweber; MMag. Philipp Homar; Johannes Marosi; Stefan Papastefanou; Dr. Lars Rühlke; Thomas Sagetter; Dr. Kirsta Schmidt; Dr. Christopha Schordner; Dr. Christopha Schordner; Dr. Christopha Schordner; Dr.
content.title_en: Legal as an infrastructure for innovation : Munich 2018

content.text: Fairplay in Sports: Contributions to the debate on values and ethical potentials. The articles of this conference group are dedicated to the debate on values in sports in theory and practice. The contributors deal with fundamental values and ideals of sports, their importance for society and the economy, but also their decay. For example, sport can promote the integration and inclusion of people. However, there is also a strong competition and commercial interests, which result in current scandals about corruption, fraud and doping. At the third Udo-Steinberg symposium these opposing tendencies of sports as well as possible developments by representatives of various disciplines, including jurists, sports scientists and psychologists as well as practitioners were discussed.The content of doping in sports refugee initiatives in sports integration and participation by sports and morals sports communication The target groups of lecturers and students of sports sciences, sociology, psychology, communication and business and law representatives representatives of sports associations and associations, foundations, refugee initiatives, ethics associations and all sports interested persons The editors André Schneider is the holder of the chairpersonship in Sports Management, and the chairperson of Sports Management.
content.title_en: Fairplay in sport : Contributions to the debate on values and ethical potentials

content.text: Action under risk: approaches to design between risk and precaution. The institutionally arranged relationship between security and risk is in crisis in view of the massive changes in internal, social and external security. Modern societies face the question of how and in which forms this relationship can be redefined and re-arranged in social, legal and political ways.The focus of this volume is on the evaluation of political, social and technical ways of dealing with risk and on the analysis of the social imaginations that are inevitably linked to it.
content.title_en: Risk-taking: Design approaches between risk and prevention

content.text: Democracy tomorrow : reflections from science and politics. For the post-war generations in Germany, democracy is a matter of course. But what room for manoeuvre does a prudent democratic balance have in times of globalized markets, rating agencies and expert commissions? Do we need new forms of democratic participation and decision-making? With Hauke Brunkhorst, Horst Dreier, Burkhard Hirsch, Julian Nida-Rümelin and Volker Wulf/Marén Schork, renowned authors from science and politics discuss weaknesses in our democracy and point ways to overcome them.
content.title_en: Democracy tomorrow : reflections from science and politics

content.text: Knowledge - Power - Opinion : Democracy and Digitization : the 20th Hannah Arendt Days 2017. For Hannah Arendt, the communicative power was one of the most important elements of politics. Long before the Internet, she was convinced of the special importance of networking for political action. But digitalisation is actually delivering her democratic promise to give everyone equal access to information and a voice? With reference to the political philosopher Arendt, the authors of the volume discuss what opportunities this almost predestined Internet, locally and globally, promises to offer for a spatial and cross-border discourse and what challenges for political actors from the Commune to the Bundestag pose. In what intensity and scope does the network – not least thanks to artificial intelligence – generate common publics and counter-publics in which individuals as indeed free and equal communicate with each other? To what extent do social media support these desirable spaces of equality and freedom of persons and in which ways political power asymmetries and social exclusions arise in them, too? Or is the idea of digital participation and participation against the background of the umbrella of algorithms rather a reciproachable reciprocity in terms of a new era of politics.
content.title_en: Knowledge - Power - Opinion : Democracy and Digitalization : the 20th Hannah Arendt Days 2017

content.text: The lead years: State and terrorism in the Federal Republic of Germany and Italy 1969-1982. Two states, a problem. Nowhere in Europe did left-wing extremists commit so many bloody attacks during the 1970s as in Italy and the Federal Republic of Germany. South of the Alps, neofascist attacks aggravated the situation. The two young democracies were forced to respond to this militant challenge. The interaction of terrorism, state and society shaped a decade that was perceived as "leaning" in two respects: because of the oppressive atmosphere under the primacy of internal security and because of the return of armed violence in the political conflict. How was this crisis managed? Did the democratic state and liberal society take on damage? A comparative view of both countries promises new answers.
content.title_en: The Lead Years : State and Terrorism in the Federal Republic of Germany and Italy 1969-1982

content.text: Reforming the health system — or: In which health system do we want to live? : A dispute. Within the framework of the social contexts of the statutory health insurance system, monetary problems exert a great pressure on the health system in its internal order and structure, its areas of care, functioning and occupational groups. Therefore, the internal structures of the health system with its manifold institutions, but also the effectiveness, efficiency and quality of the services provided, are in the focus of the critical consideration.
content.title_en: Reforming the health system — or: In which health system do we want to live? : Dispute

content.text: System theories in comparison : What do system theories do for social work? An attempt at dialogue. The authors develop various system theoretical-paradigmatic approaches to a theory of social work. Using central categories to theoretical prerequisites and action theory implications, a comparative analysis is developed under the question of what system theories can do for social work.
content.title_en: System theories in comparison : What do system theories do for social work? Attempts to dialogue

content.text: Communication and Technology: Selected new approaches in the context of an interdisciplinary approach. Further developments of communication technologies and their effects on communication behaviour -- Communication in the field of tension between engineering and economics -- Technical solutions for the optimization of communication (e.g. apps) -- Reactances and limits in human-machine communication. . The aim of the volume is to present current interdisciplinary approaches of research at the interface of communication and technology and to provide insights from very different perspectives: Technical change or innovation as the subject of communication; Communication to reduce reactances in complex technologies; Expectation management; Tasks and role of employees in communication of technology; Personal communication of sellers of technical services (B2C) or external services / Sales (B2B); Optimization of user instructions; Communication for better customer integration in technical services; Regional and sector specific features of communication of technology. The content of further developments of communication technologies and their effects on communication behaviour Communication in the field of engineering and business sciences Technical solutions for optimization of communication (e.g. apps) Reacts and Communication of the human-machine and communication of the legal community.

content.text: The volume focuses on social transformation processes that can be observed in the context of flight migration. All contributions combine the perspective on migration as a normal state of social reality. The analysis of political structures, the historiographical considerations of migrant living worlds as well as the ethnographic detailed research on everyday phenomena form a broad spectrum of theoretical-methodological approaches. As a transdisciplinary review, the volume offers insights into current research fields and research projects on escape migration. The content With contributions by Christof Roos, Onur Yıldırım, Tatjana Louis, Matthias Thaden, Birgit Glorius, Anne-Christin Schondelmayer, Robinson Dörfel, Christine Egger, Carolin Leutloff-Gradits, Sabine Hoffmann, Simon Goebel, Thomas Fischer, Friedrich Kießling and Angela Drivers. The target groups Dozierde und Studieren der Geschichts-, Sozial- und Kulturwissenschaften. Die Hebeibenden Dr. Simon Goebel, Einführgruppe „FlturkUitst, Thomas Goebel, Thomas Fischer-Küttt. Profisch.
content.title_en: EscapeMigration and social transformation processes : Transdisciplinary perspectives

content.text: The Limits of Democracy: Contemporary Diagnoses of Politics and Law. This volume depicts the current debate and research on democracy quality. Because democratic governance is not currently under any good star. Democracies are under economic pressure, tend to be authoritarian solutions - from state of emergency to torture - and are also confronted with the management of migration movements of unimagined proportions. How will democracy emerge from this crisis? How quickly or slowly does it change? And when is a point reached in the context of the upcoming changes that will no longer be spoken of of democracy? The content of the permanence of the state of emergency?.- Constitutional interpretation in the field of real-political effectiveness thinking and constitutional order.- How the war against terror changes a political system.- Combating terrorism and the European human rights convention.- The immunization of crisis processing in the eurozone.- The Securing of Democracy with the Means of Law.- Shifting of Borders.- Political Protests in the Limits of Democracy around the Limits of Democracy. The Targets and Students of the Politics of the University of Aachen.
content.title_en: The Limits of Democracy : Contemporary Diagnoses between Politics and Law

content.text: Driver assistance systems 2017 : From assistance to automated driving - 3rd International ATZ Conference on Automated Driving. The main topics of the conference group at the ATZlive event on driver assistance systems 2017 are, among other things, new developments for automated driving. In connection with the electrification and networking of the vehicles new electric/electronic architectures and flexible software platforms are created. Other topics are e.g. new driver assistance systems for premium passenger cars, braking and evasive assistants for trucks and high-resolution digital road maps. The content markets and users.- development topics.- research and practice.- series application.- simulation and test.- driving dynamics.- software, IT and security. The target groups vehicle and engine engineers as well as students who are looking for current expertise in the field of their work - professors and lecturers at universities and universities with a focus on automotive and engine technology - expert, researcher and development engineers in the automotive and supply industry The organizer ATZlive is responsible for top quality, high level in technical information and is part of the show-ediation- technology- and technology- application of the German market.
content.title_en: Driver assistance systems 2017 : From assistance to automated driving - 3rd International ATZ Conference Automated driving

content.text: The Department of Education and Education at the University of Applied Sciences is the Department of Education at the University of Applied Sciences. The Department of Education at the University of Applied Sciences is the Department of Education at the University of Applied Sciences. The Department of Education at the University of Applied Sciences is the Department of Education at the University of Applied Sciences.
