In addition to the school's educational and educational perspectives, the Department of Education also considers general educational, social and adult education. The common feature of the contributions is the question of how and to what extent the case can make pedagogical action detached from everyday relations, routines and patterns of conduct.

content.text: Monument and Energy 2018 : Energy efficiency, sustainability and user comfort. This book on the event of the same name contains contributions from renowned authors from science and practice. It serves to transfer knowledge of practical project examples, current research findings and the way in which newly developed materials are applied to the actors in the construction sector. It aims to show which possibilities are available to reduce energy demand and improve user comfort by increasing energy efficiency on listed buildings. The content Buildings and Projects - Planning in detail - Material and technology - Research and development The target groups Architects, engineers, monument keepers and representatives of the public service and companies working in the field of monument maintenance and renovation. The editor Prof. Bernhard Weller is Director of the Institute of Construction at Dresden Technical University. Dr.-Ing. Sebastian Horn is head of the research group "Glasbau - Energy efficiency and sustainability" at the Institute for Construction of Dresden Technical University.

content.text: The Hamburg Automotive Engineering Conference 2016: 14th ATZ Conference. Mobility, safety, comfort and environment are the technical main objectives of the product development in automotive engineering. The reduction of fuel consumption and the reduction of CO2 emissions pose new challenges for development and manufacturing engineers. Lightweight construction, innovative materials and alternative manufacturing processes are the focus of this year's 14th Body Building Days. The aim of this conference is to bring together the participants in the development and production of the body to exchange experiences. The content of research and development components.- Body development.- Vehicle concepts.- Development methods. The target groups of vehicle and engine engineers as well as students who are current expertise in the field of their work are looking for professors and lecturers at universities and universities with a focus on automotive and engine technology. The company ATZlive is the organizer of the Hamburg Automotive Engineering School. The Hamburg Automotive Engineering School is the joint research department of the Hamburg Automotive Engineering School.

content.text: The 8th GWB Novelling Act (GWB) is a new amendment to German antitrust law. The amendments concern, among other things,•the re-regulation of merger control by introducing the SIEC test, etc.•the reform of the anti-trust supervision•changes in antitrust fines law and•a tightening of the consequences of antitrust infringements.The amendments also include sector-specific regulations for the press, water and energy supply and the up to the most recently controversial inclusion of health insurance companies in the field of competition law.The volume documents the new regulations that came into force on 30 June 2013, and presents problems for future antitrust practice and develops its own solution proposals. The authors are designated experts in the field of competition law as university teachers, lawyers and executive employees of the Federal Cartel Office, noting Florian Kulmann Heywith contributions from: Andreas Bardong
content.title_en: German antitrust law under the 8th GWB-Novelle

content.text: The algorithmic cultures: about the computational construction of reality. High frequency trading, Google-Ranking, filter bubbles with simplicity. The volume gathers articles that deal with the historical emergence and the ubiquitous spread of algorithms in various areas of social life. They take into account the interrelationships of algorithmic and non-algorithmic actors and their meanings for our everyday life and our social relationships and explore the mechanisms by which algorithms - even products of a specific world access - frame reality, while at the same time they organize the way people think about society. The contributions include case studies on social media, advertising and evaluation, but also on mobile security infrastructures such as e.g. Drohnen. High frequency trading, Google ranking, filter bubble - just three topical examples of the power of algorithmms.
content.title_en: Algorithm cultures : about the computational construction of reality

The authors discuss the resulting implications and action requirements for climate adaptation and climate protection in tourism. The global warming presents the industry with new challenges in the coming decades. Hardly any other industry is dependent on climate conditions such as tourism. This can also result in risks. content.text: Digital change does not follow linear patterns – it is dynamic, complex and disruptive. Recognizing emerging IT trends and supporting them normatively is one of the most exciting challenges for law and administration. More than ever, the success of innovative regulatory strategies depends on synchronizing them with the technical foundations of digitalization. The "Speyer Forum on the digital world" sees itself as an idea workshop and innovation laboratory for the public sector. The conference volume summarizes the contributions of the fifth symposium from 2016: it contains contributions from the fields of European data protection law, big data, e-government, smart city, blockchain and digital media landscape. Exciting individual topics on the "Perspects of the digital world" bundles the book into a coloured kaleidoscope of the digital future.
content.title_en: Perspectives of the digital world

content.text: Happiness - Virtue - Time : Aristotle about the time structure of good life. When can we say that we are happy? In Aristotle's ethics this is an important question. Is happy who has a virtuous soul constitution or does it need external goods? Is it enough for a short time or does it require a whole virtuous life to achieve the highest good of eudaimonia? This volume assumes that the aristotelian theory of good life can only be understood appropriately by taking into account time. So what does the time structure of a successful life look like? What are Aristotle's answers to dealing with time?
content.title_en: Happiness - Virtue - Time : Aristotle on the Time Structure of Good Life

content.text: The newspaper between print and digitalisation. The newspaper is the oldest public (mass) medium and remains young until today. As its history shows, it has been able to meet all the challenges so far - whether in the form of profound political and economic changes, be it in the form of competition from new media. In this respect, it is not surprising that the newspaper is also aggressively responding to the recent challenge posed by digital electronic media. In no phase of newspaper history was the dynamics of change as high as can be observed for some years. The functional change to which the newspaper is subjected has various causes: the competition with the media radio and television for an audience whose media use is increasingly characterized by entertainment orientation; the change of reception expectations towards a stronger visualization; and not least the emergence of a parallel medium, the electronic newspaper. In view of this situation, the criticism of how it is currently being expressed in new forms of presentation of the print media is being expressed in the words "designer journalism" or "lego journalism", at least prematurely. It passes on a critical examination of the new presentation and form of the newspaper's image in terms of the electronic expression.
content.title_en: The newspaper between print and digitalisation

content.text: The permanent interaction between society and sociology is to be reorganized. In the light of the current cultural and technological upheavals and political transformations, the traditional arrangements of social integration and consensus formation appear to be at the end of the 20th century. This not only requires the development of contemporary theoretical and analytical instruments, but also outlines the space of reflection within which sociology develops at the beginning of the new century. Along the themes of theory and society, social inequality in market society and facets of civil society, the volume outlines the contours of contemporary sociology and represents its analytical and diagnostic ability.
content.title_en: Social images in transition : Sociological perspectives in Germany

content.text: Heterogeneity, integration and differentiation in primary education. Heterogeneity of pupils in primary education has become a central category of childhood research, primary research and primary education. The volume introduces the importance of child heterogeneity for primary education. It documents research results on the diversity of individuals and their overlapping affiliations to various groups in a complex manner. Studies on numerous pedagogical approaches that respond to heterogeneity are presented. This includes joint learning of children with and without disabilities, intercultural learning, working with heterogeneous learning groups in initial education, among others, investigations on the core curriculum, asking for the importance of binding learning content. In addition, methods of childhood and teaching research as well as theoretical approaches are put to the discussion.
content.title_en: Heterogeneity, integration and differentiation in primary education

content.text: Space - Time - Mediation : Interdisciplinary studies on new communication technologies. Experiences with the new communication technologies have fundamentally irritated theoretical assumptions about space and time. The Internet becomes the explicit focus of the now advanced space and time theories. This book documents which perspectives open up on electronic networks and communication technologies when action or system theory concepts of space or time are used, i.e. when space and time are considered as structural-action elements or as communicative products
content.title_en: Space - Time - Mediation : Interdisciplinary studies on new communication technologies

content.text: Citizen's Conference: Dispute Genetics : A model project of citizen participation in bioethical discourse. The book provides an overview of the implementation of the Danish model of the Consensus Conference in Germany using the example of genetics diagnostics and sheds light on the practical, scientific and social aspects of citizen participation in the bioethics debate. In autumn 2001, the German Hygiene Museum organized the first nationwide citizen conference: Dispute Genetics. A 19-member group of citizens wrote a joint vote on the opportunities and risks of genetics via a multi-week opinion-forming process. The book presents the substantive results of this process of participatory technology assessment and discusses in the context of the current bioethics debate. In addition, basic findings on the course, methodology and accompanying evaluation are presented.
content.title_en: Citizens' Conference: Dispute Genetics : A Model Project of Civic Participation in Bioethical Discourse

content.text: The aim of the book is to present current challenges in the design of destinations, their marketable organizational structures, relevant projects as well as information and management systems and process structures. Furthermore, the authors deal with the question of the strategic and operational differentiation of the competition units, which are successful through the use of technologies in the IRS area and the use of new media.
content.title_en: Competition of destinations : Experiences - Concepts - Visions

content.text: Service Modelling 2014 : From Service Model to Application System. Oliver Thomas and Markus Nüttgens, with their contributing authors, present current and innovative methods and tools for modeling services that can contribute to improving industrial products and hybrid service bundles. Service models can be used to implement supporting application systems. Numerous examples illustrate the performance and practical feasibility of service modeling. The content Methods and tools for service modeling Modeling and configuration of products and services Productivity assessment and delivery models for IT services Sectors and innovative application systems The target groups Dozierdeer and students of business administration, engineering, business informatics and computer science Practitioner in companies that deal with service management and model-based design of services and their digitization The editors Univ.-Prof. Dr. Oliver Thomas is the holder of the Chair of Information Management and Business Informatics and a member of the Department of Business Administration at the University of Osnabrück. Univ.-Prof. Dr. Markus Nüttgens is the holder of the Chair of Business Informatics and Business Modelling of Business Management and Information Systems.

content.text: The volume offers an inter- and transdisciplinary view of the concept of the turn/turn. In the individual parts specific specialist discourses (e.g. educational science, philosophical, artistic) are worked on on on the one hand, and cross-disciplinary topics (e.g. documentary turn in contemporary art) on the other.A science-theoretical foundation as well as concrete considerations on turning as an interdisciplinary phenomenon frame the volume.The content • Turning in the individual disciplines • The documentary turn in contemporary art • Turning as an interdisciplinary phenomenon The target groups Scientists and scientists, artists, students from the humanities, social sciences, cultural sciences and art and art theory The editor Dr. Sandra Aßmann is Professor of Social Spaces and Places at the Ruhr University Bochum. Dr. Peter Moormann is Junior Professor of Media Aesthetics with a focus on music at the University of Cologne. Karina Ehnerfall is an artist and professor of discipline-transparent artistic practice and theory at the University of Cologne.
content.title_en: Turning : Interdisciplinary perspectives on the phenomenon turn

content.text: The relationship between the environment and the rule is one of the central structural features of every human society. The volume gathers the contributions of the first conference, which was devoted to this topic, and spans a large time span from early history to the 20th century. The topics are especially archaeological and linguistic historical findings, hunting, wood and water use as well as infrastructures. The contributions provide information on current research work as well as on future perspectives for research, also and especially in the interdisciplinary field.
content.title_en: Environment and Rule in History

content.text: Rapid political changes in the Federal Republic: theoretical framework and empirical findings. The federal German democracy is considered to be incapacitated because of its many vetoers and strong interest groups with resistance potential. Change can only be carried out in many small and insufficient steps.Contrary to this finding, far-reaching, radical and very fast political changes have taken place in various areas in the last years. What are the reasons and contexts for these rapid political changes? The volume offers theoretical conceptual considerations and brings together empirical findings: from the energy transition and the Hartz reforms to labour migration policy and drug price regulation to the abolition of compulsory military service, the introduction of the stability council and the political changes in family policy. With contributions by:Agnes Blome, Thomas Gerlinger, Sebastian Harnisch/Simon Weiß, Dominic Heinz, Holger Kolb, Friedbert W. Rüb, Manfred G. Schmidt, Christoph H. Stefes and Reimut Zohlnhörer/Nicole Herweg
content.title_en: Rapid policy changes in the Federal Republic : theoretical framework and empirical findings

content.text: The MHI e.V. is a network of leading university professors for the German-speaking industry. The MHI e.V. currently has 20 members, who represent approx. 1,000 scientists through its institutes and chairs. The MHI e.V.'s overall objective is to promote cooperation between German-speaking scientists and industry in the field of assembly, handling and industrial robotics to accelerate research, optimize teaching and improve the international competitiveness of German industry in this field. The Colloquium focuses on a high-level academic exchange, to distribute the results obtained in the field of aircraft production engineering, and to determine synergetic effects and trends, to strengthen the research field and the MHI community. The editor Prof. Dr.-Ing. Thorsten Schüppstuhl is head of the Institute of Aircraft Production Engineering (IFPT) at the Hamburg.
content.title_en: Conference volume of the 2nd Congress Assembly Handling Industrial Robots

content.text: Teaching Trends 2016 : Digitalisation at the university: more diversity in teaching. Digitization at universities is becoming increasingly important. Digitalisation can make an important contribution to highly indebted innovations, to greater transparency and to further opening up universities to new target groups, thus generating more diversity in teaching. In this collection of the ELAN e.V. Congress "TEACHINGTRENDS16: Digitalisation at the university: More diversity in teaching – empirical results, examples and reports on the implementation and integration of didactic and technological trends in university teaching are taken into account. The focus here is on diversity in teaching, individualized teaching and learning with digital media as well as the success factors of the use of digital media at universities.
content.title_en: Teaching Trends 2016 : Digitalisation at the university: more diversity in teaching

content.title_en: The fundamental right to security: On the protection obligations of the liberal constitutional state. Lecture given before the Berlin Legal Society on 24 November 1982 - extended version

content.text: Autonomous systems and work : Perspectives, challenges and limitations of artificial intelligence in the working world. Intelligent planning systems and smart robots: In the future, autonomous systems based on the principles of artificial intelligence will also be introduced into the working world. This not only raises questions about the consequences for jobs and qualifications - the actual application possibilities of these systems and the resulting labour policy and ethical problems are still unexplained. This volume makes an interdisciplinary contribution to the ongoing discourse.
content.title_en: Autonomous Systems and Work : Perspectives, Challenges and Limits of Artificial Intelligence in the Workplace

content.text: Volume 4 of the series "Baden-Baden Criminal Law Talks" contains the 20 presentations of an interdisciplinary invitation meeting on 26-27 April 2018 in Baden-Baden on the topic "Proof and documentation of discussions. The contributions examine the concept, subject matter and problems of proof in criminal law from a substantive and procedural perspective, philosophical, legal, sociological and media perspective. The authors come from the fields of science, justice, law and journalism. With contributions by René Börner, Thomas Fischer, Wolfgang Frisch, Thomas Gutmann, Rainer Hamm, Eric Hilgendorf, Dietmar Hipp, Stephan König, Christoph Krehl, Hans Kudlich, Ulfrid Neumann, Manfred Nötzel, Rolf Raum, Franz Salditt, Wolfgang Schild, Jahn C. Schuher, Johann Schwenn, Gerson Trüg, Julia Maria Valentin, Thomas Weigend
content.title_en: Evidence

content.text: The Red Vienna : 1919 to 1934 : Ideas, debates, practice. The first free elections to the Vienna Municipal Council bring the absolute majority to the Social Democratic Workers' Party in 1919. Thus, an internationally respected reform project begins, which aims at a profound improvement of the living conditions in the city and a far-reaching democratization of society. The central field of action becomes the housing question. On the basis of "luxury taxes" more than 60,000 apartments as well as numerous social, leisure and cultural institutions are created until 1934. The comprehensively illustrated publication asks about historical conditions and effects, the international influences and the external appearance, the relationship between ideology and pragmatism as well as the current potential of this dynamic urban development in the sign of modernity.00Exhibition: WIen Museum MUSA, Vienna, Austria (30.04.2019-19.01.2020)
content.title_en: The Red Vienna : 1919 to 1934 : ideas, debates, practice

content.text: Moholy-Nagy and the Neue Typography: A-Z. 1929, ten years after the founding of the Bauhaus, the Berlin-based Martin-Gropius-Bau showed the exhibition "Neue Typographie", to which László Moholy-Nagy was also invited, who had left Dessau the year before and made a name for himself as a designer in Berlin. For his space "Where is typographic development going?" he designed 78 display boards on the future and development of "Neue Typography" since the turn of the century. Moholy-Nagy used his own designs as well as advertising printed material from colleagues from the Bauhaus environment for his boards. In the 1920s, the functional graphic design of "Neue Typographie" had established an artistic advertising design that broke with the previous tradition. The aim was to present a contemporary design with standardized font types, industrial DIN standards and ideals such as readability, clarity and directness in accordance with the principles of constructivist art.
content.title_en: Moholy-Nagy and the New Typography : A-Z

content.text: Orangerie – the rediscovery of a European ideal: Festschrift to mark the 40th anniversary of the founding of the working group Orangerien in Germany e.V. For forty years, the Working Group Orangerien in Germany e.V. has been following the traces of Orangerie culture through research, documentation and publication. In this volume – at the same time double volume 16/17 of its series – he is dedicated to Orangerie as a complex total work of art from nature and art, which has a great past and a strong charisma right up to the present day. Orangeries, as once, are also today used for the presentation and cultivation, the use, care and wintering of exquisite collections of orangerie, as well as for their metaphorical staging. Orangerie buildings and their plant collections are among the most important elements of Baroque gardens and contribute significantly to the intuitive conveyance of historical connections and aesthetic qualities.
content.title_en: Orangerie – the rediscovery of a European ideal : Festschrift on the 40th anniversary of the founding of the working group Orangerien in Germany e.V.

content.text: Religious identities in a globalized world. How do religious communities shape their identity? Under the conditions of migration and an increasing globalization, they are increasingly under pressure and in motion. When divergent identities meet, new constellations of encounter and networking emerge. At the same time, the need for demarcation grows. Religion can be thought less and less locally, regionally or even nationally fixed. Content contours shift, new and novel contexts arise, boundaries are questioned, broken through and redefined. The theological and philosophical contributions of this volume ask for religious identities in a globalized world. Authors from all continents discuss various facets of the topic: from the handling of "holy writings" to religious learning processes to the relationship between religion and gender. The volume goes back to the International Theological Study Days of the Catholic Theological Faculty in June 2016.
content.title_en: Religious Identities in a Globalized World

content.text: Conflict transformation as a way to peace: Christian and Islamic perspectives. Islam and Christianity have often legitimized violence in their history, but also gave strong peace-ethical impulses. The approaches to this are illuminated in this volume from a Christian and Islamic perspective by new concepts of conflict transformation: How can religious resources contribute to constructively working on religious, but also social and political conflicts? Where can these resources be found and how can they be applied? What role can religious actors and actors, but also the spiritual sources and traditions of religions as well as their spiritual and communicative practical forms play in the conflict transformation? With contributions by Dirk Ansorgung, Reinhold Bernhardt, Michael Haspel, Marco Hofheinz, Kerim Kudo, Christine Schliesser, Hansjörg Schmid, Konrad Schmid, Nimet Seker, Mathias Tanner, Mohamed Turki, Markus Weingardt.
content.title_en: Conflict transformation as a way to peace : Christian and Islamic perspectives

content.text: Upcycling : use and repurpose as a design principal in architecture. This publication was published at the Institute of Architecture and Spatial Development of the University of Liechtenstein. The guest contributions are based on the lectures of the symposiums "Upcycling. Reuse as a Design Principle in Architecture" 2018 and 2019 at the Institute of Architecture and Spatial Development. The student contributions were made during the research semester (WS2018, SS2019) at the Institute of Architecture and Spatial Development of the University of Liechtenstein (information source: last uncounted page of the publication)
content.title_en: Upcycling : use and repurpose as a design principal in architecture

content.text: Terrorism in Europe in the field of conflict between freedom and security: historical experiences and current challenges. Terrorism is not a new phenomenon historically. At the latest since the 1970s, its various forms of play pose challenges for the liberal states of Western Europe. They are resisting ever new dimensions of danger not only by increasing security measures in public space (for example with concrete barriers against the abuse of vehicles for the killing of civilian victims); but also in law, "reinforcement" takes place. In view of the current, profound changes in the law at national and international level, it is time to stop for an inventory: Do liberal democracies threaten to lose their freedom in view of the terrorist threats and a intensified policy of internal security, which is just constitutive for these states? This question is addressed by the contributions in this volume from the perspective of law and history. They address historical constellations and experiences as well as the current legal situation in Germany, Spain and France, and thus want to make the way for an interdisciplinary and comparative examination of this problem. With Hans-Christian Ströbel, Dr. Stefan Cano, Prof. Prof. Prof.
content.title_en: Fighting terrorism in Europe in the conflict between freedom and security: historical experiences and current challenges

content.text: Expectation: The future between fear and hope. A fundamental ambivalence shapes our experience of the future. The new comes to us in such a way that we can either receive it passively or anticipate it and accordingly actively design it and shape it. Also the existential attitudes we adopt towards the future and the affective evaluations we bring to it have a contradictory character. We can see the coming as fulfilment or threat to us, therefore we expect the future in fear or hope. The present book investigates the future relationship in the horizon of two disciplines, which deal in a special way with the basic conditions of human existence and experience in time: philosophy and psychoanalysis. The contributions gathered in this volume shed light on the phenomenon of expectation in its internal tension and diverging forms, its cultural prerequisites and its existential significance. With contributions by Emmanuel Alloa, Emil Anehrn, Christian Bermes, Stephan Grätzel, Jutta Gutwinski-Jeggle, Gun Hindrich, Ralf Mariotler, Ralf Warika, Tilhoff, and Fritz Heiß, Wolfgang Küchen, Wolfgang Wehrmann, Wolfgang
content.title_en: Expectation : Future between fear and hope

content.text: Reformation in Islam: Perspectives and Limits. Islam in the modern world, which is characterized by democracy, secularism and progress, can only exist if it passes through a Reformation, is claimed by some, and contested by others, and is the subject of a debate that continues until today, which can be traced back to at least the early 20th century.This volume allows voices to speak for and against a Reformation in Islam and puts the debate in the light of current events and challenges, which include the rise of Salafism.The content Introduction Reformation as a challenge Islam and politics Reformation and the gender question Comparative perspectives The target groups philosophers theologians social scientists political and religious historians The editors Jörgen Erik Klußmann is a study leader at the Evangelical Academy in the Rhineland and alongside coach and trainer for sociocultural and religious sensitivities as well as for systemic conflict transformation. Dr. Michael Kreutz is a political scientist and Orientalist in Bochum with the focus on Modern History of the Middle East and South East Europe, political idea history, Europe and Islam, religion and politics. Aladin Islam-Referenz-Referenz-Radition-Radition-Radition-Radition-Radition-Radisch-Radition-Radition-Radition-Radition-Radisch-Radisch-Rad-Rad-Rad-Rad-Rad
content.title_en: Reformation in Islam : Perspectives and Limitations

content.text: The palace of the Republic: utopia, inspiration, political space. The popular name was given to it after the then head of state "Erichs Lampenladen" or "Last of the Republic". During its short service life from 1976 onwards, it was a term for the "Palace of the Republic" as a government building with the hall of the Volkskammer and at the same time the central cultural building of the GDR capital. After the end of the GDR, it was given to demolition by politics, but was still used for some time for artistic activities; it polarized until the last time. The exhibition "Palace of the Republic - Utopia, Inspiration, Politikum" at the Kunsthalle Rostock shows pieces of equipment and works of art that deal with the often controversially discussed building. Visitors are invited to remember or rediscover the "Palace" and its many facets. Art and design, which once brought it to light, are expanded by the eyes of various artists to the "Palace of the Republic" and show it as a source of inspiration until the present.
content.title_en: Palace of the Republic : Utopia, Inspiration, Politics

content.text: Collective violence in the city : Europe 1890-1939. Are violence, experience of violence, violence and life in the cities closely linked? Phenomena of collective violence have been examined by history, especially for the interwar period. The volume conceived and published by Friedrich Lenger clearly broadens the perspective: it sets the course for older street politics such as demonstrations, food riots or tenant strikes and involves the European East and South. Political violence is not least consistently classified in the context of supposedly unpolitical forms of protest
content.title_en: Collective violence in the city : Europe 1890-1939

content.text: After the founding of (Great) Berlin in October 1920, the system of centers in Berlin changed fundamentally: In addition to the historical centre, the New West gained importance around the Kaiser Wilhelm Memorial Church. An inheritance of the Imperial period was also an extraordinary number of medium, small and smallest centers in the city centre as well as on the periphery, for example in Weißensee or Frohnau. In the following 100 years, further centers such as the Fehrbelliner Platz or the Marzahner Promenade were added. But where should the main center lie, how should it be designed? Should there be a common center at all? In 1920, resources and forces were missing (Great) Berlin, after 1933, the National Socialist dictatorship planned a new monumental center. In the course of the split in Berlin, two rival centres were then developed: Alexanderplatz and Breitscheidplatz. With the fall of the Wall, the question once again arose: Where and what is the Berlin centre? The metropolitan region has three centres of rank today: the historic centre, the city west and the Potsdam Old Town, and the wider city, and the wider city's old town, and the wider population, the more of these centres, the more of these centres, the more of their history, and more.
content.title_en: 100 years (large) Berlin and its centers

content.text: Digital technologies between steering and self-empowerment. Apps that remind schoolchildren of their homework and show parents how long their children have taken to do it; digital applications that show social workers and their clients how they have developed; programs that support the integration of refugees: The influence of digital technologies on our personal lifestyle and thus on the design of our social interaction is not only a side effect, as is often observed in the use of digital media, but is intended and often even primary goal. But how far does this influence extend, and how can it be evaluated? The band reflects the use of digital technologies for social purposes with regard to the field of tension between steering and self-empowerment or also help and control from various disciplines.
content.title_en: Digital technologies between governance and self-authorisation

content.text: AUDIENCE Diversity 4.0 : Shaping transformation in digital transformation and strengthening the effectiveness through diversity : a workbook for practice with co-creative participation of 300 people from cultural enterprises. Diversity and digitalization are the institutional change processes that meet every cultural enterprise – in addition to changes caused by regular changes of the mindset. The change in population structure through immigration and the progression of digital change have an impact on every institution, because the audience, its cultural composition, the viewing and listening habits and the usage behaviour in the digital space are changing.
content.title_en: AUDIENCE Diversity 4.0 : Shaping transformation in digital transformation and strengthening effectiveness through diversity : a workbook for practice with co-creative participation of 300 people from cultural enterprises

content.text: Housing issues without end?! : Resources for social housing supply. Cities and regions are confronted with a variety of housing issues: In growing metropolitan regions and mid-towns in Germany rents and land prices have been rising for years. In other places, there is a lack of adequate housing. Thus, it is becoming increasingly difficult for large sections of the population to find affordable and adequate housing for students or seniors. Appropriate policies and instruments for socially equitable housing supply were available. (Verlagstext)
content.title_en: Questions of housing without end?! : Resources for social housing

content.title_en: Civil and legal economic problems of the Internet and artificial intelligence : 15th Travemünder Symposium on the economic analysis of law

content.text: Conrad Wilhelm Hase (1818-1902) : Architect, university teacher, consistorial builder, monument keeper. Publisher: Conrad Wilhelm Hase (1818-1902) is one of the most influential German architects of the second half of the 19th century. With the Museum of Art and Science, the present-day Künstlerhaus, and the Christuskirche, he built two important program buildings of Historism in Hanover. The Christuskirche is also considered an early model for the Eisenach Regulative for Protestant church construction, formulated by Hase. As a consistorial builder, Hase shaped the Lower Saxony church architecture as no second, both in new construction projects and in conservational dealings with historical buildings. With the Marienburg he designed a princely castle for the Welfs, which by no means survived the neo-Gothic residences of the Hohenzollern and Wittelsbacher.
content.title_en: Conrad Wilhelm Hase (1818-1902) : architect, university teacher, consistorial builder, monument keeper

content.text: Earth Stories : Literature and Geology in the Long 19th Century. Around 1800, the framework of a Christian-understood world history of almost 6000 years was blown apart. The perspective opened up into geological time-abstracts and an ever-wider audience was haunted by the fear-throwing, as first scientists began to reconstruct earlier Earth Age of partly irritating antiquity. In view of this reconstruction work, Balzac once enthusiastically asked whether the geologist and paleontologist Cuvier was not the "greatest poet" of the 19th century. In this question, the particular relationship between literature and geology is expressed, which is illuminated in this volume from various perspectives.
content.title_en: Earth Stories : Literature and Geology in the Long 19th Century

content.text: Sustainability and agriculture in China and Germany: a comparative perspective. The work Sustainability and Agriculture in China and Germany – A comparative perspective contains contributions by Chinese and German authors on legal issues of sustainability in agriculture. In both countries, the preservation of the various functions of agriculture is considered a task of the state, which it must regulate by law. The functions to be promoted here are the subject of the social acceptance of agricultural functions in China and in Germany. The contributions of outstanding representatives of German and Chinese agricultural and environmental law from science, administration and attorneys are concerned, among other things, with issues of sustainable soil management, climate protection and social law issues. The European Common Agricultural Policy and sustainability aspects in the law of the WTO are also taken into account. Economic perspectives in the context of insurance protection and risk management are shown. The volume ends with one of the main functions of agricultural activity, food security.
content.title_en: Sustainability and agriculture in China and Germany: a comparative perspective

content.text: Communication, Creation and Innovation - Law in the Transition? : GRUR Junge Wissenschaft : Leipzig 2019. The conference volume deals with current challenges that are exposed to the legal areas of intellectual property, media, competition and data protection law, mainly due to technical developments and resulting legislative changes. Examples of these are artificial intelligent systems that question the essential principles of applicable patent and copyright law. However, questions about the basic media law classification of search engines, social bots and other internet intermediaries are also addressed, as well as questions about the data protection requirements for bloggers, for street photographers and for the "Credit scoring", which have become in need of clarification, in particular through the new data protection regulation. Further focus of the volume are the regulatory possibilities for data markets of "Industry 4.0" and the new directive on copyright in the digital internal market.With contributions by Stefan Papastefanou, David Linke, Katrin Giere and Dorothea Heilmann, Azim Semizoglu, Hanno Magnus, Jens Milker, Stefan Michel, Katharina Wunner, André Reinelt, David-Lahn Klebruck, Tobias
content.title_en: Communication, Creation and Innovation - Right to change? : GRUR Young Science : Leipzig 2019

content.text: The following are the main topics of the 2019 brake conference. The symposium is an indispensable platform for the knowledge and thought exchange of researchers and developers of all companies and institutions. The content of the 2019 brake conference focuses on heat cracking in truck brake discs: influencing factors, brake fluids and recupative braking systems. The symposium is an indispensable platform for the knowledge and thought exchange of researchers and developers of all companies and institutions in the field of brake technology. The content of the brake brake forming in truck brake discs: influencing factors, impact factors and predictive factors in the field of brake fluids.
content.title_en: XXXVIII. International μ Symposium 2019 Brake Conference : XXXVIII. International μ Symposium 2019 Brake Conference

content.text: The hanging gardens of Babylon: from the wonder of the world to the green architecture. Among the seven ancient world wonders, the hanging gardens of Babylon occupy a special position - also because they were the only ones that left no trace: Up to modern times, it is disputed whether the monumental landscape of the terrace ever existed. The fascination for the hanging gardens did not stop - on the contrary. From antiquity to Karl Friedrich Schinkel tells a history of tradition and imagination of how each epoch made its own image of this original type of garden art - and of his legendary creator, the Babylonian Queen Semiramis. Besides reconstruction fantasies, which reached their peak with Robert Koldewey's archaeological rediscovery of Babylon around 1900, numerous installations since the Renaissance bear witness to the influence of the hanging gardens: the Palazzo Piccolomini in Pienza, the Palazzo Ducale in Urbino, the Kleine Eremitage in Saint Petersburg or the roof gardens of Le Corbusier. In the sign of sustainability and climate protection today, a green "Hitec garden" is renewed in the midst of the old promise of the city architecture:
content.title_en: The Hanging Gardens of Babylon : from the Wonder of the World to the Green Architecture

content.text: Identity of architecture, III. Function : Positions on the meaning of function in architecture. Editorial info: Through its function, a building opens to use and purpose. This "keeping open" is intended to ensure the usefulness and expediency of the building, but the way in which architecture performs this purpose in the function of a building is not clearly defined and determined from the outset. Always the "function" - especially in the design - is represented as a concentration of possibilities, thereby also assigning a certain "playroom" to the strategies, concepts, programs, intentions and instructions stored in the building.
content.title_en: Identity of architecture, III. Function : Positions on the significance of function in architecture

content.text: Digitalization of the world of life: Studies on the crisis in Husserl. The fact that digitalisation has now penetrated all areas of society is undisputed. But what are the consequences? Do we focus on a completely data-caught, completely artificial world? This vision of terror does not meet the ambivalent effects of the ongoing technological shift. However, the noticeable changes in the human world relationship call for assurance of the consequences of this process. To analyse this volume, the present volume draws on a diagnosis of the late Husserl. The philosopher saw the human world of life as exposed to a tendency towards technologicalization, which we experience in digitalization. It is characterized by a reckless scientific and technical quantification that influences the material-life-worldly connection of the meaning of individuals, society and nature. The contributions of the book examine the current state of this transformation in the fields of politics, economy, traffic, knowledge, education, literature, health and eroticism.
content.title_en: Digitalization of the world of life : Studies on the crisis after Husserl

content.text: The conference included the best contributions of the 9th Annual Colloquium on Communication in Automation (Komma 2018) and the 6th Annual Colloquium on Image Processing in Automation (BVAu 2018). The conference took place on 20 and 21 November 2018 in the SmartFactoryOWL, a joint institution of the Fraunhofer IOSB-INA and the Technische Hochschule Ostwestfalen-Lippe. The presented latest research results in the fields of industrial communication technology and image processing broaden the current state of research and technology. The vivid examples from the field of automation contained in the contributions put the results into direct application. The editors Prof. Dr. Jürgen Jasperneite direct the Fraunhofer IOSB-INA and is the board member of the Institute for Industrial Information Technology (inIT) of the Technische Hochschule Ostwestfalen-Lippe (TH-OWL). At TH-OWL he represents the field of computer networks with a focus on the field of industrial communication. His research focuses on the field of industrial communication and the field of business automation.
content.title_en: Communication and image processing in automation : selected contributions of the annual colloquia KommA and BVAu 2018

content.text: The question of the methods of theatre studies goes back to the initial phase of academic professionalization and constitutionalization of the subject: already Max Herrmann speaks in his "Research on the German theatre history of the Middle Ages and the Renaissance" (1914) of the necessity of an independent methodological instrument set in order to provide theatre science with its own scientific profile. Since the 1990s, a pluralization of the research approaches in the subject can be observed, which corresponds with an increasing aesthetic heterogeneity of theatre and the opening of the subject to interdisciplinary dialogue. However, this extension has remained until now without reflection of the methodological questions associated with it. The aim of this publication is therefore to present, reflect and discuss a selection of the methods of our subject as well as to thematize the limits and problems.
content.title_en: Methods of Theatre Studies

content.text: Construction management in areas according to §§ 30 and 34 BauGB: technical and legal questions. Despite amendments to urban planning and environmental regulations, the overplanning of already planned areas (§ 30 BauGB) and of land areas in the unplanned interior area (§ 34 BauGB) are more relevant than ever. Questions about the prevention of planning damage, the consideration of property rights, the security possibilities of building management planning and the choice of the most suitable planning instrument are relevant. Environmental requirements also play a decisive role. Also current occasions, such as the introduction of the "Urban Area" (§ 6a BauNVO) as well as the provisions on escape line plans, leave the overplanning of areas according to §§ 30-34 BauGB often more complex than new plans on the green meadow.With contributions by Dr. Matthias Blessing, Dr. Jörg Wagner, Matthias Simon, Univ.-Prof. Stephan Mitschang, Helmut Petz, Prof. Dr. Michael Uechtritz, Dr.-Ing. Tim Schwarz, Dr. Gernot Schiller, Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr.
content.title_en: Construction planning in areas according to §§ 30 and 34 of the Civil Code : technical and legal questions

content.text: Teaching Trends 2018 : the Presence University and the Digital Transformation. The conference volume of Teaching Trends 2018 offers all readers exciting insights into classrooms, which use various digital media in clever scenarios for the acquisition of their students' skills. In a broad view of digitalization, the conference contributions deal with new learning formats such as blended learning and inverted classrooms, their current legal framework in GDPR and copyright and technical foundations, e.g. in Augmented / Virtual Reality or Audience Response. In addition, however, overarching strategies and development concepts that lead the university into a digital future are discussed. In all areas, the lecturers reported directly from their teaching practice as well as from accompanying research. To round off the conference, the editors have brought the introductory discussion on the significance of digital transformation for universities, the panel discussion on challenges that arise for the study, and a keynote on the architecture of learning spaces to paper.
content.title_en: Teaching Trends 2018 : the Presence College and the Digital Transformation

content.text: Right thinking, right spaces? : anti-democracy developments and their spatial contexts. Right orientations and discourses have a spatial dynamic. The problem of locating only in structurally weak regions, rural areas or disadvantaged residential areas is however shortened, reproduces stereotypes and provides hardly any explanation. Because social and spatial contexts not only require behaviour and attitudes, but are equally produced and changed by individual and collective actions. The contributors of various disciplines investigate these complex relationships, discuss them with experts from practice and thereby open up new spaces for action.
content.title_en: Right thinking, right spaces? : anti-democracy developments and their spatial contexts

content.text: The EU between decline and re-establishment: Paths from the polycrisis. In 2012, the European Union received the Nobel Peace Prize. Nevertheless, for several years, it has been struggling with multiple crises, such as the "Euro crisis", the "refugee crisis", the "Brexit" and the increasing division of the community of values. In view of its parallelity and interrelationships, the crisis scenarios have meanwhile become a situation in which the European integration project as such is under scrutiny. In particular, two core projects of the EU are at risk with the Eurozone and the Schengen area, which stand in particular for the convergence of Europe. In the context of the 25th Würzburg European Legal Days (19/20 July 2019), these legally challenging complexes were examined in detail and paths from the polycrisis as well as constructive guidelines for a renewal of the EU were discussed. The papers by renowned speakers from science and practice are documented in the collection volume. With contributions by Prof. Dr. Markus Ludwigs; Prof. Dr. Stefanie Schmahl; Prof. Dr. Frank Hoffmeister; Prof. Frank Schoreck; Prof. Dr. Rudolf Hein
content.title_en: The EU between decline and new start-up: ways out of the polycrisis

content.text: Forms of (re-)presentation of technical knowledge: Approaches and methods for teacher education in the didactics and educational sciences. However, the (re-)presentation of knowledge is now well researched in individual disciplines of teacher education in the field of didactics and educational science. However, the exchange of approaches, methods and results of this research between the disciplines is still only slow. The volume presents lectures of an interdisciplinary conference at the Christian-Albrechts-Universität zu Kiel, which was promoted within the framework of the Kiel project "Lehramt mit Perspektive – LeaP@CAU the quality offensive teacher education. The main questions were among others the following: Which theoretically sound approaches (dual coding, mental models, chunks, etc.) are based on empirical methods and methods of teaching (re-) and methods of teaching (re-)?
content.title_en: Forms of (re-)presentation of professional knowledge : Approaches and methods for teacher education in the fields of didactics and educational sciences

content.text: Movement and change in literature, language, and society. This volume explores the topics of ‘movement and change' in various societies. The individual chapters deal with spatial and temporal mobility in language, literature, culture and society. The topic is examined from a theoretical, critical, historical and practical perspective, partly by critically examining controversial topics such as political movements, identity, body images, sexuality and violence. The volume thus contributes to understanding the changing conditions and functions of societies. This volume investigates the themes of movement and change in human societies. The chapters deal with spatial and temporal mobility in language, literature, culture and society. content.text: Collaboration in water resource management in Vietnam and South-East Asia. Water, water resources and water management are now in the most difficult, non-traditional and cross-border security problems. Based on documents from first hand, the experts in this volume are trying to develop an understanding of why the Greater Mekong Subregion (GMS) is important from a geostrategic point of view, what historical and current challenges the region has to face, how major powers such as China, India, Japan and the USA are politically involved in the GMS and what the GMS can learn about water resource management from other regions. "This publication documents the main results of a workshop on cross border cooperation in water resource management - The Case of the Greater Mekong Sub-region. The conference too place in Hanoi on 16 October 2018 [...]." - Introduction Water, water resources and water resource management are one of the challenges of the non-traditional crowding problem in Hanoi.
content.title_en: Collaboration in water resource management in Vietnam and South-East Asia

content.text: How can adequate protection of trust be ensured in digital markets? This question was addressed by a colloquium organised by the Ernst von Caemmerer Foundation in cooperation with the Institute for Law and Finance, the Goethe University Frankfurt am Main and the German Hub of the European Law Institute. The volume documents the presentations held, which addressed the issues of digital explanations, blockchain, crowdfunding, corporate law and online platform. The contributions also take a comparative and European perspective. Together with the discussion reports, a rich picture of the state of play and the perspectives of research is given. With contributions by Uwe Blaurock, Jan Lieder, Alexander Roßnagel, Hans Schulte-Nölke, Gerald Spindler, Tizian Troxler
content.title_en: Protection of trust in the digital age

content.text: "And this is what Gelsenkirchen says ..." : Kultur@Stadt_Bauten_Ruhr. For most people today cultural buildings belong to a city. Since the 19th century museums, theatres and opera houses are prominent and prestigious building tasks of urban architecture. Internationally well-respected cultural buildings such as the Musiktheater in the district in Gelsenkirchen, the Museum Folkwang or the Aalto Theatre in Essen, the Museum Quadrat in Bottrop or the library and canteen of the Ruhr University Bochum are witnesses to the departure of the cities and have also written it along with.0The publication tells of a Ruhr area that constantly reinvents itself far from its industrial past; from ideas, discussions and decisions on architecture and urban construction that still have an effect today. Using plans, models, photographs, correspondences, printed matter and other documents from the holdings of the Baukunstarchiv NRW in Dortmund, the biographies of some of these buildings will be re-drawn and previously hidden treasures from the archives will be presented to a broad public for the first time, thus comprehensively depicting the importance of these cultural buildings for the cities in the Ruhr area.00Exhibition, Germany 20.
content.title_en: "And that's what is in Gelsenkirchen..." : Kultur@Stadt_Bauten_Ruhr

content.text: What if ...? : to the utopian in art, architecture and design. How do we want to live today and with what artistic means can we find approaches for this? If one considers utopia as a method of thinking, as a spiritual free space in which, for the time being, concepts for the future, independent of the current reality, are tested in conjunction with a critical reflection of the present, it gains immediate significance for the Now. Art, architecture and design can as creative engines contribute significantly to promoting such alternative thinking models and to re-evaluating the quality of utopian thinking.
content.title_en: What if ...? : to Utopian in Art, Architecture and Design

content.text: The volume focuses on the various influences of progressive digitalization on criminal proceedings. It contains the written lectures held at the conference "Digitalization and Criminal Procedures" at the University of Leipzig. Experts from science and practice discussed opportunities and challenges of the new technical possibilities: first experiences with the electronic file, the use of electronic evidence or the technical recording of interrogations and main negotiations. The controversial e-evidence regulation and its consequences for investigations in Germany are also taken into consideration. In future, judges can help to access decisions and considerations of other courts for their criminal investigations. And also in the criminal prosecution, digitization is taking hold and raises the question whether prisoners should be allowed to use tablets or mobile phones. With contributions by Jun.-Prof. Dr. Dominik Brodowski, Eleni Chaitidou, Prof. Dr. Robert Esser, Wolfgang Gründler, Patricia Hamel, Prof. Dr. Elisa Hoven, Prof. Dr. Matthias Jahn, Prof. Dr. Kudlich Rostski, Prof. Dr. Reschke, Prof. Dr. Dr.
content.title_en: Digitalisation and criminal proceedings

content.text: The crisis of the democratic rule of law in the 21st century: The meeting of the Young Forum on Legal Philosophy (JFR) in the International Association for Legal and Social Philosophy (IVR) in Salzburg in April 2019. The democratic rule of law has been shaken in the 21st century – not only in Europe. Developments such as the USA and Brazil bear witness to the global significance of this phenomenon. Due to the multitude of worrying events, it is of utmost importance to analyse this crisis. How can the attacks on democracy be countered? Are we able to deal with international or supranational means? What can answers be given if the liberal rule of law lives on conditions that it cannot (for its sake) guarantee itself?
content.title_en: The crisis of the democratic rule of law in the 21st century : Meeting of the Young Forum on Legal Philosophy (JFR) in the International Association for Legal and Social Philosophy (IVR) in Salzburg in April 2019

content.text: The digitalised state - Opportunities and challenges for the modern state : 60th Assistant Conference Public Law : Conference of Research Staff, Scientific Assistants and Assistants, Trier 2020. Unlimited access to information and new opportunities for the economy - the opportunities of digitalization are manifold. At the same time, there are numerous challenges of economic, political and social nature that demand answers. To measure this digital transformation from a public-law perspective, the 60th Assistant Conference, which took place in March 2020 at the University of Trier, set itself the goal. The resulting conference volume gathers answers from young German-speaking scientists to the question of what opportunities and challenges digitalization holds for modern states and how our legal framework can be developed with a view to digital change. With contributions by Dr. Wolfgang Abromeit, Dr. Ranjana Andrea Achleitner, Alice Bertram, Nikolas Eisentraut, Roman Friedrich, Matthias Haag, Eleonora Heim, Alexander Iben, Dirk Müllmann, Dorothea Mund, Elisabeth Paar, Dirk Pohl, Lasse Ramson, Sebastian Schwab, Dr. Rike Wagner, Dr. Riker, Julia, Dr.
content.title_en: The digitalized state - opportunities and challenges for the modern state : 60th Assistant Meeting Public Law : Conference of Scientific Staff, Scientific Assistants, Trier 2020

content.text: Law and Diversity: Local constellations and global perspectives from the early modern era to the present. Parallel justice, anti-discrimination laws, legal transfer – the topic of "Law and Diversity" combines a wide range of current discussions and proves to be central to the social approach to difference and equality. The contributors of the volume - from history and law and Jewish studies - put this topic into a historical perspective and take a look at constellations and ways of dealing with legal diversity from the early modern era to the present. Illuminating situations of cultural contact and interreligious coexistence as well as globally acting actors and organizations in Europe, Asia, America and Africa Frontmatter -- Content -- Preface & Thanks -- Law and Diversity: Conceptual considerations and microhistorical insights -- "Le chapeau ou la toque" -- Foreign beggars or country children? -- Sharia according to k. & k. content.text: Purity and authority in the cultures of the ancient Mediterranean. Ideas of purity and impurity are important structural elements of ancient religious traditions. In their simplest form they regulate the physical presence of individuals and objects in sacred districts or in other places where this seems socially necessary. However, due to their potential for regulating inclusion and exclusion, purity concepts always have an – mostly implicit – meaning for the formation and maintenance of human communities. With the religious dimension, a political dimension is necessarily attached to this. In this conference volume, we examine how communities of the ancient Mediterranean and their leaders dealt with this political potential.
content.title_en: Purity and Authority in the Cultures of the Ancient Mediterranean

content.text: Urban mining and cycle-oriented construction: the city as a resource warehouse. Urban mining describes the fact that cities in industrialised countries can be resource mines. After an introduction to the topic, concepts from the research and practice area to closed cycles in the building sector, variety purity and thoughts on a new material understanding are shown. In times of a growing world population and increasing resource shortage, how construction is possible without exploiting and destroying our environment further. On exemplary experimental buildings in Stuttgart and surroundings, the More.Value.Pavilionin Heilbronn, the future residential and work laboratory NEST in Dübendorf (Switzerland) or a pavilion of beverage packaging and pallets, the No-Waste-Vault in New York are presented the possibilities with many photos and graphics. The band is very attractively designed, suitable for professionals from the building industry and interested lay people and contains many ideas on an important topic.
content.title_en: Urban mining and cycle-oriented construction: the city as a raw material warehouse

content.text: Crisis climate: Environmental conflicts from a Latin American perspective. Climate change, species extinction, massive resource exploitation, pollution, consumption of non-renewable but vital elements, all of which are symptoms of a planetary crisis that threatens ecosystems – and thus also humans – in their current existence. Despite their global dimensions, this crisis has a very different regional, social and political impact. In the volume, the global facets of these multiple environmental crises are considered from a Latin American perspective. In particular, the interdependencies with Europe are emphasized, as regards the crisis-related consumption. At the same time, the contributions discuss concrete solutions and creative responses to the global ecological crisis from a Latin American perspective.
content.title_en: Crisis climate : Environmental conflicts from a Latin American perspective

content.text: Narrative texts develop worlds, they also design orders. In addition, they must be properly designed in the narrative, so that the concept of 'order' is relevant in two respects in application to narrative texts: as order(s) of narrative as well as as as told order(s). 'order' is understood as a dynamic concept, which is only to be grasped in its plurality and strongly linked to the social spaces of action of its negotiation. Because orders aim, among other things, to establish and organize community, to form perception, to generate meaning, to make meaning offerings and to enable knowledge. Thus, the order concepts designed in told worlds can be read as a specific expression of cultural knowledge. Primary interest of the volume is to try out 'ordering' as a category of narratological analysis and to ask about the double formula to which extent the order conceptions designed in told worlds can be used as a specific expression of cultural knowledge.
content.title_en: Narrated Orders - Orders of Narrating : Studies on texts from the Middle Ages to the Early Modern Period

content.text: In the Bauhaus year 2019, much of the music at the Bauhaus was to be read and heard, for example, from the Bauhaus students' jazz band or from the fruitful relationship with Johann Sebastian Bach's music, but also Arnold Schönberg's with artists such as Paul Klee or Wassily Kandinsky. However, references between the Bauhaus and music and/or sound that extend to the design of our present day can be found on other levels: What significance do 100 years after the founding of the Bauhaus still have for programmatic, educational and social utopian concepts of the Bauhaus, for example for auditory urban planning and architecture, for the design of sounds and music in films, computer games and pop music, or for the acoustic design of everyday objects? In September 2019, an international conference at the Goethe National Museum Weimar addressed these and similar questions.
content.title_en: Designing sound worlds : on the topicality of the Bauhaus in sound design and auditory urban planning

content.text: In the middle of Germany, in the middle of war: coping practices and options for action in the Thirty Years' War. The Thirty Years' War is considered the greatest catastrophe and most traumatic war experience in German history before the Second World War. Indeed, in many regions, large sections of the population suffered from the acts of war and their consequences. At the same time, there were also clear regional and social differences: While many goods and goods or even their lives were lost, others arranged themselves with the war or could even benefit from it, even in regions seriously affected by the war "middle Germany". Basically, the Thirty Years' War was not only passively suffered by most people, but also actively managed. The band examines the practices of individual, collective and institutional actors that are taking effect and thus works out the various options for action and coping strategies.
content.title_en: In the middle of Germany, in the middle of war : coping practices and options for action in the Thirty Years' War

content.text: From "beautiful diversity" to precarious heterogeneity: educational processes in plural society. "This collection of contributions from the interdisciplinary conference "From 'beautiful diversity' to precarious heterogeneity" (University of Salzburg, 2017) asks how educational processes are possible in a plural society. The decisive challenge is not a "beautiful diversity", but a precarious heterogeneity that questions the cohesion and understanding in contemporary society. A central result of this interdisciplinary debate is the realization of heterogeneity as an opportunity to see and enable educational processes in the context of (inter-)cultural and social tensions. Education means to confront different, indeed contradictory experiences and life contexts and therefore to develop a new quality of knowledge, critical ability and learning competence."---
content.title_en: From "beautiful diversity" to precarious heterogeneity: educational processes in plural society

content.text: The promise of autonomy : Contributions of the symposium of 28/29 October 2019 at the Academy of Sciences and Literature, Mainz. "Autonomy" is an omnipresent catchword of our time. How does man position himself with his own claim to autonomy in relation to newer forms that have become predominant in the technological field? What liberal, economic and cultural promises of classical ideas of autonomy can be fulfilled by digitalization and automation? The contributions of this volume deal with the encounter of these ideas from perspectives of different specialist cultures. Some of the basic categories with which the humanities and social sciences operate vary. The diversity of questions and methods that the different disciplines pursue on this topic opens up the view of how people attribute autonomy and – as a counterpart – responsibility to each other.
content.title_en: Promises of autonomy : Contributions of the symposium of 28/29 October 2019 in the Academy of Sciences and Literature, Mainz

content.text: The German theatre* in queer everyday life and activism of the 1970s and 1980s, the German theatre* in the German theatre* in the German theatre* in the German theatre* in the German theatre* in the German theatre* in the German theatre* in the German theatre* in the German theatre of the 1970s and 1980s. On women's festivals and in the dance culture, in protest performances and performance art, on public toilets and backroom stage, the theatre is characterized by very different forms of theatrical representation, in order to make sexuality and genders visible and tangible beyond the heteronormative matrix. The spectrum of effects ranges from subversive parody to political agitation and play with complete illusion. In the title of the book, we want to give the theatre concept a first overview of a field which has been described little. The contributions document the diverse theimutual discourses and the e-controspective of the German and the econtrospection of the German theatre and the econtrospection of the German time.
content.title_en: Theatre* in queer everyday life and activism of the 1970s and 1980s

content.text: What is digitality? Philosophical and pedagogical perspectives. The concept of digitality has only recently become the focus of cultural and spiritual science. It does not correspond to the understanding of digitalization in terms of the development of technologies, the collection and storage of data and the automation of processes. Rather, digitality reflects on cultural and social realities and forms of life that go hand in hand with digitalization and enable it to interact. The aim of the volume is to determine the phenomenon of digitality and to focus on cultural, philosophical, didactic and sociological aspects of life in a digitalised world. The following questions are at the heart of this: What is the relationship between the phenomena "digitalization" and "digitality"? How do teaching and learning processes in the context of digitalization and digitality change? What challenges, opportunities and problems arise from the digitality of the future of society and universities? How can the culture of digitality be shaped and communicated in a targeted manner?
content.title_en: What is digitality? : Philosophical and educational perspectives

content.text: Conflict transformation as a way to peace: Christian and Islamic perspectives. Islam and Christianity have often legitimized violence in their history, but also gave strong peace-ethical impulses. The approaches to this are illuminated in this volume from a Christian and Islamic perspective by new concepts of conflict transformation: How can religious resources contribute to constructively working on religious, but also social and political conflicts? Where can these resources be found and how can they be applied? What role can religious actors and actors, but also the spiritual sources and traditions of religions as well as their spiritual and communicative practical forms play in the conflict transformation? With contributions by Dirk Ansorgung, Reinhold Bernhardt, Michael Haspel, Marco Hofheinz, Kerim Kudo, Christine Schliesser, Hansjörg Schmid, Konrad Schmid, Nimet Seker, Mathias Tanner, Mohamed Turki, Markus Weingardt.
content.title_en: Conflict transformation as a way to peace : Christian and Islamic perspectives

content.text: Geography of violence: Power and counterpower in Latin America. In parts of Latin America, violence has developed a seemingly inexorable self-dynamic.The boundaries between the legal and illegal, between the state and organized crime, and the lawless and unprivileged life blur.In contrast to the political violence of the past century, this new violence has no clearly recognizable switching centres and often no recognizable goal.It is more explicit and at the same time unsightly, local and global: apparently everyone: it can be its actor or victim, supposedly everywhere.How can we think of the relationships between levels and places of our violent presence – from the body to the global, from Europe to Latin America? Where and by whom is power organized and exercised today? What purpose does violence fulfil, and how can we decode its global entanglement? How can we talk about them as they represent what they do against it? With contributions by Carlos Beristin, Verónica Gago, Anne Huffschmid, Mario Rufer and Rita Segato.
content.title_en: Geography of violence : Power and counterpower in Latin America

content.text: "Extreme situations, quick decisions" : Helmut Schmidt against storm flood and RAF terror : Companion to the exhibition in the library of Helmut Schmidt University. Flood disaster 1962: Ban the Basic Law on the Rescue and Supply of Storm Flood Victims by the Bundeswehr? Did Helmut Schmidt, the Hamburg police senator, overtake it, heartily over it, in a "overlawed emergency situation? – RAF terror 1977: Was the Bonn Constitution again no guidance, as if it had to be decided whether the kidnapped employer president Hanns Martin Schleyer and the 91 inmates of a kidnapped Lufthansa jet should be saved – at the price of the release of imprisoned terrorists? Did Schmidt, meanwhile Chancellor, again resort to "the painfully tested conclusion of his political life experience and his moral insight? Was he inevitably guilty of this – as in an ancient drama? At the beginning of the Corona crisis in 2020, it has been repeatedly deplored that Germany no longer proficient of a leadership, like Helmut Schmidt's book of legends.
content.title_en: "Extreme Situations, Fast Decisions" : Helmut Schmidt against Storm Flood and RAF Terror : Companion to the exhibition in the library of Helmut Schmidt University

content.text: Teaching in the information society. Children and adults as part of the information and knowledge society are also affected and involved in the digital transformation. To what extent information and knowledge are actually accessible, usable and designable for everyone is a question of educational theory and didactics. Students, teachers, students, teachers and candidates for teaching positions are to be supported in exploring the possibilities and limits of the information society, in reflecting on it and in identifying and training options for action, orientation and skills. In this volume, teaching in the information society is examined from the perspectives of the didactic reconstruction of the subject, media education and informatical education; the question of appropriate places, media and technologies are also addressed as well as projects in university teacher education as approaches to perspective.
content.title_en: Teaching in the Information Society

content.text: Methods of policy-daughtering theory and empirical research. Political didactics is the science of political teaching and learning. As such, it contributes to the theory-building and empirical research in the field of school and non-school political education. The collection volume provides an up-to-date, differentiated and accessible insight into this work through the perspectives of young scientists. In three chapters, an overview of theoretical and qualitative empirical research is given at the beginning. Subsequently, twelve contributions explicate these perspectives on policy-daughter doctoral and research projects.
content.title_en: Methods of policy didactic theory and empirical research
