content.text: Digital Romanist Linguistics: Status and Perspectives. The role of computer science in human sciences, including philologies, is gaining in importance. This also results in significant changes and new perspectives for Romanist linguistics, especially in methodological terms. The description of key aspects of these processes is the focus of this volume, which combines the contributions of the XXXIV. Romanist Colloquium. The spectrum of topics includes theoretical and methodological questions as well as the presentation and discussion of ongoing digital-based research projects from Altrumanian to contemporary Spanish.
content.title_en: Digital Romance Linguistics : Status and Perspectives

content.text: Realtime 2021: Real-Time Systems Through the Ages -- Dynamic migration decisions in multicore systems -- Execution time and power consumption of interferences of artificial neural networks on a tensor processor -- Dynamic Vision sensors for texture classification in automatic visual inspection -- Are bitcoin transactions safe, real-time and resource-appropriate? -- Analysis methods for calculating WCET with asynchronous input/output processing -- An interior position system based on Bluetooth 5.1 and ultra-wide band -- Hardware accelerators for automotive multicore microcontrollers with a tough real-time requirement -- Fault Tolerance in heterogenic Automotive Real-time Systems -- Real-time Ethernet communication in automotive multi-core systems with hierarchical memory layout -- Time-controlled communication interfaces in different application contexts -- A conference system with biometrically based face visualisation for very large number of participants -- Machine Learning is rich in temperature measurement of a permanent magnet/remote measurement of the time cycle.
content.title_en: Real-time 2021 : Real-time communication

content.text: Visionaries & Displaced : Austrian Traces in Modern American Architecture; [on the occasion of the exhibition "Visionaries & Displaced, Austrian Traces in Modern American Architecture" at the Kunsthalle Vienna, February 24 to April 16, 1995]. In the continuation of its focus on architecture, Kunsthalle Wien presented an overview of the works of Austrian modern architects, who emigrated or were displaced to the USA between 1911 and 1941. The exhibition spanned a range from the first (in the European sense) modern buildings of the forced '70s in the USA to important projects from the 1950s.
content.title_en: Visionaries & Displaced : Austrian Traces in Modern American Architecture ; [on the occasion of the exhibition "Visionaries & Displaced, Austrian Traces in Modern American Architecture" at the Kunsthalle Wien, 24 February to 16 April 1995]

content.text: Property in digital society. Property rights cover private law in two different discourses, largely decoupled from one another. General civil law and intellectual property law are hardly in dialogue. The intensively discussed, well-prepared prerequisites and limits for precise and differentiated assignment of intangible goods are only insufficiently fruitful for the scope of property. In doing so, the digital society challenges property rights overall. The boundaries between physical and non-physical objects are disintegrating. This raises the fundamental question of the individual assignment of (immaterial) goods. The volume is the result of an intradisciplinary conference, in which the function, scope, structural design and conditions of exercise of property rights are fundamentally discussed with a broad audience and the separate discourses in the law of intellectual property and general civil law have been merged. Property rights and intellectual property rights are discussed in two different, largely disrupted, discourses. This volume deals with the function, scope, structure design, and the law of the law into the private law.
content.title_en: Ownership in the digital society

content.text: Deportations document and exhibit: new concepts of visualisation of Shoah and Porajmos. Klappentext: How can Shoah and Porajmos be documented in a contemporary way in Germany and Europe, exhibited and taught in educational offers? The volume presents innovative forms of representation and mediation that involve the multi-layered memory-cultural concepts in the countries of the initial and target locations of deportations, but also regional-historical specifics of the persecution of Jews, Sintize and Sinti, Roma and Romnja. The possibilities and challenges of digitalization, participation, inclusion and social diversity on content and presentation forms are discussed. The focus is on processes of origin and conceptions, the design and public reception of exhibitions in museums, memorials and memorial sites. The effects, potentials and perspectives of digital media and projects are also included.
content.title_en: Deportations document and exhibit : new concepts of visualisation of Shoah and Porajmos

content.title_en: Technicalization of care : 4. Goldegger Dialogue Forum Human and finiteness

content.text: The focus of the conference is on the topics of communication and image processing in automation: selected contributions from the annual colloquium KommA and BVAu 2020. This open access conference volume contains the best contributions of the 11th annual colloquium "Communication in Automation" (KomA 2020) and the 7th annual colloquium "Image processing in automation" (BVAu 2020). The colloquium took place on 28 and 29 October 2020 and was organized for the first time as a digital web event on the Innovation Campus Lemgo. The presented latest research results in the fields of industrial communication technology and image processing expand the current state of the art of research and technology. The vivid application examples from the field of automation contained in the contributions set the results in direct application. The editor Prof. Dr. Jürgen Jasperneite is on the board of the Institute of Industrial Information Technology - inIT of the Technical University Ostwestfalen-Lippe (TH-OWL) and leads the Fraunhofer IOSB-INA. At TH-OWL he represents the field of computer networks with a focus on industrial automation and networking. The field of industrial systems.
content.title_en: Communication and image processing in automation : selected contributions of the annual colloquia Komma and BVAu 2020

content.text: Digital learning in primary school III: didactics in discussion. The digitalization of society and thus of school is continuing to progress. In this context, the extracurricular use of digital applications has become a normality. Pupils:inside, teachers, parents and many actors:inside use a multitude of digital applications in their everyday lives. This can and should be reflected in the field of institutional learning as part of the social world. In order to shed more light on the potential of digital applications, ideas and findings from leading scientists at the symposium "Learning Digital" at the Technical University of Chemnitz were for the third time, in 2021:in and committed practitioners:in-house gathered and discussed. The intensified networking beyond the didactics of subject matter has once again enabled activities and insights to be gathered that reflect on the use of digital media not only from a media didactic and/or educational perspective, but primarily take into account subject-didactic questions.
content.title_en: Digital learning in primary school III : Subject didactics in discussion

content.text: Transforming Mobility - What Next? : technical and business aspects. At the 13th Science Forum Mobility in Duisburg, the conference volume was discussed in June 2021 on the transformation of the automotive industry and the mobility industry. The conference volume presents contributions from the Science Forum at the interfaces of business and engineering research and shows how companies can shape the transformation. The editor Prof. Dr. Heike Proff, holder of the Chair of ABWL & Internationale Automobilmanagement, with the participation of Prof. Dr. Frederik Ahlemann, Prof. Dr. Ellen Geschlemann, Prof. Dr. Jutta Geldermann, Prof. Dr.-Ing. Holger Hirsch, Prof. Dr. Pedro José Marrón, PD Dr. habil. Ani Melkonyan-Gottschalk, Prof. Dr.-Ing. Bernd Noche, Prof. Dr. Alexander Schmidt, Prof. Dr.-Ing. Dieter Schramm, Prof. Dr.-Ing. Dirk Wittowsky, Prof. Dr. Andreas Wömpener, all University of Duisburg-Essen Transforming Mobility Management - Transformation Mobility - Transformation
content.title_en: Transforming Mobility - What Next? : Technical and business aspects

content.text: New world - other politics? : political science surveying attempts. Klappentext: Due to multiple crises, the national and international framework conditions of political action have changed fundamentally. How important are these developments for the function and performance of democracy? How has politics so far reacted to this, what are central problem areas and possible options for action? The volume discusses these questions from the point of view of political theory, comparative government theory and international relations and thus contributes to the political science "re-measurement" of a world that is determined by increasing uncertainty.
content.title_en: New world - other policies? : political science survey

content.text: Emperor Charles V and the Holy Roman Empire: Normativity and structural change of an imperial system of rule at the beginning of the modern era. The Roman-German emperor and King Charles V (as King of Spain Charles I) from the House of Habsburg is one of the most interesting and powerful rulers of the early modern era. The expansion of his domain beyond the Old World, the structuring of his power structure in the Holy Roman Empire, in Spain and Italy, as well as the handling of the person Martin Luther and the Lutheran Reformation are only some characteristic aspects. Beyond the large area of study here, Charles V's references to Saxony and other German territories were also taken into consideration. Charles V was a determined opponent of the Reformation by virtue of his constitution and for his own reasons of faith. Above all, in this segment, the Leipzig Academy research and edition work meets with international Charles' research. The concept is emphasized interdisciplinary, comparative-international and multi-lingual.
content.title_en: Emperor Charles V and the Holy Roman Empire : Normativity and structural change of an imperial system of rule at the beginning of modern times

content.text: The cultural diversity of the university's free space and landscape: perception, participation, appropriation and design. Introduction -- Culturally shaped perceptions – theoretical-methodological approaches -- Cultural diversity in the use and appropriation of free space -- Intercultural design -- Cultural diversity in participation processes -- Cultural diversity in special types of free space -- Conclusion/Conclusions/Outlook. To capture cultural diversity in free space and landscape in its complexity means to think of spaces of different social groups and milieus, of values, practices and ways of life. Free spaces and landscapes are understood as a venue as well as a product of social action. At the same time, the cultural orders of space and the associated power relations are questioned. In cities and metropolitan regions, the globalization processes and migration movements of the past decades have led to a new cultural diversity. People of different socialization use public free spaces in common, but not always in the same way. In practices, artifacts, discourses and subjectivizations, culture and thus spatial constructions are visible. At the interface between theory and practice, the authors of this landscape and of different dimensions.
content.title_en: Cultural diversity in open space and landscape : perception, participation, appropriation and design

content.text: The pandemic situation of the past years has stimulated a discourse on digitality as a substitute for the presence in which the problems of physical absence become more obvious for society. This discourse also makes it clear in historical research that a void is involved. The question arises as to how the absence of a ruler, the absence of ritual, was processed by a society whose constituent element was directly affected by it. This conference volume is devoted to the question of the concrete place of presence and the dimensions of absence. At the same time, it opens the question in a temporal and theoretical way to the interdisciplinary dialogue in order to explore the potential of this new question.
content.title_en: Absence and Presence

content.text: From genes and people: who we are and could become.What influence does genetics have on the four pillars of human existence: origin, identity, health and nature? How genetic research shapes our ideas of human diversity and its origin, from freedom to individual life-form and the position of man in nature, is the author: in various disciplines. Discourse and informative, this richly illustrated volume offers an insight into genetic research and its socio-political effects, combining perspectives from natural, social and cultural sciences as well as art.With essays, literary contributions and interviews by and with: Peter Berz, Frank Buchholz, Sheree Domingo, Constantin Goschler, Donna Haraway, Johannes Krause, Thomas Lemke, Christian Kosmas Mayer, Kerstin Palm, Tino Plümecke, Gudrun Rappold, Christoph Rehmann-Sutter, Hans-Jörg Rheinberger, Volker Roelcke, Christina Schües, Christian Schwarke, Mihai Surdu, Joan Rehmann-Slot, Joan Wu.
content.title_en: Of genes and humans : who we are and could become

content.text: On the way to a New Enlightenment: a plea for future-oriented humanities. What role can the humanities play in shaping our common future? What values do we take in the 21st century? How can we use the potential of the humanities in a time of diverse crises? The authors ask themselves these fundamental questions and locate the answers in a new understanding of the humanities, which align their thinking and their imagination with criteria of a future worth living. These humanities put themselves in the service of all life on our planet and are thus able to bring new, binding values into society and to resolutely oppose the destruction of our environment.
content.title_en: Towards a New Enlightenment: a plea for future-oriented humanities

content.text: Prevention, decriminalisation, social work: alternatives to criminalisation. The media report dramatically rising crime rates, correspondingly the fear of criminal offences is growing in the population. The detention centres, especially the detention centres, are overcrowded. Procuratorates and courts complain about an immense work attack. Criminal justice, it seems, has reached the limits of its capacity. The official crime fight against crime by criminalization promises remedy. One of the issues is an economically meaningful privatization of this area, but also cost-effective, non-free-depriving forms of responses to criminality and better ways of preventing crime. However, in view of the societal challenges of the 21st century, it seems more urgent than ever to develop an overall criminal policy concept to which the authors want to contribute with this volume.
content.title_en: Prevention, decriminalisation, social work : alternatives to criminalisation

content.text: Garden futures : designing with nature. Gardens have always been places of recreation, pleasure and production. As an expression of identities, dreams and visions, they have deep cultural roots and great symbolic significance. If the garden has been increasingly becoming the focus of social interest for some years, it is not only a romantic refuge, but also an experimental space for future ideas. This book examines the garden as a place where we shape our relationship to nature. .. The garden also as an experimental field for concepts of social justice and a more sustainable future.
content.title_en: Garden futures : designing with nature

content.text: Digital teaching and learning in specialist classes: current developments, objects and processes. The volume bundles contributions that illuminate aspects of digital teaching and learning in selected subjects, disciplines and educational institutions at the theoretical/empirical level. The volume bundles contributions that shed light on the aspects of digital teaching and learning in subjects, disciplines and educational institutions selected at the theoretical/empirical level. Basic questions of digital teaching and learning are discussed as well as necessary teacher competences and questions of technology acceptance, digital data literacy and open educational practices. To this end, work (1) from the CODIP project, (2) from further projects on digitality at Leuphana University Lüneburg and (3) from other Lower Saxony projects will be presented.
content.title_en: Digital teaching and learning in the field of technical education: current developments, objects and processes

content.text: Singularity in pluralism: colonialism, Holocaust and the second historian's dispute. Since 2020, the German feuilleton and the sciences have been raging in the "second historian's dispute". The debate is often centred on the uniqueness and comparability of the Holocaust and the importance of colonialism for the present. The dispute is less fuelled by historical facts, but rather by the questions of the present. In particular, the state of Israel and the "German state raeson" are often at the centre of the debates. The volume of the collection brings together contributions from various disciplines and international perspectives to the discussions of the present day, thus offering a broad panorama and insight into the state of discussions.
content.title_en: Singularity in the plural : Colonialism, Holocaust and the Second Historian Dispute

content.text: Klio has now Internet: historical narratives on YouTube – presentation, staging, negotiation. History videos on Youtube have gained enormous reach for the transmission of historical and political content. The problem: from a scientific perspective, these videos are not always technical and normatively valid. As phenomena of history culture, they convey historical orientations to the recipients, from which action-guided motives can arise. This results in the necessity not only to consume history representations on YouTube, but also to reflect and understand in their overall social relevance. Therefore, the volume is dedicated to media productions, historical cultural negotiation processes and the epoch specificity of historical representations on Youtube. In order to pool the expertise on these topics, the volume gathers eight scientific contributions to an interdisciplinary review. From this perspective, the volume aims to contribute to the determination of the relationship between history science and popular media and the resulting challenges.
content.title_en: Klio now has Internet: historical narratives on Youtube – representation, staging, negotiation

content.text: Always on: Seduction and danger of digital media. Especially the enormous possibilities and the diverse offer of the Internet ensure that many people get lost or lost in it. This up-to-date book offers practical background knowledge and valuable tips for competent and careful handling for parents, young people and everyone who is active on the Internet. Because it is clear: prohibitions and restrictions usually do not bring much. Much more important and effective is the strengthening of the skills and skills of the users:inside, so that they can optimally use the positive possibilities of the Internet for themselves, but also the risks and dangers can be properly assessed and acted accordingly - from social media and online shop to artificial intelligence, binge watching and much more.A current non-fiction book for the digital everyday life, which reveals seductions and dangers and gives the reader the appropriate tools in order to handle them correctly - completely without prohibitions and defamations. â danger recognized, danger banned - digital competence instead of prohibitions â knowledge of experts with continuous practical reference â top current: from binge watching and artificial to intelligence
content.title_en: Always on : Seduction and danger of digital media

content.text: Future Elbe - River and Settlement Area : 1st IÖR Symposium on 14/15 October 1993 in Dresden. The contributions cover the state of the Elbe and its landscape area, spatial and landscape ecology tasks, the economic development of the Elbe area and the controversial discussion that has been held in recent times for the development of the Elbe as a shipping route. In a panel discussion that concluded the conference, the contradictory views of the spatial folders and water builders, respectively the opponents and supporters of an expansion, became clear. For the Elbe there is a risk of erosion, which can be well covered by modern computer technology. Discussion topics were the need for the Elbe to expand in terms of future traffic development, predictability of the effects and appropriateness of the planning procedures as well as the costs and benefits of the expansion.
content.title_en: Future Elbe - Riverscape and settlement area : 1st IÖR Symposium on 14 and 15 October 1993 in Dresden

content.text: Stadtträume - Traumstädte : Conference volume of the 50th annual conference of the Southwest German Working Group for Urban History Research. The contributions of the volume span a wide range of concepts from early modern ideal and planned cities to visions of the city of the future. They deal, among other things, with ideal and planned cities in the German southwest, with the "small city" in transition to modernism, the legal framework of municipal infrastructure planning in the 19th century and the urbanist prestige project of the GDR Halle-Neustadt. The tension between globalization and the emphasis on local identities, the problems of social segregation as well as the vision of a humane city in which social functionality and individual wishes are compatible, point to present and future challenges
content.title_en: City Dreams - Dream Cities : Conference volume of the 50th Annual Meeting of the Southwest German Working Group for Urban History Research

content.text: The following articles are published in the "Law and Time" conference.The contributions of the conference "Law and Time" follow the intuition that time is normatively relevant.In law, this is shown, for example, by the fact that criminal offences and claims are statute-barred or that the criminal liability is quantified in time with the current and life-long imprisonment.The contributions examine where and how time plays a role in law and whether there are legal phenomena that can only be explained by an appropriate normative time-understanding.In recent times, an increased interest in law and the critique of law within the critical theory can be noted (in particular Christoph Menke and Daniel Loick).The contributions under the title "Critical Theory(s) of Law" are based on right-philosopherical texts of the Frankfurt School are relatively interrogated with their own topicalities and the critical theories within the context of the Frankfurt School.
content.title_en: Time Dimensions and Critical Theory(s) of Law : Meetings of the Young Forum on Legal Philosophy (JFR) in the International Association for Legal and Social Philosophy (IVR) in September 2020 in Munich and in May 2021 in Braunschweig and Hamburg

content.text: On intervention: Afghanistan and its consequences. Klappentext: In the summer of 2021 NATO troops left Afghanistan after almost two decades. On 15 August of that year, the Taliban took power. Since then, the question has been discussed whether and to what extent international humanitarian, political and military engagement in Afghanistan has failed. This book takes stock. It gathers contributions from German-speaking social and legal scientists: women who have researched over the last two decades and in Afghanistan. It examines the knowledge behind the intervention and what ideas shape current discussions about its failure. The contributions illustrate the multiplicity and often contradictory demands and motivations of the intervention actors. They illustrate how Afghans and Afghans experienced the developments. And they highlight the importance of Afghanistan's interventions within the intervening societies. Thus, it becomes clear that the question of the balance sheet is above all a question of perspective and the legacy of intervention goes beyond their military failure.
content.title_en: Intervention: Afghanistan and its consequences

content.title_en: Architecture, atmosphere, perception : the Roman villa as an opportunity for building today

content.text: New developments in the German language corpus landscape: Contributions to the IDS Method Fair 2022. The contributions to the Method Fair of the 2022 Annual Meeting of the Leibniz Institute for German Language provide an overview of the current corpus landscape in Germanic linguistics: from historical collections of authentic language data on current newspaper and social media corpora, conversation corpora, corpora from texts from German learners to a corpus with texts of light language and a sign language corpus. The contributions explain the design criteria and the methodology of data collection and give an insight into how the data can be used linguistically.
content.title_en: New developments in the Germanistics corpus landscape : Contributions to the IDS Method Fair 2022

content.text: 23. Dresdener Kreis Elektroenergieversorgung : Accompanying volume for the workshop 2022 in Magdeburg : [15. to 16. March 2022]. On 15 and 16 March 2022, a conference was held at the Otto von Guericke University Magdeburg of the Dresdener Kreis 2022. Traditionally, research groups from the universities of Hanover, Duisburg-Essen, Dresden and Magdeburg meet on these days. The most important part of the conference is the lecture block in which academic staff of all universities give an insight into their research. In this collection volume, the papers of the corresponding scientific work are brought together. Further information on the Dresdener Kreis 2022 in Magdeburg are also summarized.
content.title_en: 23. Dresdener Kreis Elektroenergieversorgung : Support tape for the workshop 2022 in Magdeburg : [15. to 16. March 2022]

content.text: Transformation in tourism: perspectives for a resilient and sustainable experience economy. "With extensive travel bans, travel restrictions and the on-site infection, travelers were particularly affected by the Covid-19 pandemic - and with them all people who work in the leisure and tourism sector. Despite easy relaxation, the industry should resist considerations and strategies based on a pure return to a previous normality. How the change towards a resilient and sustainable tourism can succeed, the contributions of this volume illuminate with current market analyses, case studies and best practices. - Transformation & Digitalization: Which structural and digital developments offer new opportunities? - Tourism in the context of the Covid-19 pandemic: What impulses and effects remain relevant? - Experience economy: How can the relationship of tourism to nature, climate and economy be redefined? - Outdoor and adventure tourism: What innovative ideas and offers promise sustainable success? An exciting cross-section of current tourism research, which combines the latest concepts and future approaches with diverse concrete industry insights."
content.title_en: Transformation in tourism : Perspectives for a resilient and sustainable experience economy

content.text: The following is a short story about the history of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art of the art
content.title_en: Dynamic young people as hopeful and argument in the early modern age

content.text: 15th Aachen Conference Water Technology : Procedures for Wastewater Treatment and Water Treatment. The latest developments from application-oriented research and experience from long-term operation of large-scale facilities in the field of water treatment and wastewater treatment are the focus of this conference volume.The written versions of the expert contributions of the 15th AACHENER MEETING WASSERTECHNOLOGY reflect the current state of research and technology and provide an insight into the current discussion of technical-economic aspects as well as political and legal framework conditions.The current tasks of the water sector Drinking Water Treatment, Desalination, Elimination of Traces, Treatment of Industrial Waste Water and Energy Optimization are compared here with membrane, Adsorption and Oxidation processes, as well as combination and new processes.
content.title_en: 15th Aachen Conference on Water Technology : Wastewater Treatment and Water Treatment

content.text: Transport centre: Documentation of a workshop in the framework of the project "Decision Fields of Urban Future" on 8 and 9 December 1994 in Stuttgart. Centrality and accessibility are essential conditions for the economic competitiveness of cities and regions. European integration, the opening of Eastern Europe, the German unification, but also technical developments such as fast-track and telecommunications networks can influence the accessibility conditions, the "location" of cities. The impact of these developments was one of the questions of the workshop. The papers, which dealt with the trans-European networks, the importance of integrated high-speed systems in Europe and the transport projects of German unity, tried to give an answer to this question. A presentation on the limits of accessibility was pre-arranged. For two reasons, the contribution was at the beginning of the lecture series: one to introduce the situation and the general developments in the transport sector. On the other hand, the considerations on the limits of accessibility should form the background of the further discussion.
content.title_en: Transport centre: Documentation of a workshop in the context of the project "Decision Fields of Urban Future" on 8 and 9 December 1994 in Stuttgart

content.text: The Theology in the face of the Digital: The Theology of the World - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders - The Divine Disorders.
content.title_en: Theology in the face of the digital: Contributions to the theological challenges of digitality and digitalization

content.text: The mechanisms of innovation in the monastic life of the high Middle Ages. Those who research the sustainable new, i.e. innovative ones that cross the system borders, hardly get past the monasteries of the 12th and 13th centuries for the Middle Ages. The monastic culture opened up areas of the first and unknown, in which experiences had to be gathered to handle the innovatively won. This resulted in, among other things, lighthouses of technical progress, a new handling of writing, a new statute law, regulated procedures or ritual solutions supported by creative hybrid models.The band deliberately does not focus on the innovations that have already been studied several times. Rather, he asks in which system connections innovations in monastic life worked, i.e. why they were created and how they were promoted, carried, inhibited or even destroyed.
content.title_en: Mechanisms of Innovative in the monastic life of the High Middle Ages

content.text: The renewable energy sources and hydrogen technology 2023 : Conference volume : 30th Energy Symposium on renewable energy sources and hydrogen technology, Stralsund, 08-10 November 2023. The conference volume of the REGWA Conference 2023 documents the 30th anniversary of the symposium on "Regenerative Energy and Hydrogen Technologies" at Stralsund University. The target groups are interested in discussing the current state of innovative developments in the field of renewable energy and hydrogen technologies. The conference volume includes contributions to legal developments in the energy transition as well as to hydrogen projects, decarbonisation of heat supply, storage technologies, electromobility and electricity grids. The target groups are interested parties who would like to discuss the current status of innovative developments in the field of renewable energy and hydrogen technologies at Stralsund University of Applied Sciences.
content.title_en: Use of renewable energy sources and hydrogen technology 2023 : Conference volume : 30th Energy Symposium Use of renewable energy sources and hydrogen technology, Stralsund, 08-10 November 2023

content.text: AI:Text: Discourses about AI text generators. When artificial intelligence (AI) can generate texts, what does it say about what a text is? What are the differences between texts written by humans and AI generated texts? What are the expectations, fears and hopes of science when AI-generated texts are received and recognized in their discourses, whose authorship and originality are no longer clearly definable? How does work with sources change and what consequences result for the criteria of scientific text work and the understanding of science as a whole? What are the opportunities, limits and risks of AI text generators from the point of view of technology ethics and technology assessment? And what criteria are there for an ethically conscious approach to AI text generators in the educational context? These and similar questions illustrate the complexity and scope of the challenge posed by the ever-growing and increasingly self-evident use of AI text generators for future work with and texts? Here, problems are crystallized out that address a broad spectrum of disciplines whose specific discourses are examined in this volume.
content.title_en: AI:Text : Discourses about AI text generators

content.text: English Linguistics and Subject Didactics in Dialogue : Opportunities for strengthening teacher education. Based on current research and teaching projects, this collection systematically presents reference points between linguistics, subject didactics and school English teaching, thus contributing to the further development of the current debate on coherence and professionalization in foreign language teaching. The contributions assigned to the main areas of English as a language system, English as a world language, English as a language of learners and teachers as well as English corpus linguistics and didactics discuss which linguistic content, methods and tools are particularly relevant for English teaching and how these can be used for the professionalization of (coming) teachers. Thus, the volume serves as an idea collection and hand-out for all actors in the field of foreign language teaching.
content.title_en: English Linguistics and Subject Didactics in Dialogue : Opportunities for Strengthening Teacher Education

content.text: Remembrance culture and Holocaust Education in digital transformation: georeferenced documentation, memory and mediation projects. The memory of National Socialism and the Holocaust is constantly transformed. This change is gaining in importance as is the development of digital Holocaust Education. This is reflected not least in ever new digital mediating offers and georeferenced web applications, in which places of memory are marked on digital maps and further information is provided in the sense of deep mapping. The contributors discuss these developments critically and present the different aspects of digital georeferenced documentation, memory and mediation projects.
content.title_en: Remembrance culture and Holocaust Education in digital transformation : georeferenced documentation, memory and mediation projects

content.text: Climate change and the damage caused by the construction of the Worms Synagogue. Global climate change is felt worldwide and is the focus of public perception with extreme competition events and their economic and partly life-threatening consequences. The threats to cultural heritage caused by summer heat and long-lasting dry periods are less noticeable. The Worms Synagogue, part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site SchUM-Statten, is affected by this kind of damage. The static security measures visible in the synagogue courtyard of the exterior building and at the vaults of the Westjoch of the building rebuilt in 1961 are particularly vividly illustrated by the threat posed by the laying of foundations in the area of the foundations as a result of the progressive drying out of the soil. At the initiative of the Landesdenkmalpflege and the Institute for Stone Conservation e. V. in 2023 a two-day conference took place, which in particular the scientific studies already carried out at the Worms Synagogue and the findings gained from it. Special attention was given to the foundation of the synagogue, under the construction of the framework of the garden of the medieval plant, which involves the use of the scientific research, the use of the local history, and of the scientific research, to the future.
content.title_en: Climate change and structural damage caused by the construction of the Worms synagogue

content.text: Knowledge in electronic networks : structuring, development and retrieval of information resources on the Internet ; a selection of lectures from the 19th Annual Meeting of the Gesellschaft für Classification, Basel 1995. The Internet was the focal point of the bibliographical conference of the Gesellschaft für Klassikation in Basel. In a further training course, the search possibilities with Veronica in Gopher entries, with search engines and catalogues on the Worldwide Web and with WWW-based online library catalogs were demonstrated. The problems of intellectual and machine methods of structuring, the development and retrieval of information resources on the Internet were illustrated in in in-depth lectures. Referred to clearinghouse concepts using the example of social sciences, so-called virtual libraries using the example of information on the subject of forest, automatic classification methods using the example of WAIS databases and the possible further development of hypertext methods for structuring knowledge. <dt.>
content.title_en: Knowledge in electronic networks : structuring, development and retrieval of information resources on the Internet ; a selection of lectures of the 19th Annual Meeting of the Society for Classification, Basel 1995

content.text: Design for Modernism : Hellerau: Stand Ort Bestimmung ; [Documentation of a conference in Hellerau 1995]. The garden town Hellerau (today belonging to Dresden) and its buildings on the festival grounds represent a social and culturally historical and urban-architecturally extraordinary monument. The festival hall designed by Heinrich Tessenow became the intellectual-cultural centre of Hellerau. Built from 1909, above all this festival building and its artists' houses are today in a worrying state. The present documentation reflects the attempt of the conference initiators (Wüstenrot Stiftung, Kulturstiftung Sachsen, Förderverein Hellerau) to promote the matter together in an active memory of Hellerau's unresolved reform content. It is important to formulate on the basis of new ideas and concepts perspectives, this unique cultural ensemble of European rank in the sense of the workshop idea for open uses and supra-regional activities "intolerant to monuments", i.e. without exhausting the traces of history, to develop further.
content.title_en: Draft on Modernism : Hellerau: Status Location Determination ; [Documentation of a conference in Hellerau 1995]

content.text: Architecture as a political culture : philosophia practica. Architecture has been used or interpreted time and again as an expression of political self-representation. Examples from antiquity served as architectural monuments of modernism. The authors of this volume discuss the influence of political and philosophical concepts on the aesthetics of building.
content.title_en: Architecture as a political culture : philosophia practica

content.text: Cross-border cooperation in regional and regional planning: Russian-German seminar in St. Petersburg. In the close interplay of planning practice and planning science, opportunities and problems of cross-border planning cooperation are presented on the various spatial scale levels from the Russian and German point of view and improvements in planning cooperation are shown. The spectrum ranges from urban-Umland cooperation, interregional cooperation to cooperation that transcends national borders and national borders. The contributions of the volume show that specific problem constellations in the sub-areas require "suitable" solutions. Especially in the difficult cross-border planning questions, personalities in responsible positions with ideas and commitment are important. The contributions have also shown that there are a wealth of common, almost uniform phenomena and problems. There is on the one hand the tension between growing spatial concentration of the population in the agglomeration areas. On the other hand, there is natural competition between large and small cities, between equally strong cities and regions.
content.title_en: Cross-border cooperation in regional and regional planning : Russian-German seminar in St. Petersburg
Professional objective: Engineer : A departure into the technology

content.text: Media, Communication and Urban Development : Documentation of a workshop in the context of the project "Decision Fields of Urban Future" on 18 and 19 January 1996 in Karlsruhe. The potentials for urban development associated with the media and communication industry have been growing since the beginning of the 1980s. In contrast to the structural crisis of classical industries, the economic sectors associated with concepts such as "telematics", "multimedia", "interactive services" convey the image of a strong and promising area. The workshop "Media, Communication and Urban Development", which took place with the participation of urban developers and economic promoters from eleven German cities in the context of the project "Decision Fields of Urban Future", focused on the application aspect. It was necessary to examine which areas of action could be opened up to the municipalities, in which development opportunities exist, who the relevant actors are and, in conclusion, whether and how municipal options are linked to overarching developments.
content.title_en: Media, Communication and Urban Development : Documentation of a workshop in Karlsruhe on 18 and 19 January 1996 in the context of the project "Decision Fields of Urban Future"

content.text: Western and Eastern Europe on the way to EMU: Accession problems against the background of economic transformation and fiscal convergence criteria; Ifo/IfW Symposium from 9 to 11 December 1996 in Munich. This book was produced in cooperation with the Institute for the World Economy, Budapest. It deals with the integration of Western and Eastern Europe into EMU. The focus is on economic transformation and fiscal convergence criteria. Of great importance are the accelerating structural adjustment process and the rapid development of capital markets and banking as a framework for the transformation process.
content.title_en: Western and Eastern Europe on the way to EMU: accession problems in the context of economic transformation and fiscal convergence criteria; Ifo/IfW symposium from 9 to 11 December 1996 in Munich

content.text: The principle of sustainable development in spatial planning. This publication documents the 19th seminar for regional planners in Bavaria in October 1996 in Nördlingen, which contains the basic principles and the shorter and more detailed statements in three working groups. The basic principles are concerned with the concept and the approaches of sustainable spatial development and raise current questions. First experiences and possible applications of the concept in Bavaria, Austria and Switzerland are presented. The statements of the working groups refer to the implementation of the sustainability principle in urban and free space development, economic development and in infrastructure development. Here fundamental problems as well as experiences in individual regions are shown and solutions presented.
content.title_en: The principle of sustainable development in spatial planning

content.text: The volume deals with two workshops organized by the IRS (22 February and 23 May 1996) on the construction and planning history of the GDR, which dealt with the research and collection work on the building and planning history of the GDR. The first conference was devoted to institutional exchange of ideas and information, with debates on the historical processing and the virulent question of their relevance to planning for the current urban and regional development. The second conference of the heads of archives and collections was intended to identify the scientific collections of the IRS in the course of its construction within the institute, and the other was to be informed about existing stocks or existing extensions. In addition to the conference contributions, the volume contains a compilation of institutions that have stocks available for the construction and planning history of the GDR. It provides information on contacts, types and scope of the holdings and their utilization possibilities.
content.title_en: In the thicket of the archives : Research and collection work on the construction and planning history of the GDR : (Conference documentation)

content.text: Exegesis and Method Discussion. Exegesis and Method Discussion provides a manual-like overview of new exegetical approaches. The 14 contributions by German, Austrian, Swiss and American exegetes share the interdisciplinary interest in conducting exegesis in the current scientific discourse. The essays are written as introductions to the respective field and are excellent for academic teaching.
content.title_en: Exegesis and Methodological Discussion

content.text: The "Student" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "St." of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of the "Stairs" of
content.title_en: Culture from the margins of society : from the practice of authentic theatre work ; [model project "Sustainability prevention by former drug addicts and relapse prevention for former drug addicts as a cultural pedagogical task"; within the framework of the model project the second conference on the topic "Authentic Theatre" took place from 24. - 26.11.1997 in Flözlingen/Rottweil]

content.text: Land use competition on site - Land management as a municipal and regional task : Documentation of the contributions to a regional seminar of the German Institute for Urban Studies and the Municipal Association of Greater Hanover on 27 and 28 May 1997 in Hanover. Qualitative and quantitatively efficient land management, in which not only the different usage requirements are brought to a balance to the areas, but also with land and soil is treated sparingly and gently, with soil sealing being limited to the necessary level, is a central component of sustainable settlement and land development in urban regions. Supported by the municipal association Greater Hanover, which has long been in an intensive coordination process with its members from the core city of Hanover, the district of Hanover and the many individual municipalities, the German Institute of Urban Studies organized a seminar on the topic of land management, which is documented in the publication. The individual contributions and discussions showed on the one hand how difficult a regional area management between municipal planning sovereignty and regional overall responsibility was. On the other hand, however, it became clear which central importance regional area management has for sustainable settlement development.
content.title_en: Land use competition on site - Land management as a municipal and regional task : Documentation of the contributions to a regional seminar of the German Institute for Urban Studies and the local association Greater Hannover on 27 and 28 May 1997 in Hanover

content.text: Organised crime and constitutional state: Annual meeting from 19 September to 21 September 1997 in Karlsruhe. While some people see the rule of law as less threatening the rights of individuals on the part of the state than in insufficient protection of these rights by the state, others fear that the phenomenon of organised crime (OK) is being used to weaken civil rights in a more modest manner. Both the speakers and the participants in the panel discussion agreed, however, that organised crime has taken a serious cross-border development.
content.title_en: Organized crime and constitutional state : Annual meeting from 19 September to 21 September 1997 in Karlsruhe

content.text: Rural areas in Lower Saxony: focus on tasks and approaches to action. The spatial structural developments in Germany have led to very different structures and development conditions in rural areas. These structural problems represent a spatial policy challenge and require integrated and coordinated policies in various fields of action. In this report volume of the Regional Planning Conference Lower Saxony 1998, the central urban structure, an ÖPNV concept and regional tourism management are shown as areas of action and approaches to solutions as building blocks for the strategies in rural areas.
content.title_en: Rural areas in Lower Saxony : Areas of responsibility and approaches

content.text: Historical-thematic cartography : Concepts, methods, applications. In 1998 Dietrich Ebeling organized a conference on historical-thematic cartography in the digital age. The papers were published very quickly in a conference volume which provides an extremely interesting insight into the latest developments and ongoing projects in the field of computer-aided historical cartography. [Johannes Dörflinger (Cartographic News 49, 1999)]
content.title_en: Historical-thematical cartography : concepts, methods, applications

content.text: Ecology, Economics and Jurisprudence. Environmental Economics and Environmental Policy / Joachim Klaus -- Basic Environmental Problems from a Legal Perspective / Rüdiger Breuer -- Environmental Certificates / Alfred Endres -- Environmental Certificates / Alexander Blankenagel -- Environmental Policy in Practice / Lutz Wicke -- Environmental Policy in Practice / Andreas Troge -- Environmental Protection at the Punch of the Social Market Economy / Edgar Michael Wenz
content.title_en: Ecology, Economy and Jurisprudence

content.text: Artificial temptation : Nylon, Perlon, Dederon; [A guide book to the exhibition at the Haus der Geschichte der Bundesrepublik Deutschland, Bonn, 23 April to 22 August 1999]. Rich illustrated guide book to the exhibition (until 22.8.1999) in Bonn's "Haus der Geschichte der Bundesrepublik Deutschland". It uses the development of polyamide fibres invented in America and Germany at the same time (1938) and their influence on fashion and lifestyle as a red thread through contemporary history since 1945, and also as a demonstration object for the comparison of the economic systems of the Federal Republic of Germany and the GDR. Some of the contributors bear different glasses: Here the gently amused review of economic miracle, petticoat and nyltest fashion in the West, there a critical analysis of the state-driven, environmentally harmful chemical production in the service of socialism and of their modest contribution to the raising of living standards.
content.title_en: Artificial temptation : Nylon, Perlon, Dederon ; [A guidebook to the exhibition at the Haus der Geschichte der Bundesrepublik Deutschland, Bonn, 23 April to 22 August 1999]

content.text: The challenge of libraries through electronic media and new forms of organisation. Verlagsinfo: "The library world is at a stage of change and reorientation. Libraries must define how they can adequately fulfil their basic functions in the new information world. This claim can only be met before the foil of a probably permanent transformation, if it succeeds in really re-shaping the relationships with users, authors, publishers and bookshops. Thus, the "classical" library tasks change: collecting, opening up, keeping available and securing materials. Electronic media cannot be collected and stored according to conventional patterns. And how can the formal closure of these publications be organized in practice? (Beitrag R. Weber). How and at what price can libraries provide information and documents electronically or conventionally in the future?"
content.title_en: The challenge of libraries through electronic media and new forms of organisation

Klappentext: The Central Institute for Art History publishes a publication 50 years after the end of the war, which first breaks down the history and function of Nazi buildings at Königsplatz in Munich. The publication combines scientific and informational texts by art historians with essayist-narrative contributions by prominent writers and journalists.
content.title_en: Bureaucracy and cult : the party center of the NSDAP at Königsplatz in Munich; history and reception

content.title_en: Imagining Europe: the European single market as a cultural and economic task

content.text: Protection of intellectual property in Central and Eastern European countries: the legal situation in Bulgaria, CSFR, Hungary, Poland and Romania; [originally prepared for a conference held in Munich on 8-10 July 1992]. the introduction of reform elements in the copyright law in Bulgaria; or the new patent law, industrial design law and competition law in Romania. Poland and Hungary, in the socialist Aera pioneer in the field of the modernization of intellectual property, are therefore also faced with the task of modernising important aspects of the copyright law. In summary, the study can only draw a current picture, since in the future significant developments in this field can be expected. This report illustrates in a comprehensive overview the intensive attempts of Bulgaria, Czechoslovakia, Hungary, Poland and Romania to improve the legislation on intellectual property protection. These measures take place against the background of serious political controversy, especially between political and economic interests, and enormous economic and social problems. In spite of these obstacles, the new rules have already been achieved in some cases.
content.title_en: Protection of intellectual property in Central and Eastern European countries : the legal situation in Bulgaria, CSFR, Hungary, Poland and Romania ; [originally prepared for a conference hero in Munich on 8-10 July 1992]

content.text: Sustainable urban development: Concepts and projects. In urban areas ecological concepts and needs of the city society seem to be incompatible. "Sustainability" does not represent an operationalized concept of action for urban development, but rather a guiding principle and a concept of orientation. Here, city is not only outlined as a "structurally designed environment" for social, cultural and economic interactions of its inhabitants, but as a highly complex structure of perceptions, "systems of signs", meanings and meanings. Examples (Leipzig, especially Hamburg) are presented projects in the fields of energy, transport and economy and the indispensable role of citizen participation. - According to G. Schmidt-Eichstaedt: "Stadtökologie" (BA 7/97) for expanded stocks. (3) (LK/F: Lüdtke)
content.title_en: Sustainable urban development : Concepts and projects
