content.title_en: Transformation in education and European perspectives : Germany and Poland compared

content.text: Settlement structures, spatial mobility and transport: on the way to sustainability in urban regions?. In connection with the research project "Space-Time-Structures in the Modernization Process. Mobility and Transport as a vehicle and mirror image of regional and settlement development", a scientific colloquium was held in November 1998 in which transport and urban researchers, universities and other spatial institutes as well as representatives from politics and administration participated. The papers are documented - divided into three discussion blocks: On the state of empirical settlement and transport research; Specifics in the process of (sub-) urbanization of East Germany - additional inputs; Approaches of generalisation - Empirie, theory, application. In addition, a short summary of the respective discussion rounds is added.
content.title_en: Settlement structures, spatial mobility and transport: on the way to sustainability in urban regions?

content.text: The analysis of the relationships between organisations as "networks" has proved fruitful in recent years. In practice as in science, an increased interest in the management of inter-organisational networks between enterprises, funding institutions, educational and research institutions etc. is currently being heard. Economic, social and political governance issues are discussed in terms such as strategic management, group management, network controlling, governance, policy networks and context management. - - Network approach as a conceptual framework, management of enterprise networks in organizational theoretical perspective, resource management in networks, application possibilities of corporate controlling in enterprise networks, network control through selection, policy networks and context control, control through inter-organisational information and communication systems, cooperation and competition in networks, network control and complexity theory
content.title_en: Network management : concepts and practices

content.text: The volume documents the statements of the 2nd Young Forum of the Academy for Spatial Research and Regional Planning. Additional reports are submitted on the topics of the connection between socio-economic developments and regional structural change, the structural importance of information and communication networks (-technologies) and questions of the protection of free space and the reduction of land use at the expense of the open spaces. All contributions and the discussions are summarized in this report. Both rural peripheral spaces as well as old industrial spaces and metropolitan regions are discussed.
content.title_en: Future of spaces - spaces with a future?

content.text: Water survey and hydrographic information systems: Contributions to the 49th DVW seminar on 28 and 29 September 1999 at the Technical University of Dresden. The publication contains the contributions to the forty-ninth DVW seminar. In addition to the further development in the areas of locating, soldering and feeding, the focus is on sediment detection, surface-based data plausibility, the use of ECDIS and ARGO and integrated coastal zone management. (AUT)
content.title_en: Water survey and hydrographic information systems: Contributions to the 49th DVW seminar on 28 and 29 September 1999 at the Technical University of Dresden

content.text: Events: Sociology of the extraordinary. Sociology of events is en vogue (cf. Gerhard Schulze, ID 10/00). Standing in the tradition of Max Weber, the editors see the book as a contribution to a theory of late modernism and set high standards. It dates back to 2 conferences of the German Society for Sociology 1998. In 21 wide-ranging, highly interesting studies, the authors (including social pedagogues, sports scientists, sociologists) deal with the current phenomenon of so-called eventization of culture. Oriented on milieu models and the only temporal existence of "scenes", the focus is on the phenomena of youth culture (techno, pop concerts, sports), but also the Wagner Festivals are examined and examined for marketing strategies. What are these for rituals, is the central question. Scientific pre-education is required. - For expanded sociology stocks. (3) (Thomas Lutz Schweier)
content.title_en: Events : Sociology of the extraordinary

content.text: Quality development in engineering training : Workshop of the Technical University Ilmenau and the Rectors' Conference Ilmenau, 11/12 May 1999 ; [this publication was produced within the framework of the project Quality Assurance]. The conference, documented within the framework of the project Quality Assurance, contains the following individual contributions in addition to the greeting and opening words: Klemkow, Hans-Rainer: What do engineers expect from the evaluation? - EXPERIENCE REPORTS. What has proven to be the case with the evaluation? What would you do differently today? (Oswald, Bernd R. - Großekemper, Hans-Jürgen. - Claus, Volker. - Naescher, Jürgen). - Interim reports from the working groups (Working Group 1. How can quality be defined in engineering training? - What measures can quality be measured? - Working Group 2. Why does and how do you develop a guiding principle? - Working Group 3. Quality development and profiling as a means of positioning on national and international education markets. - Working Group 4. Evaluation as a basis for performance and load-oriented distribution? - Working Group 5/6. Quality development and quality control - Quality management - Quality assurance - Evaluation - Text Management)
content.title_en: Quality development in engineering training : Workshop of the Technical University of Ilmenau and the Rectors' Conference of Ilmenau, 11 and 12 May 1999 ; [this publication was published in the framework of the project Quality Assurance]

content.text: Contributions to a social-integrative housing policy: Documentation of an event of the City Day North Rhine-Westphalia and the German Institute for Urban Studies in Cologne on 30 September 1998. The main problem and action areas of a housing policy of the cities are to slow down the migration of young families with children from the core cities and to maintain socially mixed occupancy structures. The answer to the question of how we will secure municipal occupancy rights in future in view of the dramatic decline in housing with social bonds without endangering the preservation of socially mixed structures is of outstanding importance for the cities and their development opportunities. On the subject of "Integrative Housing Policy against Social Erosion in the Core Cities", the City Day North Rhine-Westphalia and the German Institute for Urban Studies conducted an event. In the course of the event, two case studies from Düsseldorf and Dortmund were discussed with the local actors, which showed that landlords, tenants, social workers and local cities need to cooperate and should not be selected isolated but integrated, partnership-based solutions.
content.title_en: Contributions for a social-integrative housing policy : Documentation of an event of the Stadttag Nordrhein-Westfalen and the German Institute for Urban Studies on 30 September 1998 in Cologne

content.text: ZimmerWelten : wie junge Menschen heute leben. As part of a project between the Westfälische Freilichtmuseum in Detmold and several institutions in Westphalia, an investigation and an exhibition on the living culture of young people were carried out. The starting point was the acquisition of 5 completely furnished youth rooms with personal objects by the museum. This can in future document the everyday living of young people in the 20th century. For the project, among others, boys and girls between 8 and 25 years were asked about their room, the furnishings, the fashion and their daily routine. These interviews are printed here, supplemented by numerous illustrations. In addition, scientifically sound contributions on the importance of children's and youth rooms, fashion, the housing facility, the social situation of children and families as well as allergens in interior spaces are provided. A final chapter provides study plans on exhibition architecture and a contribution on conscious living. With enclosed "schnittspatzen". (3) (LK/K: Weber)
content.title_en: RoomWorlds : how young people live today

content.text: Linoleum: History, Design, Architecture 1882 - 2000; [Conclusion of the special exhibition "On the Linoleum was a Bloodprint" - Linoleum: History, Design, Architecture 1882 - 2000" in the context of the EXPO 2000 in Hanover on the North wool in Delmenhorst, Museums of the City of Delmenhorst from 7 June to 10 September 2000 and at the Weißenhof Institute at the State Academy of Fine Arts, Stuttgart, beginning of 2001]. Linoleum is currently experiencing an enormous renaissance as an ecological floor covering. This book, bound in Linoleum, tells the story of the classic and reports on its (re)discovery in design and architecture. Linoleum is a natural material that, since his invention, had a changeable effect story by the English entrepreneur Frederik Walton in 1864. In the years 1900 to 1930 he experienced a first great heyday: numerous well-known designers - for example Josef Hoffmann or Bruno Paul - designed collections and patterns. Peter Behrens also finished - even before he had a diatistic consultant± of the AEG and developed in Berlin - as a baron.
content.title_en: Linoleum : Geschichte, Design, Architektur 1882 - 2000 ; [As a companion for the special exhibition "Auf dem Linoleum war eine Blutspur ... - Linoleum: Geschichte, Design, Architektur 1882 - 2000" in the context of EXPO 2000 in Hanover on the North wool in Delmenhorst, Museums of the City of Delmenhorst from 7 June to 10 September 2000 and at the Weißenhof Institute at the Staatliche Akademie der Bildenden Künste, Stuttgart, beginning of 2001]

content.text: Economic ethical perspectives ; 5: Methodological approaches, problems of tax and distribution justice, questions of order. Over-the-counter of a large part of the lectures, held during two meetings of the Committee on Economic Sciences and Ethics in the Association for Social Policy from 12 to 14 February 1998 at the Univ. Erlangen/Nuremberg and from 25 to 27 February 1999 at the FernUniv. Hagen
content.title_en: Economic ethical perspectives ; 5: Methodological approaches, problems of tax and distribution justice, regulatory issues

content.text: Cities: engines in rural development? - Junges Forum International Berlin 2000. URBAN 21/ Akademie für Raumforschung und Landesplanung. [Authors Werner Buchner ...]. Small cities have important tasks to take over for their surrounding area or region. But precisely such places lack attractive jobs in the context of globalization the population is ageing because active people are following modern jobs, transport infrastructure sometimes leaves much to be desired, etc. The topic is dealt with in two stages: in working groups and with reports from the working groups, which are supplemented with statements: "Cities as places to live", "Cities as the driving force of regional development" and "Cities as an important building block of the cultural landscape".
content.title_en: Cities: engines in rural development? - Junges Forum International Berlin 2000. URBAN 21/ Akademie für Raumforschung und Landesplanung. [Authors Werner Buchner ...]

content.text: The practices of learning in the early modern era: [... conference held in Bad Homburg in March 1999 ...]. Klappentext: Science has been primarily an activity up to the 18th century that has dealt with "learned" knowledge, reading, practice, excerpting, compiling, editing and interpreting traditional knowledge. Thirteen international scientists examine in the contributions of this volume the practices of learning in the early modern era as well as their social and cultural conditions and contexts. It is about knowledge technology and its media ("reading and compiling"), the connection between the learned activity of editors, philologists or academic teachers and the end products of their work ("research and teaching"), the practices of transferring knowledge to addressees ("communizing and representing") and, finally, the monitoring of learned communication and its regulations.
content.title_en: The practices of learning in the early modern era : [... conference held in Bad Homburg in March 1999 ...]

content.text: Foreign trade, growth and productivity - issues ahead of EU enlargement: Report on an ifo-IfW symposium held in Dresden on 01/02 December 2000. In addition to the status and strategy of CEEC countries for EU accession, more general topics were on the agenda at the Dresden conference; e.g. issues such as technology transfer needs to be improved or whether technological development has led to an acceleration of productivity growth. On the way to the knowledge and information society, the question is in particular for East Germany, Poland, the Czech Republic and Hungary how scientific findings can be translated into marketable products and services more quickly and effectively.
content.title_en: Foreign trade, growth and productivity - issues ahead of EU enlargement: report on an ifo-IfW symposium held in Dresden on 01/02 December 2000

content.text: From risk society to opportunity society. Globalization, digitalization, individualization - the megatrends of the beginning of the 21st century also shape our society. Against the background of profound scientific, technical and sociological upheavals, politically explosive questions arise: Does our society drift apart or can it maintain its cohesion? How can the increased demands for education and further education be better met? Does the society of the future offer people more opportunities than before or does it ultimately contain more risks? How can existing potentials of common sense be better opened up and new foundations for social cooperation be found? Authors such as Benjamin Barber, Bärbel Bohley, Norbert Bolz, Wolfgang Frühwald, Robert Leicht, Annette Schavan, Erwin Teufel and Norbert Walter describe their view of things from different perspectives in a necessary and exciting social debate. - I. Sense questions in modern society II. Knowledge and culture as factors of social progress III. The situation of the youth and the relationship of generations IV. Social commitment and ways of co-responsibility V. Value and values - Globalisation and its impact on society
content.title_en: From the risk society to the opportunity society

content.text: 25 years of planning and building in democracy 1950 - 75 : [Exhibition; contribution of the Free Academy of Arts in Hamburg, Section Baukunst zum Hamburger Architektursummer 2000]. An exhibition of the Free Academy of Arts in Hamburg shows plans and models of architects, all of whom come together, from the post-war period, from a time when much had to be rebuilt and rebuilt in Germany. The motto "So much beginning was never" was in the foreground of the buildings. They wanted to remove the debris in the cities with their optimism. The architects whose plans and models are exhibited are members of the Section Baukunst at the Free Academy of Arts in Hamburg and among them many Fritz Schumacher Prize winners, a significant architectural prize in Germany.
content.title_en: 25 years of planning and building in democracy 1950 - 75 : [Exhibition ; contribution of the Free Academy of Arts in Hamburg, Section of Architecture for the Hamburg Architecture Summer 2000]

content.text: International migration and spatial integration : Specialist colloquium of the section "Population, Settlement and Infrastructure" / Academy for Spatial Research and Regional Planning. [Authors Stefan Bender ...]. Questions of the scope and consequences of future immigration to Europe and Germany have been discussed intensively for some time in politics and public opinion. For a long time it has been undisputed among demographers that without international immigration in Germany a population decrease would take place in the medium term. In this volume the results of a specialist colloquium of Section II of the ARL are documented. The focus is on the connections between international migration and overall economic development, the regional effects of a population decline with a fictitiously balanced external migration balance (model calculations), the social integration and spatial behaviour of expatriates as well as the chances and limitations of labour market integration of foreign workers.
content.title_en: International migrations and spatial integration : Specialist colloquium of the section "Population, settlement and infrastructure" / Academy for Spatial Research and Land Planning. [Authors Stefan Bender ...]

content.text: Structural change in mining succeeding landscapes: strategies for sustainable development. The Saxon-Thüringian border area is particularly marked by the typical development problems of mining succession landscapes. These include not only the old lignite mines and the facilities for the further exploitation of the lignite produced, but also the legacy of uranium production by the former Wismut AG. For the regional and regional planning in both countries, the rehabilitation and development of these areas in the affected regions is therefore a priority, cross-border task. Accordingly, strategies are developed for the necessary structural change to open the way for sustainable development for these regions. This problem was the common regional planning meeting for Saxony and Thuringia on 15/16.07.2000 in Altenburg, whose main presentations are presented in this volume.
content.title_en: Structural change in post-mining landscapes : Sustainable development strategies

content.text: Technical education : Approaches and perspectives; [Selection of lectures given at the international conference on this topic at the Technical University of Braunschweig in September 2000]. The teaching of a technical education is required worldwide, not only in the industrialized nations but also in the developing countries. The book shows in selected articles the importance of technical education from a global point of view. Renowned international authors present curricular approaches of technical education. In these approaches the different understanding of technology is clearly shown. At the same time, the interfaces between school, vocational training and study are presented. From this, requirements for technical education are derived. A prerequisite for the implementation of technical education is the competent specialist teacher. In this context, an e-learning concept for teacher training and further education is shown.
content.title_en: Technical Education : Approaches and Perspectives ; [Selection of lectures given at the international conference on this topic at the Technical University of Braunschweig in September 2000]

content.text: How natural is gender?: Gender and the construction of nature and technology; [Result of the 5th Symposium on Gender Research, which took place at Kiel University in November 2000]. Klappentext: What is the gender of a human being? How much of it is innate, what is created by cultural practice? Are the brains of women and men different? Are women tech muffles? Is a cyborg male? These questions are discussed theoretically and empirically across disciplines. The mutual connection of the constructions of gender, nature and technology is revealed.
content.title_en: How natural is gender?: Gender and the construction of nature and technology; [Result of the 5th Symposium on Gender Research, which took place at the Christian-Albrechts-Universität zu Kiel in November 2000]

content.text: The Secret of Shadows: Light and Shadows in Architecture; [on the occasion of the exhibition "The Secret of Shadows - Light and Shadows in Architecture" at the German Architecture Museum (DAM), Frankfurt am Main (23 March - 16 June 2002)]]. Shadows belong to the Light. The interplay ranges from the thesis that shadows are holes in light to the inverse idea that they are the representatives of the cosmic darkness remaining on Earth, which are being torn up by light. There are more and more light sources on Earth, so that more and more light and less shadow zones and darkness. In architecture, the transparency of the new buildings and their organization grows. The increased use of glass and other translucent layers as a result of more light raises the question of the significance of shadows. Are shadows a gain - a protection or loss of brightness. How do architectural shadows explain themselves in a historical perspective? How has their significance been determined in architecture? Why do we need shadows? This question is sought by the book, which accompanied an exhibition at the German Architecture Museum on the subject, from different viewpoints and ideas.
content.title_en: The Secret of Shadows : Light and Shadows in Architecture ; [on the occasion of the exhibition "The Secret of Shadows - Light and Shadows in Architecture" at the German Architecture Museum (DAM), Frankfurt am Main (23 March - 16 June 2002)]

content.text: Future Forum Spatial Planning: joint congress 2001 by ARL and BBR. Important framework conditions for spatial development have changed profoundly in the transition from industrial society to the service and knowledge society. These include the globalization of economic processes, the progressive European integration, the expansion of information and communication technologies as well as structural changes in the state and society directed towards decentralisation and public-private cooperation. The new development trends lead to changing requirements for spatial planning and policy. A realignment of spatial planning and spatial development policy is urgently needed. To this end, the Forum on the future of spatial planning, which was conducted by the Academy of Spatial Research and Regional Planning (ARL) and the Federal Office for Building and Spatial Planning (BBR) in Bonn at the end of 2001, should make an important contribution. The volume contains the results of the Future Forum. In addition to a location determination, proposals are presented to ensure the effectiveness of spatial planning in the light of future challenges.
content.title_en: Future Forum for Spatial Planning : joint congress 2001 by ARL and BBR

content.text: Natural stone conservation - basics, developments and applications. Most of the articles in the book deal with the scientifically sound development of "elastic stone solids" based on modified silica esters (KSE), their test regarding gel formation and their effect on the hygrian (hydrophil/hydrophob) and mechanical properties (solidity, e-module) of samples of some important natural stone varieties. Finally, the testing of the KSE modular system based on these developments is presented on some selected examples (Schloß Frankenberg, Schlosskapelle Dresden, Wall cleaning of the Roman thermal baths in Xanten, Tuffsteinfasade of the Roman Cross Valley in Oberpleis). These articles are supplemented by reports on different transport mechanisms in the desalination of natural stones and by experiences with breathable, color-giving lasuras as a surface protection for water rejection especially suitable for the KSE modular system.
content.title_en: Natural stone conservation - basics, developments and applications

content.text: Regional planning in Baden-Württemberg: Further development of the 12 regions and selected areas of action; Regional planning conferences Baden-Württemberg 1999 and 2001. The enormous process of change in economy and society does not remain without consequences for the organizational structure and the tasks of modern regional planning. Only those who act and not only react will be able to act in a creative and steering way today. Regional planning is timely if it sees and uses its opportunities in a targeted, appropriate and effective way. The new Landesplanungsgesetz will lay the foundations for this. The volume contains exemplary examples where regional planning is already active in Baden-Württemberg and its instruments and possibilities are provided. The task goes far beyond the creation of a regional plan. The dynamic framework conditions not only cause unpleasant pressure on the need to change, but also provide opportunities for new things. The examples of large-scale retailing, contractual agreements and memberships, regional market concepts, wind energy, flood protection and automated spatial planning cassters show that this is possible in the current planning requirements.
content.title_en: Regional planning in Baden-Württemberg : Further development of the 12 regions and selected areas of action ; Regional planning conferences Baden-Württemberg 1999 and 2001

content.text: The project "Online shopping and services - Municipal play areas" deals with the e-shopping and urban development complex. The six-part event cycle focuses on the questions of whether technology-induced trends in "de-spatialisation" of trade and service functions at local level can be countered and whether the energy and dynamics that currently characterize the areas of telematics and multimedia can be used for sustainable and human-friendly urban development. This volume documents the third project workshop, which took place in Hamburg in November 2001, and focuses on the secondary effects of online shopping and services, i.e. the effects on urban development. The potential consequences of e-shopping on the internal and inter-urban location and centre systems as well as on logistics, goods and customer traffic are discussed. Finally, the focus is on urban development strategies for urban development, which range from the targeted use of ICT technologies to spatial planning and planning of the logistics strategies for the area.
content.title_en: City on wire : e-shopping and urban development: impact, concepts, strategies ; 3. Workshop report "E-shopping and municipalities"

content.text: Spatial planning has a future: spatial planning in the field of tension between Europeanization and regionalization; 100th meeting of the Landesarbeitsgemeinschaft Hessen/Rheinland-Pfalz/Saarland. The volume documents the course and content of the anniversary meeting of the Landesarbeitsgemeinschaft Hessen / Rheinland-Pfalz / Saarland of the ARL on the occasion of its 100th meeting. The lectures draw a further line in the double sense: one of the current developments of important determinants in planning to future trends; the other of the spatial focus beyond the three countries to the European level. In this context, concrete demands are also made with regard to the further development and further harmonisation of spatial development within the framework of European integration.
content.title_en: Spatial planning has a future : spatial planning in the field of Europeanization and regionalization ; 100th meeting of the Landesarbeitsgemeinschaft Hessen/Rheinland-Pfalz/Saarland

content.text: The contributions of this volume bring together the findings of the two directions, partly based on different paths. We know one thing for sure: a safe bonding experience in childhood - at least one! - is a very important protection against the emergence of psychopathological symptoms after a traumatic experience. The findings of binding research have recently been incorporated into psychoanalytic and psychotherapeutic considerations. This book now combines the previously largely independent directions of binding research and psychotraumatology. It is shown how binding behavior and disorders can be related to traumatic separation and loss experiences or also with other traumatic events such as physical and emotional abuse or sexual violence. The binding research has worked out how such unresolved traumats can affect disturbed behaviour in children and on binding representations in adults. In parallel, the traumatological events such as physical and emotional abuse or sexual violence can be triggered by muteticism.
content.title_en: Binding and Trauma : Risks and Protection Factors for Children's Development ; [International Congress Attachment and Trauma: Risk and Protective Factors in the Development of Children]

content.text: Human images in human geography. The contributions of this volume are part of the symposium 'Human images in science theory and research practice' of the 53rd German Geographentag 2001 in Leipzig. They treat a new view of humans in different social contexts as the subject of human geography.
content.title_en: Human images in human geography

content.text: Sustainable spatial development - more than just a word? : Scientific plenary session 2002. In the run-up to the UN World Summit on Sustainable Development in Johannesburg in September 2002, the ARL had deliberately devoted its scientific plenary session to the topic of "Sustainability". It thus provided a groundbreaking platform for the Federal Republic of Germany to determine its own critical location. In this context, it assumed that despite numerous work on sustainability, there was still a considerable need for advice and research on the various facets of this postulate and its respective spatial implications. Since the mere reference to the requirement of sustainability produced little feedback in terms of experience, the topic was deliberately treated in a pro- and contra-perspective, which was already laid down in the overall title. The course and results of this conference are documented in the volume.
content.title_en: Sustainable spatial development - more than just a word? : Scientific plenary session 2002

content.text: System theories in comparison : what do system theories do for social work? ; attempt of a dialogue. Heino Hollstein-Brinkmann, possibilities of interparadigmatic comparison - Roland Merten, social work from an (extended) perspective of system theory Niklas Luhmann - Heiko Kleve, Der systemtheoretische Konstructivismus: Eine postmoderne Beferungstheorie Sozialer Arbeit - Werner Obrecht, Ontologischer, sozialwissenschaftlicher und sozialbarbeitswissenschaftlicher Systemismus. Ein integratives Paradigma der Sozialen Arbeit - Richard Sorg, Materialistische Dialectik als Systemtheorie des Marxisms - Andrea Brandl-Nebehay, Systemische Ansätze im Jugendamt... - Friedhelm Kron-Klees, Entwicklung Sozialer Arbeit in der Tagespraxis... - Silvia Staub-Bernasconi, questions, possible answers and decisions regarding the conception or construction of (system)theoretical approaches - comments of the authors on the practical example: "In this Treff I would not last day" .
content.title_en: System theories in comparison : what do system theories do for social work? ; attempt to dialogue

content.text: Chora and Polis. The focus of the ancient and archaeological research was until recently on the history of the city; the surrounding country, however, the Chora remained in the dark. Therefore, fundamental questions still have to be clarified regarding ancient rural life: What did the rural settlement, social and economic structures look like? Was the ancient economy essentially subsistence economy or rather market oriented? How can demographic conditions be grasped? New research approaches are devoted to the administrative organization of Chora, its cult topography, the non-agrarian functions of rural settlements and above all a more detailed analysis of agricultural activities and productivity. The contributions gathered in this volume also reflect fundamental methodological discussions. They ask about the importance of investigations of the surfaces of settlement areas and what possibilities the so-called surveys offer.
content.title_en: Chora and Polis

content.text: History interpretation on old maps: Archaeology and history. "Historical interpretations" on and with old maps are the subject of the 22 contributions of the volume. It is about "kartographic representation" as a means of shaping historical consciousness and the cartographic apprehension of history, not limited to the history of cartography or thematic maps typical of the map. Thus maps were included, which may seem foreign and paradoxical to some geographers or cartographers of natural science in the tradition of enlightenment and rationalism, as the so-called "TO-maps", which symbolize ecumenism in their own way as the space in which history takes place. Five thematic areas are divided into the investigations: 1. Signa and Imagines of Different World Views 2. New world images with traditional world interpretations? 3. History cartographic 4. Disconcerted worlds 5. World conception in the service of dominational instrumentalization
content.title_en: History interpretation on old maps : Archaeology and history

content.text: Biomechanics as application research : Transfer between theory and practice ; 6th symposium of the dvs section Biomechanics from 22 - 24 March 2001 in Konstanz. This volume contains the contributions of the 6th symposium of the Section Biomechanics of the German Association for Sports Science (dvs), which was organized in March 2001 by the Institute of Sports Science of the University of Konstanz. In addition to fundamental contributions to biomechanical basic research for biology, robotics and sports, the further 38 contributions are assigned to the focus areas on the sport-specific application of biomechanics in sports, modeling and neuromuscular movement control as well as preventive sports biomechanics. In addition, planned and ongoing research projects are presented. The contributions provide a comprehensive overview of current research work in biomechanics, involving various working groups from sports science, training science, medicine, sports medicine and biotechnical fields. They try to establish a link between theoretical-scientific preparation and the practical application of biomechanical questions. Hartmut Riehle is professor of sports science at the University of Konstanz.
content.title_en: Biomechanics as application research : transfer between theory and practice ; 6th symposium of the dvs section Biomechanics from 22 - 24 March 2001 in Konstanz

content.title_en: Terror in the Service of God : the "spiritual guidance" of the assassins of September 11, 2001 : [the band emerged from a roundtable held on October 1, 2003 at the Max Weber College of the University of Erfurt]

content.text: The planning theory has developed considerably over the last decades. While the technocrat planning process was the focus of interest in the past, it is now more concerned with communication among the planning participants as an interpretative science. In this volume, well-known authors discuss why such a change is welcome and what consequences it has. Different perspectives and approaches to planning theory are presented: How should planning be? How is planning understood and seen? How does planning work? The volume thus presents a current and comprehensive locational determination of the social science oriented planning theory. Deike Peters: On the state of planning theory Martin Lendi: Basic orientation for spatial planning Sandra Huning: The path is the goal Wolf Reuter: Planning and power Dieter Hassenpflug: Urban planning as spatial image and experience management Marianne Rodenstein: A plea for planning as deconstruction Gerd Albers: On the role of theory in urban planning Ute Teacher: Where is the city in planning theory? Klaus Selle: What are you talking about?
content.title_en: Perspectives of planning theory

content.text: ArchiSculpture : Dialogues between architecture and sculpture from the 18th century to the present day; [on the occasion of the exhibition "ArchiSculpture. Dialogues between architecture and sculpture from the 18th century to the present day" in the Fondation Beyeler, Riehen/Basel, from 3 October 2004 to 30 January 2005]. Interrelation between architecture and sculpture, reference, impulses from the history of architecture and their influence on modern sculpture
content.title_en: ArchiSculpture : Dialogues between architecture and sculpture from the 18th century to the present day; [on the occasion of the exhibition "ArchiSculpture. Dialogues between architecture and sculpture from the 18th century to the present" in the Fondation Beyeler, Riehen/Basel, from 3 October 2004 to 30 January 2005]

content.text: New living for old age : what is going on and how it works. Concept, editorial and editing: Michael Andritzky and Thomas Hauer With contributions by Joachim Brech, Albrecht Göschel, Alexander Grünenwald and Berta Heyl, Gerda Helbig, Alex Hofmann, Cornelia Kricheldorff, Marie-Theres Krings-Heckemeier, Andreas Kruse, Renate Narten, Harald Nier, Rolf Novy-Huy, Klaus Joachim Reinig, Tobias Robischon
content.title_en: New living for age : what goes and how it goes

content.text: Living at work: [Trendbook Life and Work in the Future]. We live in a time of transition, in a time of transition from the industrial to the knowledge and service society. "Living at work" shows how our lives change in and with work: Companies are completely reorganizing, their culture is determined by respect and responsibility, customers and suppliers are growing together. A fascinating view into the world in which we will live tomorrow! With contributions by: - Ulrich Beck - Klaus Doppler - Matthias Horx - Werner Tiki Küstenmacher - Reinhard Sprenger and many others
content.title_en: Living at work : [Trend book Living and working in the future]

content.text: Electronic phenomena in organic solids : [9th International Conference Electrical and Related Properties of Organics Solids], Prague, Czech Republic July 14 - 18, 2002. This volume contains articles on many aspects of electrical and optical properties of organic solids. The articles were presented as lectures and posters at the 9th International Conference on Electrical and Related Properties of Organic Solids, which took place in Prague in July 2002.
content.title_en: Electronic phenomena in organic solids : [9th International Conference Electrical and Related Properties of Organics Solids], Prague, Czech Republic July 14 - 18, 2002

content.text: city.net - Cities in the age of telecommunications. Telecommunications and information technologies represent the challenges of a connected world in the 21st century. Were the revolutions of industry and transport in the 19th and 20th centuries the decisive forces of the urbanization process, the information revolution that began with telephone and fax and now provisionally flows into the Internet is now considered as the most powerful factor of future urban development. Critics of this process state that many functions that previously established the existence of cities are now fulfilled by locationless computer networks. Cities would therefore have been depleted. The city now threatens to disappear completely in virtual space. Scientific findings, however, show that even in the world of cyberspace the old economic principle of agglomeration still has its validity: people still need personal contact to meet each other, to handle business, to exchange information and goods. Representatives of theory and practice questioning in this publication are instead able to present widely-spread clichés and thematize opportunities, possibilities and challenges that the telecommunicative age offers for city builders, architects and urban planners, as well as well as for urban and regional planners.
content.title_en: city.net - Cities in the age of telecommunications

content.text: The culture of aging from antiquity to the present. The increasing ageing of the population is one of the central challenges of our time. You must confront society, but also every individual in his personal aging process and ultimately death. Both aspects illuminate the eleven contributions of the present collection from different perspectives: that of the historian, the physician, the sociologist and the demographer. Starting from the social position and the possibilities of financial protection that old people had in previous eras, the main questions of the range of age and aging that arise in the present and future are addressed. What social consequences do demographic change have? How can the individual cope with the problems that bring his own age and that of the relatives to the point of need for care? What opportunities and risks do medical progress entails? Where are the ethical limits? The collection volume shows the complexity and great importance of the topic of aging and aging and provides a first access to the further employment of this area. With contributions by Hans Braun, Sigrun-Heide Filipp, Andreas Gedrich, Roland Hardtmann, Dirk Wtrug, Elisabeth Anft
content.title_en: The culture of aging from antiquity to the present

content.text: Reserve der Form: [appears in the context of the exhibition Reserve der Form (26 August to 14 October 2004, Künstlerhaus Wien)]. >Reserve der Form< presents over ninety works from architecture, art and everyday culture. Form is far more than the formal. Formal reserves create diverse parallel actions in aesthetic, social, economic and legal contexts. Spaces appear in places where they were neither intended for architectural nor for building purposes. Artistic practices transcend the symbolic level and contemporary political effects. The associative grouping of the detailed project documentations enables the visualisation of connections beyond stylistic or media preferences. At the same time, the publication is also a book on reading >Reserves of form < with contributions by well-known authors from philosophy, sociology, art and architecture theory. >>Reserve of form< is a morphized exposition, bent, distorted, engulfed and overloaded, turned, dispelled and oscillated in itself. Composing of thoughts and sacks.
content.title_en: Reserve of Form: [shown in the exhibition Reserve der Form (26 August to 14 October 2004, Künstlerhaus Wien)]

content.text: Developing skills - increasing the quality of teaching in primary school: development lines and research findings; [Primary school meeting "development times" ... in September 2003 at the University of Bremen; section of the contributions]. Developing competences - this is the claim, expectation and challenge of educational and educational work in the school context, which affect both the pupils in their learning process and the professional skills of the teachers. The contributions of this volume seek to open up the possibilities and ways of developing competence for a quality increase in teaching and learning processes. The volume is aimed at future educators, teachers in primary schools as well as employees in universities and universities. It bundles diverse aspects of competence development, ranging from their teaching to their basic conditions and research methodological approaches. At the same time, a range of current research findings is drawn to schulpractical consequences. Three chapters will highlight striking examples of multifaceted approaches to the development of competence in primary school, which range from subject-independent areas, to mathematical and mathematical research-related issues.
content.title_en: Developing skills - increasing the quality of teaching in primary school : Development lines and research findings ; [Primary school meeting "Development times" ... in September 2003 at the University of Bremen ; section of the contributions]

content.text: Lifelong learning in the knowledge society: Prerequisites and framework conditions : Contributions of the OECD-CERI regional seminar for German-speaking countries in Vienna from 29 September to 2 October 2003. Since 2001 there has been a series of OECD/CERI regional seminars on the event and book cycle "Learning in the knowledge society". The events thus address a topic that will be of central importance in the coming years for the further development of education. The topic of this conference volume is "Lifelong learning in the knowledge society - prerequisites and framework conditions". The contributions from Germany, Austria and Switzerland dealt with the following core topics: .Previous support as a prerequisite for lifelong learning (with particular consideration of neuropsychological findings); .The school's contribution to the promotion of educational motivation and basic competences for lifelong learning; . Inter-educational strategies for the realization of lifelong learning at local and regional level. In a compact and concise manner, the volume develops coherent strategies for the future topic "Lifelong learning".
content.title_en: Lifelong learning in the knowledge society : Prerequisites and framework conditions : Contributions of the OECD-CERI regional seminar for German-speaking countries in Vienna from 29 September to 2 October 2003

content.text: Use of media games - games of media users: [the contributions were presented at the conference of the Department of Reception Research of the German Society for Publicity and Communication Sciences (DGPuK) in Hanover in 2002 for the first time ...]. The term "game" can also characterize a media offer and a reception method: On the offer side defined by the producers as such, the recipients invite the reception experience to a corresponding reception experience. However, playful reception methods do not necessarily have to have their starting point in playful media offers. Game can arise in many contexts. How people experience their (media) games and deal with them and what effects result from them is the subject of this volume. In this way, it contributes to the systematic study of this communication science-related subject and thus opens up a wide and promising research field. The present volume deals with games and playful reception, while making use of classical research areas of communication science, such as Selective Exposure Research, the research on effects or the use-and-granifications approach for this new topic area of research.
content.title_en: Use of media games - Games of media users : [The contributions were presented for the first time at the conference of the Department of Reception Research of the German Society for Journalism and Communication Science (DGPuK) in Hanover in 2002 ...]

content.text: Human biotechnology as a social challenge: [Wartburgtagung zur Humanbiotechnologie, vom 6. bis 8. Mai 2004]. The volume gathers the contributions of renowned personalities from science, society and politics, who posed themselves at the transdisciplinary "Wartburgtagung" of the question of the challenge of science and society through modern human biotechnology. The common goal of the contributions is to present the problem clearly and concisely from the point of view of the individual areas and thus to create the possibility for a discussion between the sciences and between science and society. In this context, not only thematic content from biology, philosophy, theology or law is conveyed, but also the controversy in the interpretation of science as well as questions to fundamental concepts such as the one of the much quoted "human dignity". The volume reflects the diversity of social opinions in the questions of human biotechnology on a high level and yet intelligible.
content.title_en: Human biotechnology as a societal challenge : [Wartburg conference on human biotechnology, 6-8 May 2004]

content.text: In the process of modernization, Riga's history of the Baltic Sea became more and more important in the 19th and early 20th centuries. [Fruits of an international conference, organized from 11 to 16 September 2001 ... in the Latvian capital]. The Baltic Sea metropolis of Riga has long been examined in the extra-lettan, especially German-speaking historical research as a phenomenon of medieval city, economic and social history. However, the recent history of Riga, its development of the pre-modern, German-speaking merchants, has been characterized by a trade city moving in manageable and fixed lanes to a multi-ethnic, cultural and social diversity, economic dynamics and industrial acceleration. Only recently, the modernization processes behind the fundamental transformations of the 19th and 20th centuries have been described and paralleled with these expired processes of modern nation-building also for Riga more and more closely addressed to a study of the Russian Empire and of the most interesting and of its trade.
content.title_en: Riga in the process of modernisation : Studies on the change of a Baltic metropolis in the 19th and early 20th centuries ; [Fruits of an international conference held in the Latvian capital from 11 to 16 September 2001]

content.text: Support in online studies: the emergence of a new educational field of activity. More and more universities develop in addition to their conventional teaching programs online courses or individual courses with integrated online phases (Blended Learning) in order to make learning and teaching more flexible and thus also to address new target groups in the field of vocational in-service training. The "new media" have led in recent years to a real e-learning euphoria. However, the planning, development and implementation of online studies is extremely complex. Therefore, sustainable support structures at the level of learning and teaching and also at the organizational level for a didactically sound support of the innovation process. The book builds a bridge to the theory and practice of online distance learning as a basic form of media-media-media-media-media-mediated learning and teaching. On the basis of examples, Olaf Zawacki-Richter shows the experiences and concepts for the integration of online learning and teaching from an international perspective.
content.title_en: Support in online studies : the emergence of a new educational field of activity

content.text: Gottfried Semper (1803 - 1879) : Greece and the living architecture. Semper's statement opened new horizons for the reception of antiquity, but they also created the prerequisites for the abnegation of the architecture of his time from the Slavic imitation of the Greek model. Semper, the famous architect of the Dresden court theatre, undertook in his young years the obligate archaeological journey to Greece for many educated architects of his time. To the key experience of his visit he became the discovery of colour traces on the building members of ancient temples from the best Athenian time. Semper was not the first to come to such knowledge. However, he was the one who put these findings into a coherent theory: on the one hand color as evidence of the historical condition of ancient architecture - thereby challenging the idea of a universal and overtime application of its model by dogmatic classicists of the Stasi-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis-Statis
content.title_en: Gottfried Semper (1803 - 1879) : Greece and the living architecture

content.text: Integrated Water Management : Documentation of the German-Polish workshop in the framework of the Europawoche Hessen on Wednesday, May 07 and Thursday, May 08, 2003 at the University of Kassel. During the Europawoche 2003 a German-Polish workshop took place in the University of Kassel, the result of which is compiled in this issue.The aim was to bring together scientists from different disciplines from Warsaw and Kassel with representatives of the Hessian environmental administration and to discuss the three overlapping topics: Integrated Water Management, also called River Basin Management, European Water Framework Directive and Flood Risk Management .Application of the results to the design of a research focus "Integrated Water Management" in the Department of Civil Engineering of the University of Kassel and on joint German-Polish projects .Application of the results to the European Union research project "Creating New Landscapes for Flood Risk Management (FLOODSCAPE) The book documents the contributions from the disciplines Hydrology, Agriculture, Nature Conservation, Spatial Planning and Water Management .A brief summary of the discussion is also included. This was very clear that the highly ecologically oriented management framework requires more intensive management of the water management.
content.title_en: Integrated water management : Documentation of the German-Polish workshop in the framework of the Europawoche Hessen on Wednesday, May 07 and Thursday, May 08, 2003 at the University of Kassel

content.text: Video : Playback, editing and streaming under Linux. This official collection on a main topic at LinuxTag 2005 describes in more than 15 articles the diverse aspects of video technology under Linux. After the presentation of various players it is about aspects of coding as well as various application scenarios (digital video recorder, streaming in building automation etc.). A compendium to the "State of the Art" of high-profile international authors
content.title_en: Video : Play, edit and stream under Linux

content.text: Steel concrete panels: new aspects for design, construction and construction. Bridge composite panels: an innovative precast for high-rise ceilings - Element ceilings with lattice beams according to DIN 1045-1 - Load characteristics and design of two-axle hollow-body ceilings - Concrete components with sluggish reinforcement from GFRP rods - Prestressed textile reinforced concrete panels - Prestressed concrete panels according to old and new standard compared - Cut sizes in pavement panels of road bridges according to DIN technical report 101 - Visible concrete - Notes for tender and construction according to the new DBV-Merkblatt - Reconstruction of slabs: Reusability and reusability of used concrete components - White tub: Options for modeling the load case "Drainage of hydration heat" - Plates in computer-aided building planning
content.title_en: Reinforced concrete panels: new aspects for design, construction and construction

content.text: The last hours of Herculaneum are buried in the museum of the Westphalian Roman Museum of the Westphalian Lippe, September to December 2005 Berlin, the collection of antiques in the Pergamon Museum, January to April 2006 Bremen, Focke Museum, Bremer Landesmuseum für Kunst und Kulturgeschichte]. "The last hours of Herculaneum" is the first exhibition about the neighbouring town of Pompeii, which is shown outside Italy. New, sensational excavations from Herculaneum are presented: The skeletons of the people who have found death in the boat houses through a gas cloud of over 400 degrees Celsius, the marble sculpture jewelry from the house of the deer. For the first time, the National Museum in Naples opens its gates to show the specimens of its holdings in such a quantity outside the country "The last hours of Herculaneum" is the first exhibition about the neighboring town of Pompeii, which is shown outside of Italy.
content.title_en: Vergegüßt vom Vesuv : die letzten Stunden von Herculaneum ; [Exhibition 21 May to 14 August 2005 Haltern, Westfälisches Römermuseum des Landschaftsverbands Westfalen-Lippe, September to December 2005 Berlin, Antikensammlung im Pergamonmuseum, January to April 2006 Bremen, Focke-Museum, Bremen State Museum of Art and Cultural History]

content.text: IT security is all addressed! [the 9th German IT Security Congress in Bonn/Bad Godesberg from 10 to 12 May 2005; conference volume]. The book is the conference volume of the 9th German IT Security Congress of the Federal Office for Information Security (BSI) in Bonn/Bad Godesberg from 10 to 12 May 2005. The book title was also the moth of the conference: IT security is all addressed - manufacturers as well as users, experts in the same extent as lay people. To this end, each individual can make his contribution: IT security must be technically realized in such a way that it can become socially established. Security in information technology must be understandable and practical for everyone. Only then will the electronic service society become reality. Finally, it is the citizens who use new technologies in everyday life - and they rightly want to trust the security of the technology. Congress and book deal with this background with different security questions: It is both about technology and the social significance of IT security. Finally, developments such as biometric procedures, the technical protection of intellectual property and the scope of the congress's individual security management are also addressed to the topic of security management.
content.title_en: IT security is for everyone! [the 9th German IT Security Congress in Bonn/Bad Godesberg from 10 to 12 May 2005 ; conference volume]

content.text: The single room - standard in the stationary old people's assistance?: [Worth, humanity, self-determinedness, individuality, privacy, privacy, privacy]; Summary and results of the special event "Das Einzelle" on 4 October 2004 at the Museum für Angewandte Kunst. The board of trustees of Deutsche Alterhilfe is committed to ensuring that the single room standard is used in the stationary care in Germany. This is the only way to avoid costs, which are usually not mentioned by anyone: the high "social follow-up costs", which often arise only when, for example, stress situations arise in double rooms among neighbours who have not chosen to live together voluntarily. In no case does the KDA want to deprive home residents of the right to live in a double room if they want to. But it also thinks wrong that the lower investment costs from the construction of double rooms could be the solution to financial problems in the stationary old people's care. In Volume 4 of the series Architecture + Gerontology a KDA conference on the topic of single rooms is documented. The single room is examined from an architectural, operational and maintenance perspective.
content.title_en: The single room - standard in the stationary old people's assistance? : [dignity, humanity, self-determination, individuality, privacy, privacy] ; Summary and results of the special event "Das Single Room" on 4 October 2004 at the Museum of Applied Art

content.title_en: Symbolics, social irrationality and psychohistory

content.text: Forge in history and present. Contributions to the 27th conference of the Eisenbibliothek on 29 and 30 October 2004 in the monastery estate Paradies near Schaffhausen
content.title_en: Forging in history and present

content.text: Ideal City - real projects : Architects of Gerkan, Marg and Partners in China ; [on the occasion of the exhibition Ideal City - Real projects of Gerkan, Marg and Partners in China, Architecture Museum of the Technical University of Munich in the Pinakothek der Moderne, 30 June - 2 October 2005]. In a period of six years, the Hamburg office of Gerkan, Marg and Partners - for short gmp - has created over 100 designs for clients in China, of which five are already completed and 20 are under construction or planned. Lingang New City, a port city designed on the drawing board for 800,000 inhabitants near Shanghai, is the focus: Designed by gmp in the tradition of an "ideal city", around a central circular lake the various urban districts were arranged in concentric rings. Urban building blocks and city rooms also mark identity-giving designs for different public tasks - namely a theatre and an opera house, a school, a museum, a city archive, a church, administrative towers and exhibition and congress halls up to a size of over 20 football fields.
content.title_en: Ideal City - Real Projects : Architects of Gerkan, Marg and Partner in China ; [on the occasion of the exhibition Ideal City - Real Projects of Gerkan, Marg and Partner in China, Architecture Museum of the Technical University of Munich in the Pinakothek der Moderne, 30 June - 2 October 2005]

content.text: The situation of Roma and Sinti after the enlargement of the EU. As the enlargement of the European Union takes place, the number of Roma living in the EU is greater than the number of inhabitants of some EU Member States, and will continue to grow due to the high birth rate. Poor educational and labour market prospects, unfavourable living conditions, displacements in the Balkans and the specter of poverty migration demand solutions. The 10th Forum Migration of the Otto Benecke Foundation highlighted that Roma became the losers of nation-building and economic transformation in a dramatic way, and that two levels of action were identified: local politics and pan-European responsibility. Matter provides an overview of the diversity of Roma cultures and groups and highlights the migration routes and fates. Current situation reports are presented from the countries of Romania, Serbia and Montenegro as well as the Slovak Republic.
content.title_en: The situation of Roma and Sinti after EU enlargement

content.text: Feedstock recycling of plastics : selected papers presented at the Third International Symposium on Feedstock Recycling of Plastics & Other Innovative Plastics Recycling Techniques, Karlsruhe, Germany, September 25 - 29, 2005 ; [ISFR]. Other information Other: Printing on Demand. Free download via the publishing server at the URL http://www.uvka.de/univerlag/volltexte/2005/81/pdf/Feedstock_Recycling_of_Plastics.pdf
content.title_en: Feedstock recycling of plastics : selected papers presented at the Third International Symposium on Feedstock Recycling of Plastics & Other Innovative Plastics Recycling Techniques, Karlsruhe, Germany, September 25 - 29, 2005 ; [ISFR]

content.text: Social aspects of land recycling in cities: Documentation of the 4th German-American workshop "Social aspects of land recycling" on 17/18.6.2004 in Leipzig. In the context of a German-American research cooperation, six bilateral workshops discussed procedures for dealing with waste land in the context of land recycling ( Brownfield Redevelopment ). The volume documents the 4th workshop, which dealt with the social aspects of land recycling in cities. In the revitalisation of waste land, various social aspects are mostly touched upon. The inner cities should be developed as integrated locations for housing, work and recreation as possible. In-urban waste land represents a great potential for this, as they are usually well developed and centrally located. At the same time, waste land are crystallization points for social, ecological and employment-oriented resident initiatives in urban conversion areas. The social compatibility of land recycling depends on the extent to which a connection between urban development and engineering concerns are generally well developed and centrally located.
content.title_en: Social aspects of land recycling in the cities : Documentation of the 4th German-American workshop "Social aspects of land recycling" on 17/18.6.2004 in Leipzig

content.text: Vision.Stadt : Projects on the urban development of Oldenburg and the competition "Lightmarks" ; [documents the exhibitions on the "Vision.Stadt" in the Mohrmann Hall...and the exhibition "Lightmarks"-Destructions in the GSG Oldenburg and the built Oldenburg art course "Lightmarks" in the period from May to November 2005 ... "Maturity step 05" ... from 21 May 2005 to 27 November 2005]. [Tradition - Innovation - Vision ; this publication of the Baudezernates of the City of Oldenburg and the project management of the century step 05 documents the exhibitions on the "Vision.Stadt" in the Mohrmann Hall at the horse market as well as the exhibition of the "Lightmarks"-Destructions in the GSG Oldenburg and the built Oldenburg art course "Lightmarks" in the period from May to November 2005] / Frank-Egon Pantel ; Ralf Rummel-Suhrcke (Hg.)

content.text: Problem areas at the urban and regional level: characteristics, effects and planning : 7th Young Forum of the ARL, 2 to 4 June 2004 in Dresden. As a result of structural change, changes occur within the spatial structure of cities and regions. Once leading centres can lose momentum, others can grow. But also within cities and regions there are differentiated developments. Problem areas can affect a regional, an urban and a part-urban level. The spatial planning law, the federal-state programme "Social City" as well as the programmes "City conversion East" and "urban conversion West" give impetus and promote urban development. The examination of problem areas is focused here on several sub-areas: the role and instruments of planning, questions of image and identity as well as flexible action within the framework of intermediate uses. In addition to the general aspects of the concept of "problem area", case studies are presented.
content.title_en: Problem areas at urban and regional level : characteristics, impacts and planning : 7th Young Forum of the ARL, 2 to 4 June 2004 in Dresden

content.text: Regional Planning Act and State Development Plan Baden-Württemberg : Tasks and Opportunities for the Region ; Regional Planning Conference Baden-Württemberg 2004. With the recast of the State Planning Act in Baden-Württemberg and the State Development Plan of 2002, contemporary instruments are available that provide a targeted, appropriate and effective scope for planning the state planning and its regional associations. The regional planning conference highlighted opportunities and risks in various aspects: local financial scarcity, sustainability, regional planning in regionally important matters, renewable energies, flood protection, settlement development and large-scale retail trade.
content.title_en: Regional Planning Act and State Development Plan Baden-Württemberg : Tasks and Opportunities for the Region ; Regional Planning Conference Baden-Württemberg 2004

content.text: The contributions of this volume were mostly made for the DFG-Graduate Training Group "The Figure of the Third" held in January 2005 at the University of Konstanz.
content.title_en: Dead cults : cultural and literary boundaries between life and death

content.text: The Second Vatican Council and the Signs of the Times today. In December 2005, the end of the Second Vatican Council was celebrated for the 40th time. This is enough reason to ask for the Council's orientative power to take the path into the future, precisely under the signs of the times today. But what are these signs of the times? In the first part of the study, the volume discusses contemporary signs in a global perspective and continental aspects. The second part is dedicated to the reception and theological deteriorates of the Second Vatican Council. Like any historical statement of faith, the Council texts also know limits and problems. The third part provides guidelines for the upcoming theological work with the Council texts and the substantive questions outlined therein.
content.title_en: The Second Vatican Council and the Signs of the Times Today

content.text: With pictures lying. Starting from the question of lies and deception IBM one of the basic topics of image science insight IBM is analyzed the use of images in media, public and everyday life. ... The volume refers to a lecture series that took place in 2005 under the title ?Pictures that lie? in Koblenz. The series was created at the University of Koblenz in cooperation with the Landeszentrale für politische Bildung Rheinland-Pfalz and refers to the exhibition of the same name designed by the Haus der Geschichte in Bonn. (buchhandel.de)
content.title_en: Lie with pictures

content.text: Friendships between children and young people : interdisciplinary perspectives and findings ; [Symposium on Child Friendships on the occasion of the Dresden Faculty Days]. This volume offers a profound introduction to educational and psychological friendship research. The topic of friendship is becoming increasingly interesting as a research subject in psychology and pedagogy. While child friends are being treated primarily in development psychology, adult friendships are the subject of social psychology. Both areas have found their place in a demarcated relationship research in the last decade. The volume offers a profound introduction to educational and psychological friendship research and presents a comprehensive overview of the most important results. Subsequently, in-depth individual studies on friendships in childhood and youth as well as on methods of investigation for understanding friendship and friendship processes are found. The volume is aimed at lecturers and students of psychology, education and sociology and is equally suitable for research and teaching.
content.title_en: Friendships among children and young people : interdisciplinary perspectives and findings ; [Symposium on Child Friendships on the occasion of the Dresden Faculty Days]

content.text: What strengthens children: education between risk and resilience. Press statements: The book provides a clear set of insights and information that educators, curative educators, psychologists, but also parents and other close relatives can provide assistance in supporting and accompanying children at risk" VHN" I find it sympathetic to this book that it is less about narrowing down the term "resilience". Instead, the multitude of processes that can have protective effects on the resistance of children, so that children with high risk factors can develop situation-appropriate forms of coping. (...) I have read it with pleasure (not as bed reading) and I wish the contributions many interested readers for a fruitful exchange." Short textChildren are vulnerable -- numerous risk factors can affect them in their development. Sometimes children can successfully cope with even the most difficult life situations -- then talk about resilience" . Scientists from various disciplines and countries present current results of resilience research and lead new paths of (heal) pedagogical promotion of children. Neuspan, Neuspan, Neusprache der Beziehung des Beziehungs, Neuspeichungs,
content.title_en: What strengthens children : Education between risk and resilience

content.text: Agglomerations - Situation and perspectives : 8th Young Forum of the ARL, 1 to 3 June 2005 in Gelsenkirchen. Agglomeration spaces have long been considered as centres of economic, political and cultural life. This is particularly true for Germany, which is one of the most densely populated European countries with a population density of 231 inhabitants per square kilometre. Currently, spatial planning, spatial planning and research in the agglomeration areas face special and diverse challenges. The meeting of deindustrialisation, demographic and social change as well as regional structural change in this type of space leads to major changes, which are still not discussed enough in terms of their impact and the resulting need for action. Against this background, the Young Forum 2005 addressed four topics in particular to the Academy for Spatial Research and Land Planning at its conference from 1 to 3 June 2005 in Gelsenkirchen of the situation and the perspectives of the federal German agglomeration spaces.
content.title_en: Agglomerations - Situation and perspectives : 8th Young Forum of the ARL, 1 to 3 June 2005 in Gelsenkirchen

content.text: Emissions of animal husbandry : Measurement , assessment and reduction of gases, dusts and germs : KTBL-Conference 5 - 7 December 2006 Education center Kloster Banz. The reduction of emissions from animal husbandry is an important part of the national and international air pollution policy. Because in Germany and in many other countries the animal husbandry is still the main emitter of ammonia. This leads to the fact that in international agreements for air pollution control particle and greenhouse gas emissions are increasingly included. The conference volume documents new findings about emissions of ammonia, smell, dust and germs, which can be derived from animal husbandry plants. In addition to the development, spread and deposition, the measurement and evaluation of emissions are addressed. Possible mitigation measures including the evaluation of exhaust air purification are presented and evaluated (Source: KTBL).
content.title_en: Emissions of animal husbandry : measurement , assessment and reduction of gases, dusts and germs : KTBL-Conference 5 - 7 December 2006 Bildungszentrum Kloster Banz

content.text: Local integration policy in the immigration society: migration and integration as a challenge for municipalities. Cities and communities are central to the economic, social and cultural integration of migrants as places of everyday living together.
content.title_en: Local integration policy in the immigration society: migration and integration as a challenge for local authorities

content.text: The results of the project "Zuwanderer in der Stadt" (Immigration in the City) are documented by the Schader Foundation together with the German City Day, the GdW Bundesverband deutscher Wohnungs- und Immobilienunternehmen (German Association of Housing and Real Estate Companies) and the German Institute of Urban Studies -Difu- und InWIS (German Institute for Urban Studies and InWIS) since the beginning of 2004 with the support of the Federal Ministry of Education and Research. The promotion of the integration of migrants in urban residential districts is at the heart of the joint project. The "Recommendations on urban spatial integration policies" of the Expert Forum were used by the municipalities of the practice network to examine and further develop their own strategies and measures on the ground. The project's participation research investigates the impetus and implementation of the projects in the cities and the communication and stakeholder structures that led to their implementation. In the context of a two-day congress on 28/29 September 2006, the results of the regional community policy were discussed.
content.title_en: Field of action: Urban spatial integration policy : Results of the project "Immigrants in the City" ; [Documentation of the congress "Immigrants in the City - Perspectives of Social Spatial Integration" on 28/29.09.06 in Nuremberg ...]
