content.text: Library management and marketing in a multicultural world : proceedings of the 2006 IFLA Management and Marketing Section's conference, Shanghai, 16 - 17 August 2006. The International Federation of Library Associations and Institutions (IFLA) is the leading international umbrella organisation representing the interests of libraries and information services as well as their users. It is the worldwide voice of the library and information professions. IFLA provides information specialists around the world with a forum for the exchange of ideas and promotes international cooperation, research and development in all areas of library and information services. IFLA is an institution through which libraries, information centres and information experts worldwide formulate their goals and exercise their influence as a group, represent their interests and develop solutions to global problems.
content.title_en: Library management and marketing in a multicultural world : proceedings of the 2006 IFLA Management and Marketing Section's conference, Shanghai, 16 - 17 August 2006

content.text: Does dialogue change religions? : religious encounters and interreligious dialogue. Both the other religions and Christianity are exposed to the potential questioning of their concerns. In the course of this development, local influences of Christianity as well as changes of other religions can arise. The contributions of this volume are devoted to this potential change. The authors are familiar with interreligious dialogue from their own empirical research and open up theological, missionary and aesthetic perspectives on its potential for change.
content.title_en: Does dialogue change religions? : Religion encounters and interreligious dialogue

content.text: The contributions summarized here were made at a conference in 2006 which dealt with the various dictatorships of the 20th century. The spectrum ranges from the Nazi dictatorship to the Eastern Bloc states to the military dictatorship in Argentina. It is about comparisons, differences, systematics, but above all about the political, legal and mental management of these overcome dictatorships. The results are highly differentiated. Of course, it is particularly interesting for us, as for example the examination of the Nazi period in the 3 following states of the 3rd Reich Federal Republic, GDR and Austria took place in a very different way. The book offers exemplary suggestions for further scientific employment and for the organization of the historical teaching.
content.title_en: Long Shadows : Coping with Dictatorships

content.text: The Thomas method in Europe : Origin - Development - End ; [revised lectures of a conference "125 years Thomas method"]. The most important procedure for the European steel industry in the 19th and the first half of the 20th century was the Thomas method. In 19 contributions the European dimension of this method is illuminated for the first time. The general knowledge about the dissemination and application of the Thomas method has been considerably expanded thanks to the regional approach. Thus, the assumption so far that the Rheinische Stahlwerke and the Hoerder Bergwerke and Hütten-Vere were the first plants on the continent, which applied the method developed in England, wrongly. The source study showed that the S.A. of the Aciérie d'Angleur at Lüttich were successful as the two German works acquired a license by Sidney Gilchrist Thomas and that in Kladno much earlier than in (Dortmund-)Hörde and (Duisburg-)Meiderich some Thomas-Chargen were successfully melted. Also the Luxembourg company Metz & Cie. has a two German companies classified by Sortmund-Hörde AG.
content.title_en: The Thomas Process in Europe : Origin - Development - End ; [revised lectures of a conference "125 Years of Thomas Process"]

content.text: The new guiding principles and strategies for spatial development in Germany take up the changing spatial framework conditions, as they have emerged in recent years against the background of globalisation and demographic change. An outstanding position is taken by the guiding principle "growth and innovation", which in the current formulation is primarily - albeit not exclusively - related to metropolitan regions. In the scientific, economic and spatial policy-led discussion, the central statement of this publication, namely that in Germany and beyond, there exist also far away from the metropolises growth regions, is not yet or at all rudimentary. In this volume this gap is for the first time closed, by using a spatial and economic scientific perspective, namely, statistical-empirical research as well as five sample regions (Emsland, Bodensee-Oberschwaben, Regensburg/Oberpfalz, Reiträge, Licht/Oberpfalz, Reiträgient und Obersterreich, which is further illustrated by the fact that in the context of this regional growth, the region's future is strongly influenced by the fact that the region's future is characterized by its high level of growth and its regional competitiveness.
content.title_en: Growth regions far away from the metropolises : opportunities, potentials and strategies : joint event at the congress for site and regional management Euregia Bodensee in Friedrichshafen

content.text: Old cities under conservation of monuments: 50 years of ensemble protection in Germany and neighbouring countries. International conference Meersburg, 28-30 October 2004. Meersburg am Bodensee is the first listed complex in Baden-Württemberg and the oldest protected old town ensemble in Germany. At an international conference, the speakers from Germany and the European foreign countries are concerned with procedures and strategies for the protection, methods for recording and evaluation as well as principles and experiences in the handling of historic historic cities in Germany, Switzerland, Italy and the Czech Republic.
content.title_en: Old cities under conservation of monuments : 50 years of ensemble protection in Germany and neighbouring countries. International conference Meersburg, 28-30 October 2004

content.text: The new climate trap: new targets, new alliances, new technologies - what a future climate policy must do; [Conference volume; Congress "KyotoPlus - Paths from the climate trap", September 2006]. Heat waves, floods or tropical storms - climate change is already in full swing. Even intensive efforts of international climate policy will no longer stop the man-made changes in the global climate, but only mitigate them. While binding reduction targets for greenhouse gas emissions remain an important instrument of political control, the timely adaptation to the consequences of today's no longer avoidable change is increasingly being brought to the fore. But what could a comprehensive future climate policy look like? The Heinrich Böll Foundation, the WWF Germany, the European Climate Forum and the Wuppertal Institute for Climate, Environment and Energy organized a climate congress in Berlin. High-ranking experts discussed new strategies to limit climate change and counter its consequences. The book >> Paths from the climate trap < < offers in brief and understandable contributions background information on current scientific findings, new technologies and the necessary steps.
content.title_en: Ways out of the climate trap : new goals, new alliances, new technologies - what a future climate policy must do ; [Conference volume ; Congress "KyotoPlus - Ways out of the climate trap", September 2006]

content.text: Empty status of buildings in villages - beginning of village resolution or opportunities through re-use?. Although many buildings in the villages of West and East Germany are empty, there are so far only few studies on this problem, which questions the substance of the villages or the grown village cores. Therefore, the 15th lead scrubber village symposium, which took place from 14 to 16 May 2006, addressed this neglected topic. The contributions of scientists and practitioners compiled in this collection provide an overview of the extent of the rural vacancy and its causes, discuss possible strategies for action and present successful political and planning approaches as well as examples of successful re-uses from different federal states, regions and villages.
content.title_en: Empty status of buildings in villages - start of village resolution or opportunities by re-use?

content.text: Network analysis and network theory: a new paradigm in the social sciences. In network analysis and network theory, patterns of relations are at the heart of research. Network research, although it is based on classics of sociology and on various theoretical directions and well-known methods, has in recent years been the result of the new paradigm of network research, but a variety of theoretical and empirical research has been initiated, which has led to the most dynamic field in social research. This is due to the fact that network research can provide answers to numerous questions that have not yet been or are not yet sufficiently clarified. In the volume, important theoretical strands and methodological approaches are discussed, both in an introductory and in the form of the latest research results.
content.title_en: Network analysis and network theory: a new paradigm in the social sciences

content.text: Theoretical Empirical Empirical: on the relevance of qualitative research. Selected contributions from two conferences: a conference at Bielefeld University in May 2005 and a DFG roundtable meeting at Ludwig Maximilian University Munich in July 2006.
content.title_en: Theoretical Empirical Empirical: on the relevance of qualitative research

content.text: Location factor tourism and science : Challenges and opportunities for destinations. Publishing info: Tourism and tourism science are important location factors: they have enormous impact on the economy and society in numerous regions. This is why tourism providers, as well as investors and public administration, have to face the current changes in tourism. This volume of support is provided by Walter Freyer, Michaela Naumann and Alexander Schuler. Experienced experts from Germany and abroad reflect the role of tourism in the development of economy, mobility, internationality and science and show the opportunities in the tourism competition as well as in the establishment of tourism companies. The book combines current research results with recommendations for practice. There is thus new impetus for creative work in location marketing, tourism and tourism science. (2007-11-20)
content.title_en: Location factor tourism and science : challenges and opportunities for destinations

content.text: Megastructure reloaded - visionary city designs of the 1960s reflect by contemporary artists. The city designs Plug-in City by Archigram, La Ville Spatiale by Yona Friedman and the New Babylon of the former CoBrA Painters Constant belong to the architectural incunabula of the 1960s. Architecture, pop culture, art and rebellion entered a unique connection in the visions of megastructuralists. Megastructure Reloaded poses the question of their relevance for urban problems of the present, presents the protagonists in detail in text and image, shows historical precursors such as the Soviet band cities and arranges the ironing answers of the radical groups Superstudio and Archizoom. References to Le Corbusier, Oscar Niemeyer and Lucio Costa and their realized tearboard cities Chandigarh and Brasilia, as well as a theoretical part on megastructure and megacities round off the band. Between the individual chapters find themselves in the form of "Plug-ins" contributions by eleven internationally renowned artists, the viewer and music artists dealing with the issues of real-tempo.
content.title_en: Megastructure reloaded - visionary city designs of the 1960s reflected by contemporary artists

content.text: Regional youth work : ways into the future. Innovative youth work in the region Youth work, especially in connection with care and education measures, has become an intensely discussed task for society as a whole. Currently, the question arises whether local approaches to governance, such as those governing children's and youth work, are sufficient and how the region should be perceived and taken into account more closely. In the book, renowned experts from research and practice outline the situation and diversity of youth work in the region and develop new perspectives.
content.title_en: Regional youth work: ways forward

content.text: Violence at schools: Research results and action concepts. More than 20 authors from science and school as well as providers of prevention and intervention programmes show concrete examples from research and practice. They describe successful approaches from intervention to the establishment of a school house culture or cooperation with external specialist offices and outline their limits. Experts and interested parties are offered an insight into current action concepts and solutions.
content.title_en: Violence in schools: research results and concepts

content.text: The monument as a fragment - the fragment as a monument : Monuments as attractions ; Annual meeting of the Association of National Monument Caregiver (VdL) and the Association of National Archaeologists (VLA) and 75th day of the preservation of monuments 10 - 13 June 2007 in Esslingen am Neckar. The work booklet contains 52 lectures of the first joint annual meeting of the Association of National Monument Caregiver and the Association of National Archaeologists in the Federal Republic of Germany and the 75th day of the preservation of monuments, which took place in Esslingen in June 2007. - They deal with central conservation issues from the point of view of archaeology as well as of the preservation of monuments and monuments
content.title_en: The monument as fragment - the fragment as monument : Monuments as attractions ; Annual meeting of the Association of National Monuments Preservation (VdL) and the Association of National Archaeologists (VLA) and 75th day of the preservation of monuments 10th - 13th June 2007 in Esslingen am Neckar

content.text: How does culture go under the skin? : Emergent practices at the interface between medicine, life and social sciences. Current life science research is increasingly problematizing the boundary between nature and culture. Whether obesity, Alzheimer's, psychiatric disorders, memory performance or stress - all these phenomena are evading simple biological explanatory models and require novel theoretical and methodological approaches.International empirical research analyses these developments and contextualizes them historically, practice-theoretical and biopolitical.For the first time in the German language area, this volume provides an overview of current analyses of leading scientists from Germany, Switzerland, Canada and the USA.
content.title_en: How does culture get under the skin? : Emergent practices at the interface of medicine, life and social sciences

content.text: The spatial consequences of demographic change / Academy for Spatial Research and Regional Planning; Part 11: Recognition, Taxation, Action: Answers to demographic change; 10th Young Forum of the ARL, 6-8 June 2007 in Dresden. The spatial effects of demographic change in Germany and Europe are still a topical topic for both spatial research and the practice of urban, regional and regional planning. The issues of socially selective migration from peripheral areas, the maintenance of facilities of technical and social infrastructure and the preservation of equivalent living conditions in all parts of a country have now also reached public discussion. Especially in East Germany, schools are already closed, medical care standards are being discussed and questions of accessibility to traffic have to be answered. "Acknowledge - Taxation - Action: Answers to demographic change" was the topic of the tenth meeting of the Young Forum of the ARL from 6-8 June 2007 in Dresden. The focus was on the search for solutions to spatial effects of spatial strategies, the implementation of local strategies, the discussion of the topic areas of policy adaptation and the topic areas of policy.
content.title_en: Spatial consequences of demographic change / Akademie für Raumforschung und Landesplanung ; Part 11: Recognizing, Taxing, Acting : Answers to demographic change ; 10th Young Forum of the ARL, 6 to 8 June 2007 in Dresden

content.text: Archeometrics is a research project that focuses on the development and application of scientific methods and concepts for the solution of archaeological questions. It is a research project at the interface between natural and human sciences. Archeologists, physicists, chemists, bio- and geoscientists provide an overview of the current state of the various archeometric approaches: basics, case studies and possible applications. The topics: material analysis, dating, geophysical prospecting, archaeometallurgy, molecular genetics, geoarchaeological environmental reconstruction and cultural development through climate change.
content.title_en: Introduction to Archeometrics

content.text: Body forms : Fashion - Power - Eroticism ; Catalogue of the exhibition at the Historical Museum Hannover from 31 August 2008 to 1 February 2009. Does the human body seem more sensual by a waspentaille or is the corset a crime against nature? Why were leg gowns considered immoral by women a hundred years ago? Is fashion design an expression of special individuality and does a suit fulfil the function of a uniform? The exhibition BodyForms, which presents fashion from the Rococo in the 18th century to the present as a social phenomenon, is dedicated to such and other questions. Because clothing not only protects the body, it also serves to distinguish and to attract people. (Source: hannover.de /Internet). <dt.>
content.title_en: Body forms : Fashion - Power - Erotic ; Catalogue of the exhibition at the Historical Museum Hannover from 31 August 2008 to 1 February 2009

content.text: The use of churches - model with future: Evangelical University Dialogue, Bauhaus-Universität Weimar, [from 21 to 23 February 2008]. Sinking revenues, closing of institutions, even demolition of churches - the churches in the Federal Republic are in a process of profound changes. In many places there are no concepts for the imminent abandonment of numerous churches. But already now it is clear: The loss of their church is an emotional topic for many people - whether churchgoers or not - because churches create identity. - - The Evangelical University Dialogue in Weimar has focused on the question of the future of churches. The present volume documents the papers and contributions on the largest conference on this explosive topic in Germany so far, on which more than 250 participants discussed with experts from the Church and society on possible ways to save a cultural heritage.
content.title_en: Extended use of churches - model with future : Evangelical University Dialogue, Bauhaus-Universität Weimar, [from February 21 to 23, 2008]

content.text: Transnational networks in the 20th century: historical explorations of ideas and practices, individuals and organizations; [43th Linz Conference of the International Conference of Labour and Social History, 13 - 16 September 2007 and International Scientific Conference: Transnational Networks, Contributions to the History of Globalization, Vienna 16 - 18 November 2007]. Klappentext: The concept of the spatial-territorial demarcated nation state is subject to a profound change. Borders are becoming increasingly permeable, interdependencies play an increasingly important role. In this context networks are central to the drive of transnational transfer of ideas, opinion-forming processes and lifestyles. These networks also establish structures of influence and power. Networks are organized in very different manifestations - from loose contacts to formalized cooperation structures. The contributions of this volume highlight the fundamental importance of networks and transnational interaction processes in history and show exemplary concrete expressions. In addition to the workers' movement, knowledge, protest, normative and networks of the global political economy are devoted to particular attention.
content.title_en: Transnational Networks in the 20th Century : Historical Exploring Ideas and Practices, Individuals and Organizations ; [43th Linz Conference of the International Conference of Labour and Social History, 13 - 16 September 2007 and International Scientific Conference: Transnational Networks, Contributions to the History of Globalization, Vienna 16 - 18 November 2007]

content.text: Multiple City : City Concepts 1908/2008 ; urban concepts 1908/2008 ; [on the occasion of the exhibition Multiple City - City Concepts 1908/2008, Pinakothek der Moderne München, 4 December 2008 - 1 March 2009]. MULTIPLE CITY reflects current urban developments in the mirror of central city concepts of the last 100 years. Multiple appearance forms, parallel strategies and counter-developments can be traced back historically. City concepts and urbanist discourses have their temporary economic cycle, but they leave lasting traces. A variety of phenomena, interpretations and debates exist together today. - The publication documents 16 significant themes of urban planning based on texts, current photographs and historical planning material. Renowned authors take their position on the current urban developments in the form of 32 essays. Urban construction is experienced as an exciting discourse in which we are all involved. - - Exhibition: Architecture Museum TUM in the Pinakothek der Moderne Munich - 04.12.2008-01.03.2009
content.title_en: Multiple City : City Concepts 1908/2008 ; urban concepts 1908/2008 ; [on the occasion of the exhibition Multiple City - City Concepts 1908/2008, Pinakothek der Moderne Munich, 4 December 2008 - 1 March 2009]

content.text: Movement in space - space in movement. Space and movement are closely related to each other. Thus space from a resting position and from movement is captured and experienced in different ways. In his lecture on the lecture on the lecture on the topic 2006 the Competence Center for Spatial Research and Regional Development in the Hanover region took up this topic. This volume documents with the various contributions the perspectives and answers of authors from different disciplines on this topic.
content.title_en: Movement in space - space in motion

content.text: Body trading and body experience: multidisciplinary perspectives on a explosive field. Body technology, body standardization, body expression - physicality and the way the body is handled have developed into strong topics that are presented in this book in a multifaceted manner. The contributions from educational science, ethnology, media science, medicine and biotechnology, psychology, sports and dance science as well as theology illuminate body orbits in their historical contexts, in their importance for the building of identity as well as for their social and gender-related implications. The multidisciplinary approach enables a fascinating insight into the multifaceted interactions between social frameworks, individual experiences of the body and body-related actions.
content.title_en: Body trading and physical experience : multidisciplinary perspectives on a explosive field

content.text: Mobility and Context : Future Developments of Mobile Communication in Law and Technology ; Documentation of the Foundation Conference (e.g. EMR Workshop) of the Alcatel-Lucent Foundation for Communication Research, the Institute for European Media Law (EMR), the State Institute for Communication (LFK) Baden-Württemberg and the State Centre for Political Education (lpb) Baden-Württemberg on 10 and 11 May 2007 in the State Institute for Communication (LFK) Baden-Württemberg, Stuttgart. Mobile communications technology is no longer only used for mobile telephone calls and SMS exchanges. Through assistance functions, access to web and radio, localization and context acquisition, mobile communications services become the central individual medium for the exchange and processing of all professional and everyday information. This opens up new opportunities for action and innovation, offers relief and relief, but also creates new dependencies, additional data traces and risks of abuse. The crucial question is therefore how the new possibilities for use must be legally designed and supplemented in order to keep open both development and innovation opportunities, as well as to gain the necessary trust with the user and to protect general interests ... (Source: Texteinband / Verlag)
content.title_en: Mobility and Context : Future Developments of Mobile Communication in Law and Technology ; Documentation of the Foundation Conference (e.g. EMR Workshop) of the Alcatel-Lucent Foundation for Communication Research, the Institute for European Media Law (EMR), the State Institute for Communication (LFK) Baden-Württemberg and the State Centre for Political Education (lpb) Baden-Württemberg on 10 and 11 May 2007 in the State Institute for Communication (LFK) Baden-Württemberg, Stuttgart

content.text: From pharmaceutical to food? : to the delimitation of medicinal and food products in European and German law. The distinction between life and medicinal products is of considerable importance in law and economics. The authors of the articles in this volume investigate current legal developments in Europe and Germany from a legal, nutritional and pharmaceutical perspective. (Source: Text Verlagseinband / Verlag)
content.title_en: From medicinal products to foodstuffs? : to the demarcation of medicinal products and foodstuffs in European and German law

content.text: And God saw that it was good: creation and finiteness in the age of climate catastrophe. The climate catastrophe and the threat of ecological balance have become increasingly public awareness in recent years. Political strategies for action, but also individual responsibility and personal behavioural changes are being discussed. In this volume central theological questions such as the one after creation and finiteness are discussed, newer ecological creation theologies presented and discussed and the discussion with the natural sciences conducted.
content.title_en: And God saw that it was good : Creation and finiteness in the age of climate catastrophe

content.text: Humboldt-Forum Berlin: the project - the project. The book outlines the Humboldt-Forum project for the first time comprehensively. It bundles the state of the debate and will accompany it in the coming years. Until now, the debate about the Humboldt-Forum has been conducted almost exclusively as an architectural and historical debate. After the demolition of the Palace of the Republic and the competition decision in favor of the draft of Franco Stella, the concrete visions and plans for the Humboldt-Forum are now placed in the centre of interest. As an innovative cultural and knowledge centre, as a place of knowledge and encounter of the world, the Humboldt-Forum aims to enshrine public opinion and experience - exemplary for the 21st century - while at the same time giving the city centre of Berlin a central public meaning. On the occasion of the exhibition shown at the Alte Museum from 8 July 2009, in which the future main users, the Stiftung Preußischer Kulturbesitz with its state museums on Berlin, the central and state library Berlin and the Humboldt-Universität for the first time publicly present their plans, the Berlin time at the Theater Humboldt-Forum Berlin. The project/The Project will also address the integrative concept of the project.
content.title_en: Humboldt-Forum Berlin : the project - the project

content.text: Spatially differentiated development and support strategies for north-eastern Germany: [meeting of LAGs on 2 July 2007 in Greifswald]. There are still considerable differences in prosperity between East and West Germany, increasing competition between regions under globalisation conditions and demographic change. There is enough impetus to put existing funding policy principles into the test in the new countries - especially in north-eastern Germany. The question is examined whether the equivalence postulate can be said to distinguish between funding strategies by spatial type, whether and how to strengthen strengths, whether endogenous potential can be promoted by networks and clusters and what importance soft location factors, human capital and the time factor have in this regard. Not least, inter-relationship and consistent implementation of the subsidiarity principle are called for. Pro-active measures, the concentration of funding on industry priorities and fewer centres, interrelated central top-down and decentralised bottom-up control processes with a focus on network formations in the Meso level are called as key to success.
content.title_en: Spatially differentiated development and promotion strategies for North-East Germany : [meeting of the LAG on 2 July 2007 in Greifswald]

content.text: Innovations in space - Space for innovation: 11th Young Forum of the ARL, 21 to 23 May 2008 in Berlin. Innovations and innovative capacity are currently on the course. In the scientific and political discussion, they are given a high priority for economic development. In 2000, the European leaders adopted the Lisbon Strategy with the aim of promoting innovation in order to develop the European Union into the most competitive and dynamic economic area in the world by 2010. Starting from a predominantly economic discussion, new perspectives are coming into the debate in recent times. Social and ecological aspects are increasingly being addressed. For example, in the current climate change debate, innovative technologies are considered as a prerequisite for sustainable growth. In the space sciences, innovations and innovative capacity are discussed in connection with creative milieus or knowledge regions. The Young Forum of the Academy for Spatial Research and Planning (ARL) took up with its conference "Innovations in space - Space for innovation" from 21 to 23 May 2008 in Berlin this highly topical topic. The aim of the conference was to analyse innovative spaces and the conditions under which they arise, and to examine how to promote the question, how innovations can be addressed and how these issues can be discussed in the field of research.
content.title_en: Innovations in the Space - Space for Innovations : 11th Young Forum of the ARL, 21 to 23 May 2008 in Berlin

content.text: The I and his brain: the challenge of neurobiological research for the (straf-)law. content.title_en: The Me and His Brain: The Challenge of Neurobiological Research for (criminal) Law

content.text: Building and gardening culture between "Orient" and "Occident": questions about origin, identity and legitimacy. Questions about interrelationships between European and non-European cultures and European cultural identity, especially in connection with the Orient-Occident relationship, are of particular importance in view of global intertwinedness. In science, however, the answer is to be found from different cultural historical directions, mostly based on historical sources, which are handed down to us in writing and in pictures. Findings of the building and gardening culture as very practical, historical primary sources and instances for historical-critical control, as well as as as as as mirrors of realities, are often neglected. The contributions in this volume try to counter this by investigating interdependencies in the building and gardening culture between Orient and Occident - and this from antiquity to the recent past - by means of such findings.
content.title_en: Construction and gardening between "Orient" and "Okzident" : questions about origin, identity and legitimacy

content.text: Thinking time : Eschatology in interdisciplinary discourse ; [Two-year conference of the working group of Catholic dogmatists and fundamental theologians of the German language area ... under the title "Time - Lifetime - Eternity" from 22 to 25 September 2008 in the Cardinal-Döpfner-Haus in Freising]. Time is on our minds. Time passes, rinsing, racing or resting. Time gives thought. The biblical message has a time core, is an announcement and commitment. In the contributions of this volume questions about the beginning and end of time are being discussed. From the perspective of philosophy and physics, the systematic and practical theology concepts of time and eternity come to language, promise and transformation, lifetime and end time. A fascinating interdisciplinary discourse.
content.title_en: Thinking time : Eschatology in interdisciplinary discourse ; [Two-year conference of the Working Group of Catholic Dogmatists and Fundamental Theologists of the German Language Area ... under the title "Time - Lifetime - Eternity" from 22 to 25 September 2008 at the Cardinal-Döpfner-Haus in Freising]

content.text: Action under risk: approaches to design between risk and precaution. The institutionally arranged relationship between security and risk is in crisis in view of the massive changes in internal, social and external security. Modern societies face the question of how and in which forms this relationship can be redefined and re-arranged in social, legal and political ways.The focus of this volume is on the evaluation of political, social and technical ways of dealing with risk and on the analysis of the social imaginations that are inevitably linked to it.
content.title_en: Risk-taking: Design approaches between risk and prevention

content.text: Good maps for the future? : The introduction of the electronic health card ; 5th Göttingen workshop on medical law. The electronic health card, which has been discussed for a decade and is now before its introduction, is intended to contribute significantly to a more efficient and patient-oriented health system. However, as a combined chip card and network solution, it is also a symbol of a fundamentally changed communication in the physician-patient relationship and between all other health care actors. This raises pressing questions about the continuation of that unique relationship of trust and the increasingly recognized patient autonomy, which have caused considerable anxiety and anxiety among the affected people.
content.title_en: Good maps for the future? : The introduction of the electronic health card ; 5th Göttingen Workshop on medical law

content.text: MoreValue for people and cities: Area recycling in urban conversion regions: Strategies, innovative instruments and perspectives for land recycling and urban renewal; a publication of the funding programme "Research for the reduction of land use and sustainable land management" (REFINA) of the Federal Ministry of Education and Research; a project of the research programme "Building East" of the Federal Ministry of Transport, Building and Urban Development and the Federal Office for Building and Regional Planning; [Documentation of the 1st workshop "Area recycling in urban conversion regions" in Freiberg, Saxony, 20.-21.09.2005]. *Further information Other information: To order the book - subject to its availability - please send an e-mail to: gisela.beckmann@bbr.bund.de
content.title_en: MoreValue for people and cities: Area recycling in urban conversion regions: Strategies, innovative instruments and perspectives for land recycling and urban renewal; a publication of the funding programme "Research for the reduction of land use and sustainable land management" (REFINA) of the Federal Ministry of Education and Research; a project of the research programme "Building East" of the Federal Ministry of Transport, Building and Urban Development and the Federal Office of Building and Regional Planning; [Documentation of the 1st workshop "Flächenrecycling in Stadtumbauregionen" in Freiberg, Saxony, 20.-21.09.2005]

content.text: Hortus ex machina : the Wilhelmshöhe Bergpark in the triad of art, nature and technology; [International Symposium of the German National Committee of ICOMOS, the Museumslandschaft Hessen Kassel and the Landesamt für Denkmalpflege Hessen in May 2009]. Since its construction, the Hercules and the water games in the Bergpark Wilhelmshöhe belong to the great attractions of Kassel and represent an attraction throughout Europe. - On the way to the desired entry of the Bergpark into the World Heritage List of UNESCO, the Landesamt für Denkmalpflege Hessen together with the German National Committee of ICOMOS and the Museumslandschaft Hessen Kassel held an international conference in May 2009 to concreteise the unique features of the Bergpark for Kassel, which UNESCO demanded for a World Heritage Site, and to bring them into an international context. This volume contains 16 contributions by renowned scientists from the fields of art history and conservation, which illuminate the historical and design peculiarities of the Bergpark Wilhelmshöhe Bergpark Wilhelmshöhe compared to other European garden facilities.
content.title_en: Hortus ex machina : the Bergpark Wilhelmshöhe in the triad of art, nature and technology ; [International Symposium of the German National Committee of ICOMOS, the Museumslandschaft Hessen Kassel and the Landesamt für Denkmalpflege Hessen in May 2009]

content.text: Internal insulation in the inventory: [3rd Expert Day of the Regional German Group of the Scientific-Technical Working Group for Building Conservation and Monument Maintenance, November 2009 in Weimar]. For many buildings in the inventory, an improvement of thermal protection and the resulting intended increase in energy efficiency can only be achieved with an internal thermal insulation. However, internal insulations applied to external walls are significantly altered by the structural physical behaviour of an existing construction. Aspects such as the water vapour diffusion from the inside to the outside with possible dew water formation on the structural surface of the wall or the limited drying potential after the impact rain stress are therefore to be considered. This difficult complex of topics was discussed and discussed in a controversial manner by the regional German group of scientific-technical working groups for building conservation and monument maintenance in Weimar in November 2009. The subject area is not one-sided but in the interaction between benefits and risks, between possibilities and risks.
content.title_en: Internal insulation in the inventory : [3rd Expert Day of the Regional German Group of the Scientific-Technical Working Group for Building Conservation and Monument Conservation, November 2009 in Weimar]

content.text: Myth Castle: [an exhibition of the Germanisches Nationalmuseum Nürnberg; 8 July to 7 November 2010]. This catalogue is accompanying the exhibition of the same name by the Germanisches Nationalmuseum Nürnberg. The mythical exaltation of the castle already influenced the design of everyday objects in the Middle Ages. On seals and grave slabs rulers can be represented as ideal knights, tapestries, frescoes and book miniatures show the perfect courtly life from battle to eroticism, which takes place in and outside the castle. However, the actual life was much more multifaceted. The catalogue edition is rounded off by a scientific companion book "Die Burg" and invites you to a journey of discovery into a distant world full of contrasts that continues to this day. Trutzige walls, imposing mountain peace, magnificent halls as a sign of defensiveness, power and knightly life characterize the "Myth Castle" until the present. Exhibition and catalogue dedicate themselves to the origins and development of today's castle image in its entire range on the basis of recent research findings and presents objects that have never been partially shown over 600.
content.title_en: Myth Castle : [an exhibition of the Germanisches Nationalmuseum Nürnberg ; 8 July to 7 November 2010]

content.text: The City. From becoming and passing away: [on the occasion of the exhibition "The City. From becoming and passing away", C/O Berlin, International Forum for Visual Dialogues, 8 May - 4 July 2010]. Meanwhile, more people live in cities worldwide than in the countryside. What hopes and desires do they connect with the city? In what way does the city shape its everyday life and its relations with the environment and fellow human beings? The photographers of the Berlin agency OSTKREEUZ have looked at these questions. OSTKREEUZ stands for a certain approach, namely to recognize the core of things, to represent it and to remain honest in this image. The 18 photographers portray the inhabitants of the city utopia Auroville in India, the slums of Manila and the Detroit, which decayed from the centre, document the Chinese order created on the drawing board, the artificiality of Dubai's street trains and the bombed houses of Gaza. What finally appears is the portrait of a city that is all cities.
content.title_en: The City. From becoming and passing : [on the occasion of the exhibition "Die Stadt. Vom Werden und Vergehn", C/O Berlin, International Forum for Visual Dialogues, 8 May - 4 July 2010]

content.text: The metropolises 1850-1950 : Myths - pictures - designs. At the end of the 19th and early 20th century the big cities developed very differently in Germany and France. On the one hand, the thousand-year-old Paris, after its radical conversion, stood the undisputed cultural capital of the world and model of modern urban development, on the other hand the rapidly growing industrial cities of Germany and the newly ascended capital of the German Reich, unfinished Berlin. In the 19th century the view from Germany to France was still taken for granted and the opposite direction a rare exception, so in the 20th century this changed, when the new currents in art, architecture and urban construction from Germany also found international increasing attention. - - From many perspectives, the contributions cover a interwoven field, ranging from the image of the city, its myths to its planning, its permanent reconstruction and its individual and collective use.
content.title_en: Metropolis 1850-1950 : Myths - pictures - designs

content.text: Topic No. 1 : Sex and popular music; [20th working session of the Working Group Study of Popular Music (ASPM) from 25 to 27 September 2009 in Halle an der Saale]. Sex is ecstasy – and music can also be ecstasy. Sex provokes – and creates through scandals public for the commodity music. Sex polarizes – and is therefore the means of distinction for the music of social groups and generations. Popular music is a cultural product that represents particularly youthful life worlds. Like hardly any other medium, it provides information about male and female identity models and related power structures, about moral concepts, overtime desires, longings, hopes and ideals in society. As comprehensive as in this volume, the intimate relationship between sex and music has not yet been worked out.
content.title_en: Topic No. 1 : Sex and popular music; [20th working group on Popular Music (ASPM) from 25 to 27 September 2009 in Halle an der Saale]

content.text: The religion of space and the spatiality of religion. Churches in modern times act as public signs of transcendence, decoupled from questions of church membership. However, they are open to religion beyond denominationality. Churches in modern times act as public signs of transcendence, decoupled from questions of church membership, but open to religion beyond denominationality and open to ascribe meaning. They serve as collective memory stores, for stagings in the quarters and in the city, they are refuges of otherness. The new interest in the spaces of religion must give thought to theology. What changes of individual piety, what transformation of institutional forms are involved in this? The contributions of this volume show how the new interest in the spaces of religion can give thought to the theology.
content.title_en: The Religion of Space and the Space of Religion

content.text: Strangers in the city: Orders, representations and social practices; (13th - 15th century). Klappentext: Whether pilgrims, Jews, merchants, Saracens or slaves: strangers play an important role in the medieval city. This is shown in drafts of order on a normative, everyday practical and artistic level, which are stimulated and changed by strangers. With relational perception and the manifold attributions of difference, specific relations of inclusion and exclusion within urban society are combined. Accordingly, the status and function of strangers vary from political and economic partners or cultural and knowledge-holders to internal and external enemies. The spectrum of their representations ranges from privileged personality to the dominated object. The volume analyses these fields of tension in an interdisciplinary manner with a focus on Italian cities between 1200 and 1500.
content.title_en: Foreigners in the city : Orders, representations and social practices ; (13th - 15th century)

content.text: Global crisis - regional sustainability : options for action of future-oriented urban and regional development. The global economic crisis 2008/09 is the starting point of this volume's reflections: is it a systemic crisis that is not soluble in sub-sectors of economy and politics, but rather as a fundamental problem that involves the household of man with planet Earth? Then all efforts at regional level to escape the crisis would be doomed to failure in the long term. Or is the regional level suitable to enforce other economic and lifestyles that can successfully counter the multiple crises of global development (economic, ecological, social) independent sustainability paths? While the first contributions of the volume deal with this fundamental question, the further contributions take a stand in favour of the possibilities of regional sustainability: Economic approaches of regional economic cycles Ecological and energetic contributions of a sustainable settlement policy Approaches of social sustainability under the challenges of global demands Questions of managing regional and social sustainability Aspects of the re-consolidation Reduction of local conflicts.
content.title_en: Global crisis - regional sustainability : options for future-oriented urban and regional development

content.text: Urban conversion complex : Governance, planning, process. Forms of interaction, control modes and action orientations in urban conversion are questioned from a political and planning perspective.
content.title_en: Urban conversion complex : governance, planning, process

content.text: Königliche Gartenbibliothek Herrenhausen : a new view of gardens and their books; [Conference volume; Workshop, March 2010]. On 19 and 20 March 2010 the workshop "Königliche Gartenbibliothek Herrenhausen. Ein neue Aussicht auf Gärten und ihre Bücher" took place in Hanover as a cooperation event of the Zentrum für Gartenkunst und Landschaftsarchitektur (CGL) of the Leibniz Universität Hannover and the Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz Library. The workshop represents a preliminary highlight in the history of research into the Königliche Gartenbibliothek Herrenhausen, which was transferred to public ownership due to its inclusion in the list of nationally important cultural assets in its entirety.
content.title_en: Königliche Gartenbibliothek Herrenhausen : a new view of gardens and their books ; [Conference volume ; Workshop, March 2010]

content.text: Dynamics + Change: the development of cities on the Rhine 1910 - 2010+; [on the occasion of the exhibition "Dynamik + Wandel. Die Entwicklung der Stadte am Rhein 1910-2010+" in the RheinForum in Cologne from 4 November 2010 to 2 March 2011; catalogue]. Their rapid and uncontrolled growth posed many major cities in West Germany such as Cologne, Düsseldorf and Duisburg at the beginning of the 20th century before unprecedented challenges. What changed in the settlement volume between Bonn and Duisburg over the last 100 years was fundamental and exemplarily shows numerous "universal" developments. The book sheds light on both the concrete development on the Rhine and general urban planning issues. A dynamic development history of the Rhine, which reaches to the present day, is now – in the face of climate change – faced with new and equally difficult challenges. Lukas Roth's impressive photo grfies are devoted to the topics in a very special way.
content.title_en: Dynamics + Change : the development of cities on the Rhine 1910 - 2010+ ; [on the occasion of the exhibition "Dynamics + Change. The development of cities on the Rhine 1910-2010+" at the RheinForum in Cologne from 4 November 2010 to 2 March 2011 ; catalogue]

content.text: Regional planning of large-scale retailing : small regional planning conference Baden-Württemberg 2009. Against this background, the Baden-Württemberg "Small Regional Planning Conference 2009" took place on 23.10.2009 in Bühl, which the Regional Association of the Middle Upper Rhine organized in cooperation with the working group of the regional associations Baden-Württemberg and the LAG Baden-Württemberg of the ARL.
content.title_en: Regional planning of large retail : small regional planning conference Baden-Württemberg 2009

content.text: New studies on Nazi mass killings by poison gas: historical significance, technical development, revisionist denial. More than a quarter of a century after the first comprehensive presentation on the topic "National Socialist mass killings by poison gas", which the concentration camp survivors Eugen Kogon and Hermann Langbein presented together with others in 1983, the latest research status is presented here. Internationally recognized scientists address the historical backgrounds as well as the scientific and technical prerequisites of mass killings by poison gas and their concrete implementation in the German Reich and in the occupied territories. In addition, positions of internationally active Holocaust deniers are examined and counter-strategies formulated in country-specific contributions.
content.title_en: New studies on Nazi mass killings by poison gas : historical significance, technical development, revisionist denial

content.text: Deep Search : Politics of searching beyond Google; [many of the contributions ... were first presented at the Deep Search Conference, which took place on November 8, 2008 in Vienna]. Do search engines control not only markets but also our thinking? Using Google's example, the book examines their meaning and inner systematics. It discusses appropriate reactions in society, legislation and politics as well as from the consumer side. -Search engines call pragmatically-disparately the countless programs for researching documents on the Internet. The far-known, Google, is at the center of the contributions of this collection, and in light it does far more than simply search: through its inherent systematics, it manipulates knowledge and opinions, generates structures beyond the lens, directs data streams, creates unsparing public sphere and produces customer relationships where previously knowledge thirst was. The authors take up many facets of this problematic development and discuss appropriate reactions in society, legislation, politics, but also among individual users. At the same time, they inform about the importance and history of targeted information preparation and its cultural background.
content.title_en: Deep Search : Politics of Search beyond Google ; [many of the posts ... were first presented at the Deep Search Conference, which took place on November 8, 2008 in Vienna]

content.text: The year 1950 : Focuses of German art of the postwar period; [on the occasion of the exhibition "Das Jahr 1950. Brennpunkt Deutscher Kunst der Nachkriegszeit" in the Foundation Schleswig-Holsteinische Landesmuseen Schloss Gottorf from 24 October 2010 to 16 January 2011]. Richard Scheibe / Gerhard Marcks / Hans Martin Ruwoldt / Hans Uhlmann / Gustav Seitz / Karl Hartung / Bernhard Heiliger / Waldemar Grzimek / Norbert Kricke / Jörn Pfab / Karl Hofer / Alexander Camaro / Ernst Wilhelm Nay / Werner Heldt / Hans Hartung / Heinz Trökes / K.R.H. Sonderborg / Harald Duwe / Marcel Lods / Otto Ernst Schweizer / Georg Wellhausen / Egon Eiermann / Adolf Bayer / Rolf Gutbrod / Fritz Eggeling / Friedrich & Ingeborg Spengelin / Ludwig Schweizer /
content.title_en: The year 1950 : Focuses of German art of the post-war period; [on the occasion of the exhibition "Das Jahr 1950. Focuses of German art of the post-war period" at the Foundation Schleswig-Holsteinische Landesmuseen Schloss Gottorf from 24 October 2010 to 16 January 2011]

content.text: NS Architecture: Power and Symbolism: [Contributions of an Interdisciplinary Symposium "NS Architecture: Power Policy and Symbolism" at the University of Stuttgart, which was organized in June 2009 by the International Center for Cultural and Technological Research (IZKT) in conjunction with the architect Werner Durth of the TU Darmstadt]. Architecture and urban planning played a key role in the self-presentation of the NS regime - their power and symbolism policy was correspondingly significant. Architecture was considered to be the "word of stone" through which the "leader" spoke to his people. However, the NS construction process was not exhausted in the initially dominant blood and soil architecture and neoclassical state and representation buildings. Research has already since the 1980s attracted attention to the great importance of functionalist, partly "modern" planning concepts and purpose architectures. - The volume gathers the most recent works, which are based on additionally developed archive holdings and Nachlässen.
content.title_en: NS-Architecture : Power and Symbolism : [Contributions of an interdisciplinary symposium "NS-Architecture: Power Politics and Symbolism" at the University of Stuttgart, which was organized in June 2009 by the German architect Werner Durth of the TU Darmstadt in conjunction with the historian of architecture.]

content.text: China in Castle and Garden : chinoise architectures and interiors ; conference volume ; [Symposium "China in Castle and Garden - chinoise architectures and interiors from the Baroque to the outcome of archaeological classicism" from 24 to 27 October 2008 ... at Pillnitz Castle]. In autumn 2008 Schloss Pillnitz was the venue of an international symposium on the chinoiserie - a direction of European art oriented towards Chinese models. The Chinoi series is the subject of a cultural historical phenomenon, the East Asian and European models and their interactions, the lacquer cabinet in Germany and Hungary, William Chambers' effect in Europe as well as Japonerie and Chinoiserie in Saxony. The volume makes a profound contribution to the exploration of Chinese influences in castle and garden. - Some texts are also printed in English
content.title_en: China in Castle and Garden : chinoise architectures and interiors ; conference volume ; [Symposium "China in Castle and Garden - chinoise architectures and interiors from the Baroque to the outcome of archaeological classicism" from 24 to 27 October 2008 ... in Castle Pillnitz]

content.text: The authors examine the causes, phenomena and consequences of transformation processes in the European context. The cities ask themselves: "To win, lose, transform, and transform the European urban regions in motion. Cities and regions are in a profound upheaval. But what new phenomena of spatial development can be recognized and interpreted? What are the causes or driving forces? How do they change space and what effects do they have on society and politics? The transformation of the European urban system and urban policy is at the heart of this bond. If one sees "development" as a change of relatively stable conditions and "transformation" as a reaction to a seriously changing context, then a transformation process is currently taking place in the German and European urban regions. This is in the context of economic, social and political reactions to the recent globalization shift with its much-disputed apparent and invisible effects on the European urban system, contributions from different countries are being gathered together.
content.title_en: Winning, losing, transforming: European urban regions in motion

content.text: Emissions of agricultural soils: KTBL/vTI conference from 8 - 10 December 2010 at the education centre Kloster Banz in Bad Staffelstein. The reduction of emissions is an important goal for air pollution control and mitigation of climate change. While the emissions from animal husbandry are already comparatively well quantifiable, the level of emissions from soils is still subject to greater uncertainties. Especially for nitrous oxides, the extent to which indirect emissions are to be taken into account in addition to direct emissions at the site, as well as indirect emissions by the discharge of nitrate and resulting nitrous oxides at other sites is not clarified. The conference contributions present information on nitrous, ammonia, carbon dioxide and methane emissions, but also nitrogen oxides and volatile organic compounds. The state of knowledge, strategies and practical solutions to reduce emissions and findings on the fundamental factors affecting emissions (source: KTBL).
content.title_en: Emissions of agricultural soils : KTBL/vTI-Conference from 8 - 10 December 2010 at the Bildungszentrum Kloster Banz in Bad Staffelstein

content.text: The GCP Directive has led to massive changes in pharmaceutical law in many EU countries. The contributions of this volume explain these changes and address the relationship between harmonised European pharmaceutical legislation and other regulatory provisions. The systematic breakdown by country on the one hand and the selection of critical questions related to pharmaceutical research on the other hand allows a targeted search for the answer in which the pharmaceutical legislation is permissible / inadmissible, which international rules must be used and in which areas there is a need for improvement. The GCP Directive (Good Clinical Practice) has led to massive changes in pharmaceutical law in many European Union countries. The authors present these changes and address the relationship between harmonised European pharmaceutical legislation and other regulatory provisions. The volume provides answers to the following questions: In which context is the pharmaceutical testing permissible/inadmissible, which international rules must be used and in which areas is the need for improvement?
content.title_en: Implementation of the GCP Directive and its impact on broadcasting

content.text: HDI2010 - Conference volume of the 4th conference on "High-Customs Informatics" : 9-10 December 2010 in Paderborn. With the 4th conference on university didactics Informatics a series is continued, which took place in Stuttgart in early 1998 under the heading "Informatics and Education". Since then these conferences serve as a forum for teachers in the field of university computer science as a forum for information and discourse on current didactic and educational developments in the field of computer science education. Currently, these include in particular questions of educational relevance of computer science content and the challenge of a stronger competence orientation in computer science. The submitted contributions to HDI 2010 in Paderborn illustrate different efforts to deal with relevant problems of computer science didactics at universities in Germany (and partly also abroad). From the breadth of the spectrum of submissions, problems arose at the same time in the assessment. Finally, only three of the numerous submissions could convince the experts that they were fully accepted in their long version. Nine further submissions were largely positive despite criticism, as well as a summary of the discussion paper.
content.title_en: HDI2010 - Conference volume of the 4th conference on "High debt-idaktics computer science" : 9-10 December 2010 in Paderborn

content.text: High-rise building : desire and reality ; [an exhibition and publication]. Photography -- Realities of the high-rise building -- New York -- London -- Zurich -- Hong Kong -- Shanghai -- The high-rise building,photographically viewed
content.title_en: High-rise building : desire and reality ; [an exhibition and publication]

content.text: The D.M.H.H.H.H.H.H., the D.M.H.H., the D.M.H.H., the D.M.H., the D.M.H.H., the D.M.H., the D.M.H.H., the D.M.H., the D.M.H., the D.M.H.H., the D.M.H.H., the D.M.H.H., the D.M.H., the D.M.H.H., the D.M.H.H., the D.M.H.H., the D.M.H.H., the D.M.H.H., the D.M.H.H., the D.M.H.H.H., the D.M.H.H.H., the D.M.H.H., the D.H.H.H.H., the D.H.H.H.H.H., the D.H.H.H.H.H.H., the D.H.H.H.H.H.H., the D.H.H.H.H.H., the D.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H., the D.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H., the D.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H.H
content.title_en: Roman Bezjak - socialist modernism : archeology of an era ; [in conjunction with the exhibition "Roman Bezjak. Socialist Modernism", Sprengel-Museum Hannover, June 22 - October 16, 2011, Robert-Morath-Galerie, Hamburg, January 21 - March 17, 2012]

content.text: Transregional perspectives : small-scale mobility and perception of borders in the 19th century : [ ... Contributions of the workshop "Small-scale mobility and perception of borders in the 19th century - Transregional perspectives" ... on 25-26 June 2009 in Bautzen]. Small-scale migration and everyday mobility of close spaces represented a large part of the migrations of the 19th century. The present volume documents a conference of the Institute of Saxon History and Folklore on this topic in June 2009 in Bautzen. The authors devote themselves to small-scale mobility forms as well as to the perception of administrative, confessional and social borders from a transregional perspective. They examine different geographical spaces and reflect the current state of historical and cultural research on migration. It becomes clear that the research of small-scale mobility makes the hitherto valid categories of migration research, which long-term long-distance migrations were the focus of their interest. (Source: Text Verlageinband / Verlag)
content.title_en: Transregional perspectives : small-scale mobility and perception of borders in the 19th century : [ ... Contributions of the workshop "Small-scale mobility and perception of borders in the 19th century - Transregional perspectives" ... on 25-26 June 2009 in Bautzen]

content.text: Psychoanalysis - Neurobiology - Trauma. The interest in a dialogue between psychoanalysis and neuroscientists is growing strongly in both the scientific community and the media and in the wider public. As Nobel Prize winner Eric Kandel repeatedly emphasizes, both disciplines complement each other in a fruitful way, as they explore the same from different perspectives - namely the human mind and psyche. In order to define the wide field thematically, a topic of high relevance and topicality was chosen, on which the knowledge of both sides is far advanced and convergence points already emerge: the trauma. The research results of modern neurobiology on trauma are extremely fascinating and promising from a psychoanalytic and psychiatric point of view. However, for neuroscientists too, the rich clinical experiences of psychoanalysts with trauma patients are revealing. An integration of knowledge of both disciplines allows an in-depth understanding of the functioning of the human mind in general as well as new insights about extrem traumatizations and their therapy. In this book, experts of both areas present and planned research projects and treat them with impressively-mindedness.
content.title_en: Psychoanalysis - Neurobiology - Trauma

content.text: Optica : optical instruments at the court of the Landgraves of Hesse-Kassel; [on the occasion of the exhibition "Optica. Reconstruction of the Optical Room at the Art House Landgraf Karls" in the Western Pavilion of the Orangery from 1 September 2011 to 26 February 2012]. History -- Telescope -- Telescope -- Astronomy -- Microscope -- Burning lens, Burning mirror -- Laterna Magica
content.title_en: Optica : optical instruments at the court of the Landgraves of Hesse-Kassel ; [on the occasion of the exhibition "Optica. Reconstruction of the Optical Room at the Kunsthaus Landgraf Karls" in the Western Pavilion of the Orangery from 1 September 2011 to 26 February 2012]
