content.text: Innovations in tourism and leisure: Hypes, trends and developments. Emancipated customers, shorter product life cycles, globalization – the tourism industry is increasingly influenced by high dynamics and increasing competitive pressure. To what extent can and must companies and destinations react to rapidly changing trends in order to be successful in the long term? Experts in this work, published by Philipp Boksberger and Markus Schuckert, represent important developments, trends and instruments for tourism and leisure. In addition, numerous solutions for strengthening the competitive position in practice are shown. The focus is on: - current and future customer needs - sustainability and its implementation in tourism - influences of the Web 2.0 on consumer behaviour and marketing - transformation of trends and lifestyle into marketable innovations and products. With scientifically sound contributions as well as case studies and examples, the work is a good basis for developing future-oriented business strategies.
content.title_en: Innovations in tourism and leisure : Hypes, trends and developments

content.text: Between dream and trauma: urban planning of post-war modernism. Visions, guidelines, plans and practical examples for the reconstruction (especially) of German cities after the destruction by air attacks in the Second World War. (Erdmann Steinmetz) "Light - cheerful - of course - festive - coloured - radiant", was a goal for the reconstruction of the German cities destroyed during the Second World War (especially) to "complete the work of bombs" and to realize a visionary new beginning - a concept that was hardly implemented. In this volume 15 authors of plans and examples - among others Berlin, Hannover, Hamburg, Saarbrücken, ("the socialist") Dresden - present guiding ideas under political, social and aesthetic conditions and discuss causes of today's tendency to dismantling and reconstruction. The work, which is equipped with numerous small-format illustrations and plans as well as extensive literature references, also aims to "enable a contemporary view of the structure and shape of our everyday life environment".
content.title_en: Between Dream and Trauma : Planning of the post-war Modernism

content.text: Adolf Loos and Vienna: [on the occasion of the exhibition of the same name in the exhibition center of Vienna Insurance Group AG Wiener Versicherung Gruppe, 1010 Vienna, Schottenring 30, exhibition duration: 1 December 2011 to 17 February 2012]. Adolf Loos is considered to be Vienna's most important architect and publicist of the first third of the 20th century of international importance. His work has experienced considerable opposition at the time of its creation and continues to encourage an intensive debate in the discourse on architecture. In addition to the intensive relationship with his chosen city of Vienna, as evidenced by the famous Vienna Plan, the catalogue deals, among other things, with iconographic sources that Loos used in his draft of his main work, the Haus am Michaelerplatz. The numerous documents, which have not been published yet, among others for the Schneidersalon Goldman & Salatsch at Michaelerplatz, make the book an indispensable source for architectural historians
content.title_en: Adolf Loos and Vienna : [on the occasion of the exhibition of the same name at the exhibition center of Vienna Insurance Group AG Wiener Versicherung Gruppe, 1010 Vienna, Schottenring 30, exhibition duration: 1 December 2011 to 17 February 2012]

content.text: Renewable energies in spatial planning: Symposium of the Central Institute for Spatial Planning at the University of Münster on 13 May 2011. The expansion of renewable energies is an increasingly important topic of energy policy in the context of a future phase-out from nuclear energy, the ever increasing energy demand and climate change. According to the Federal Government's energy concept, the spatial planning options of the federal government, Länder and municipalities are to be used to optimally tap into the potential of wind energy, but also other forms of renewable energies. The associated area requirements present new challenges for spatial planning and building management planning. The symposium of the Central Institute for Spatial Planning addressed the questions whether and to what extent the production of renewable energies can be controlled with the existing planning instruments or whether there is a regulatory need. The Central Institute for Spatial Planning, in accordance with the tradition of the present conference volume, makes all lectures and the summaries of the discussions of the event accessible to the interested public.
content.title_en: Renewable energies in spatial planning : Symposium of the Central Institute for Spatial Planning at the University of Münster on 13 May 2011

content.text: Technology and transcendence: the relationship between technology, religion and society. Long description: Technology is perceived as the essential motor of "disenchanting the world" in the 20th century, since it seems to compete with religious world interpretation and life practice. However, in public debates, modern technology draws on promises of salvation and utopias in order to promote itself and raise claims for validity above world images. Thus, technology and transcendence are more closely related to each other than is commonly assumed. Moreover, technology aims to bring inaccessible things into the realm of the feasible. However, this creates new unavailabilitys, especially in terms of controllability and application possibilities. The contributions of this volume interdisciplinaryly illuminate the relationship between technology and transcendence in theoretical and case-related analyses. Biographical note: Katharina Neumeister, M. A., and Peggy Renger-Berka, M. A., are employees in the special research area "Transcendence and Common Sense" of the Technical University of Dresden. Prof. Dr. Christian Schwarke teaches theology at the Technical University of Dresden.
content.title_en: Technology and transcendence : to the relationship between technology, religion and society

content.text: The church building between sacralization and secularization - in the 17th and 18th centuries and today. In the sign of the concept pair "sacralization - secularization" the conference volume brings together insights from researchers from different disciplines who deal with churches of the 17th and 18th centuries and the present. Precisely the discussion about the function and meaning of the church building in the 20th and 21st centuries, and thus the question of the sacrality of the church space, is at the center of many contributions
content.title_en: The church building between sacralization and secularization - in the 17th and 18th centuries and today

content.text: Land Use Monitoring III : Survey, analysis, evaluation ; [in this volume 26 of the 27 contributions of the 3rd Dresden Land Use Symposium, which took place from 26th to 27th May 2011, [...] are documented]. The book provides information on the latest methods and data bases of land use monitoring as well as small-scale statistical and forecasting methods. The basis is the contributions of the 3rd Dresden Land Use Symposium. Two trends determine the rapid development: the constantly improved data offer and the coordination of property and geo topography in the AAA project.
content.title_en: Land Use Monitoring III : Survey, analysis, evaluation; [in this volume 26 of the 27 contributions of the 3rd Dresden Land Use Symposium, which took place from 26 to 27 May 2011, [...]]

content.text: Theology in conversation with empirical sciences. The Department of Systematic Theology of the Scientific Society for Theology (WGTh) sought to discuss the experiences of the social sciences at two annual meetings. In 2009 she discussed the measurability of religiosity with the social sciences. In 2010 she was involved in the dialogue with the natural sciences with the topic of the horizons of experience of time. Such interdisciplinary discourses serve to clarify the issues that are pending and explore the possibilities of cooperation. In addition, they use the present contributions to the scientific theoretical debate on the concept of experience and examine the importance of experience in working methods and in the self-understanding of theology as a science.
content.title_en: Theology in conversation with empirical sciences

content.text: Imperfect Health : the medicalization of architecture ; [to accept the exhibition "Imperfect Health: The Medicalization of Architecture", present at the CCA form 25 October 2011 to 1 April 2012]. Imperfect Health deals with the complexity of today's health problems and shows a variety of architectural and urban solutions. Health -- Healthcare -- Medical Design -- Architecture -- Urban Planning -- Landscape Planning -- Design -- Environment
content.title_en: Imperfect Health : the medicalization of architecture ; [to accept the exhibition "Imperfect Health: The Medicalization of Architecture", present at the CCA form 25 October 2011 to 1 April 2012]

content.text: Book of the future : visions of the floor ; 100 years Uzin-Utz AG ; [Exhibition "The Future Among Us"]. "Book of the Future – Visionary Floor Moments" The "Book of the Future" takes the reader on a journey into the future of the ground and shows what potential the ground carries under our feet. What will the soil of the future look like? What will it do? And how will it affect our daily life? Excitedly illustrated, the visionary floor moments in seven chapters show how the soil will become key to individual well-being in the future, awaken our memories, form spaces, the world a$mX: MVB$v2013-05-01$xH$3Contents$501$ADNB$B2
content.title_en: Book of the future : visions of the floor ; 100 years Uzin-Utz AG ; [Exhibition "The Future Among Us"]

content.text: Churches in the village: conservation and use of churches in rural areas; [Documentation of the workshop meeting 7-8 April 2011 Marburg/Lahn]. In times of empty municipal funds and shrinking population numbers, many churches in structurally weak regions are threatened with closure. However, in rural areas they often represent the oldest and most important testimonies of cultural tradition. For a long time, the preservation of monuments has been in favour of giving priority to their gentle conversion over closure, sale or even demolition. - - - The volume "Churches in the village let - conservation and use of churches in rural areas" documents the conference, which took place under the same name from 7-8 April 2011 in Marburg/Hesse and has made an important contribution to a supra-regional, supra-confessional and professional unification of the previous commitment for churches
content.title_en: Churches in the village let : conservation and use of churches in rural areas ; [Documentation of workshop meeting 7 to 8 April 2011 Marburg/Lahn]

content.text: Water without borders : Contributions to Hydrology Day on 22/23 March 2012 at the Albert Ludwig University of Freiburg; [TdH 2012]. From the preface: Hydrology and water management demand an integrative approach and therefore frequently meet disciplinary, methodological and administrative limits. Therefore, inter- and transdisciplinarity has become increasingly important both in hydrological research and in water economics applications. Hydrology Day 2012 is therefore under the motto Water without borders. The conference will address and discuss works that explore these physical and disciplinary border areas, apply methods across barriers and point out approaches to overcoming borders. The 123 contributions are divided into three thematic areas: Topic 1: Border areas (research, modelling); Topic 2: Border crossings (management, planning); Topic 3: Border crossing (application, governance).
content.title_en: Water without borders : Contributions to Hydrology Day on 22/23 March 2012 at the Albert Ludwigs University of Freiburg ; [TdH 2012]

content.text: Monuments in the garden - the garden as a monument : international symposium from 31 March to 2 April 2011 in Schwetzingen. The monument is a phenomenon that has an important and changing significance in European garden art from the early modern era to the 19th century. The tension ranged here from the monument as a medium of political-dynastic programs in the princely gardens of Europe to the historical aspects of the monument, as object and initial of preservation. - This publication documents the results of an international symposium, which took place in spring 2011 in Schwetzingen against the background of the nomination of the Electoral Summer Residence Schwetzingen for the UNESCO World Heritage List under the title "Monuments in the garden - the garden as a monument". It contains 22 contributions by renowned experts in the architectural, art and garden history from eight European countries.
content.title_en: Monuments in the garden - the garden as a monument : international symposium from 31 March to 2 April 2011 in Schwetzingen

content.text: The border area as a place of remembrance : about the change to a post-national memory culture in Europe. Historical museums and memorial sites have for a long time mediated primarily national historical images. In united Europe, however, the idea of a denationalized collective commemoration is growing. This discrepancy is particularly evident in border areas where former states competed with their contrary interpretations of the past. Using the example of the north-eastern Italian border area, German, Italian and Slovenian scientists in this book are designing a comprehensive panorama of a new democratic memory culture. They show the profound consequences for public commemoration and museum and historical didactics in an international and interdisciplinary perspective.
content.title_en: The border area as a place of remembrance : about the change to a post-national culture of remembrance in Europe

content.text: In the 19th century, what is the typical situation of the European spa towns and fashion towns: International conference of the German National Committee of ICOMOS, the State Office for the Conservation of Monuments Baden-Württemberg in the government headquarters of Stuttgart and the city of Baden-Baden Baden-Baden, 25-27 November 2010. World baths as a world heritage? - In the 19th century, there are a handful of places in Europe that develop into communication centres for an international clientele: nobility and citizens, industrialists and artists, healthy people and sick people search for these places every year for several weeks and months and shape social life with their demands and interests: spa houses, casinos, music pavilions, grand hotels, villas, public baths, horse racing, sports fields, mountain railways - all this is created by the change of supply and demand. Access has everyone who can afford it. - In November 2010 the German National Committee of ICOMOS organized together with the State Office for the Conservation of Monuments Baden-Württemberg and the city of Baden-Baden the same international conference on the profile and the importance of these international cities of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city of the city
content.title_en: 19th century European spa towns and fashion baths : International conference of the German National Committee of ICOMOS, the State Office for Monument Care Baden-Württemberg in the government bureau Stuttgart and the city of Baden-Baden Baden-Baden, 25-27 November 2010

content.text: Choreography of the masses : in sport, in stadium, in intoxication ; [on the occasion of the exhibition Choreography of the masses. In sports. In stadium. In Rausch, 6 June to 12 August 2012, Akademie der Künste, Berlin]. In this book, the Akademie der Künste, Berlin, is dedicated to a key area of public space, the stadium as a venue for mass events. Volkwin Marg, member of the academy and founding partner of gmp architects of Gerkan, Marg and Partner, develops the cultural-historical interaction of sport, architecture and fan culture in six chapters with architectural historian Gert Kähler and Michael Kuhn (gmp). The archetype ranges from the sacred background of the competition in antiquity to the present-day politicization and commercialization of sport. The authors place sport and sports buildings in the context of social and political contexts in ancient times, in national socialism and in post-war times: the stadium as a structural reflection of social organization.
content.title_en: Choreography of the masses : in sport, in stadium, in intoxication ; [on the occasion of the exhibition Choreography of the masses. In sports. In stadium. Intoxication, 6 June to 12 August 2012, Akademie der Künste, Berlin]

content.text: Land Use Change in Central Europe : Research Subject and Methodological Approach to Historical Landscape Analysis. Approaching the historical landscape analysis was the topic of a workshop which took place on 16 and 17 February 2011 in the framework of the Research Training Group in Interdisciplinary Environmental History in Göttingen and whose contributions are now published in this volume. Eight articles illustrate the complexity of the topic complex and the importance for nature and landscape conservation.
content.title_en: Land use change in Central Europe : Research subject and methodological approach to historical landscape analysis

content.text: Land Use Change in Central Europe : Research Subject and Methodological Approach to Historical Landscape Analysis. Approaching the historical landscape analysis was the topic of a workshop which took place on 16 and 17 February 2011 in the framework of the Research Training Group in Interdisciplinary Environmental History in Göttingen and whose contributions are now published in this volume. Eight articles illustrate the complexity of the topic complex and the importance for nature and landscape conservation.
content.title_en: Land use change in Central Europe : Research subject and methodological approach to historical landscape analysis

content.text: The "German Post Union Foundation" continues to exist after the post union in ver.di opened in 2001. The conference in October 2011 invited well-known socio-critical speakers, including Hans-Jochen Vogel, Heribert Prantl and Albrecht Müller ("Nach DenkPage", ID-B 45/12). Their well-founded presentations on problems and misdevelopments, the threat to social peace and democracy, give the conference documentation an informative foundation. R. Obermann, head of Telekom, also demands sustainability here. The privatization of the Post since 1995, the split in DHL and Telekom are not the subject of any discussion. In various discussion rounds with ver.di functionaries, foundation boards and executive works councils hardly sounds self-criticism, the hope rests on corporate social responsibility (CSR) - corporations should assume social-state responsibility, new efforts already exist. Intention of the conference was probably also to show the rapprochement of corporations and unions with an optimistic view of the future. (3) With photos and conference program.
content.title_en: Against the creeping dismantling of the welfare state : consequences - alternatives - perspectives ; documentation of a conference of the DPG Foundation

content.text: Learning landscapes: new school buildings; [exhibition] 26 July to 18 August 2012, Galerie Renate Kammer; [catalogue]. What is school and what is "child-friendly" architecture? A range of classrooms, the sound of the break bell, noisy children in long, narrow corridors, dusty display cases on hexagonally tiled stairwell platforms, easy-care floors and heavy fire doors? For the architect Marc-Olivier Mathez, school is "WerkStadt", a space that should not be subject to a social discipline. Mathez started his school construction projects with the "Grund- und Stadtstadtschule Stübenhofer Weg". In 2010, the architectural office developed a pedagogical school architecture project in line with Dutch architect Herman Hertzberger – simple construction, generous rooms, lots of day and art light, open interior spaces without corridors, working and resting areas – forward for Germany.
content.title_en: Learning Landscapes : new school buildings ; [Exhibition] 26 July to 18 August 2012, Galerie Renate Kammer ; [Catalogue]

content.text: Symptom Design : from the point of view and the point of view of things [Contributions for the international conference "Symptom Design: Things, Signs and their Effects" ; spring 2012... at the Faculty of Design and Arts of the Free University of Bolzano]. Architecture and design are more than ever symptoms of contemporary culture. It shows in them the society as it is, but also how it wants to be. It shows itself in them the desires, desires and suppressed longings as well as the psychological abysmalities of a society. But what exactly does design show itself? And how does it show itself? Can we speak of a language of design? But does it speak at all? Or should we not rather start from a special kind of reference of things, traces, indices and signals, in which something like a symptom comes from the inner prerequisites of culture to visibility? The contributions of Christoph Baumberger, Remei Capdevila-Werning, Claus Dreyer, Kurt W. Forster, Jörg H. Schieber, Tatsuma Padoan, Gerd Selle and Uweth give answers
content.title_en: Symptom Design : from showing and showing things [Contributions for the international conference "Symptom Design: Things, Signs and their Effects" ; spring 2012... at the Faculty of Design and Arts of the Free University of Bolzano]

content.text: The children of the war children and the late consequences of the Nazi terror. Verlagsinfo: The members of the age group of today's 35- to 55-year-olds have the commonality that their parents experienced the Second World War as children and were often subjected to serious stressful events at that time.
content.title_en: The children of the war children and the late consequences of the Nazi terror

content.text: Genetic individuality in law. The deciphering of the genome and, most recently, the development of modern sequencing methods make many people afraid that their "individuality" could be lost. The present volume examines what exactly the individual's understanding of self is based on and to what extent the concern is justified in the interdisciplinary discourse between human genetics and law. The contributions result from an interdisciplinary workshop of the Göttingen Institute of Human Genetics in cooperation with the Center for Medical Law in January 2012. Complementary contributions from both human genetic and legal perspectives broaden the basis of facts and provide a deeper insight into the current state of affairs The deciphering of the genome and, lastly, the development of modern sequencing processes make many people afraid that their individuality could be lost. What exactly is meant by this is the self-image of the individual underlying and to what extent the concern is justified, the present volume investigates the interdisciplinary discourse between human genetics and law. The contributions result from an interdisciplinary workshop of the Göttingen Institute for Human Genetics in cooperation with the Center for Medical Law, which provides a comprehensive overview of human rights.
content.title_en: Genetic Individuality in Law

content.text: Life Means: Food and Drink in the Arts and Cultures; [Research results of the conference "Life Means", which was held in November 2011 at L'arc in Romainmôtier]. In what sense are the arts, the literatures of the world means to life in life, but also means and media of life itself? No doubt: literature or art is because it is more than it is. But then you don't have to ask the question: What does it eat? Isn't it what it eats? What would literature, what would art be without what it ingests on a philosophical, literary-intertextual, natural-historical or natural-scientific level? A variety of disciplines of transverse polylogs of different areas of life knowledge seeks to open the way for new transdisciplinary fields of research. The basic substance food as an elementary interface between culture and life is to reach the existential center of life.
content.title_en: Means of Life : Food and drink in the arts and cultures; [Research results of the "Methods of Life" conference, which was held in November 2011 at L'arc in Romainmôtier]

content.text: Model projects for the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity in the German biosphere reserves : Presentations and results of the conference "Best practice in the German biosphere reserves" at the International Academy of Nature Conservation Vilm from 1 - 4 November 2010. The conservation of biological diversity and its sustainable use in a natural environment are essential objectives of the German biosphere reserves. As model areas they are particularly suitable for the implementation of exemplary projects and measures. In 2010, in the year of biological diversity, a conference on exemplary projects and measures for the protection and sustainable use of biological diversity from the German biosphere reserves at the International Academy of Nature Conservation on the island of Vilm was therefore carried out. In order to make these best practice examples accessible to a wider audience, a large proportion of them are published in this conference volume.
content.title_en: Model projects for the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity in the German biosphere reserves : Presentations and results of the conference "Best practice in the German biosphere reserves" at the International Academy of Nature Conservation Vilm from 1 - 4 November 2010

content.title_en: Hunting parks and zoos : Nature conservation significance of historically used forests ; Guide with recommendations and suggestions ; Contributions to the workshops on 27 and 28 September 2011 in Weikersheim and on 24 and 25 April 2012 in Raesfeld

content.text: European Cultural Heritage - Images, Traditions, Configurations : International Conference, University of Kassel, 8 - 9 October 2010. Is there a common European cultural heritage? What ideas are underlying European identity, how is a community constructed, represented and fixed in images by different nationalities? How does the process of understanding and negotiating what should be considered a common heritage and what not? Does the idea of a European heritage collide with regional and national traditions, and what is its relation to the concept of a world heritage? The definition and interpretation of cultural heritage have changed fundamentally in recent years: Tango, calligraphy and Polynesian songs have joined temples, castles and historical districts and are to bridge the >>world heritage < from a Eurocentrism focused on material substance. So what remains of the idea of a European cultural heritage? - In this volume, experts from various disciplines are following these questions and discussing current debates as well as historical conceptions of cultural heritage and preservation. Diverging approaches are discussed in a comprehensible way, the processes of understanding and the tradition of European cultural heritage are discussed.
content.title_en: European cultural heritage - pictures, traditions, configurations : International Conference, University of Kassel, 8 - 9 October 2010

content.text: Mobilitys and immobility: People - Ideas - Things - Cultures - Capital. A key key to understanding spatial transformations to be observed worldwide is the development and transformation of mobility. This applies to large and small-scale movements of people, but also to ideas, cultures, things, capital, economic goods and information. Mobility is not without mobility, even in our hypermobile globalized world. Mobility and immobility are in a close, tension-rich interaction that decisively influences the social spatial development and shape of cities and regions. Thus, especially the most important movement machines such as mobile phones, computers, aircraft, rapid trains, etc. require highly complex, spatially fixed and spatially-oriented technical infrastructures. New technologies enable virtual mobility in physical immobility. At the same time, virtual mobility has not replaced physical mobility; rather, physical mobility has also increased. These considerations were the reason for the thematic orientation of the 1st Dortmund conference Space and Planning Research: Mobilitys and immobility. This book documents a large part of the contributions to the conference, which was organized by the Faculty of Space Planning of Dortmund University and the University of Technology and Space Planning.
content.title_en: Mobility and immobility : People - Ideas - Things - Cultures - Capital

content.text: Structural change and development issues of old-industrialized regions: Results, problems and opportunities of ecologically compatible structural change of industrial regions in Saxony, Saxony-Anhalt and Thuringia; on 4 and 5 October 1994 in Dresden. The symposium mainly presents problems and strategies in the old-industrialized regions of the new federal states. Structural change in the new federal states has a dynamic, as it has not yet been achieved in this strenuousness in Germany. The aim of the symposium was to exchange experiences on ecologically compatible structural change. Research results are presented, which are supplemented by contributions from municipal and regional perspectives, planning offices and scientific institutes. First, four statements on fundamental changes, problems and comparisons are documented, in which experiences from the old federal states are also presented. In the second part, results of industrial and regional development and selected special problems, e.g. aspects of the housing market in old-industrialized regions are presented. The third part deals with the revitalization of urban industrial areas and old-industrialized locations.
content.title_en: Structural change and development questions of old-industrialised regions: results, problems and opportunities of ecologically compatible structural change of industrial regions in Saxony, Saxony-Anhalt and Thuringia; on 4 and 5 October 1994 in Dresden

content.text: Afritecture : Building with the Community; [on the occasion of the exhibition "Afritecture - Building with the Community" at the Museum of Architecture at the TU Munich in the Pinakothek der Moderne, 13 September 2013 to 12 January 2014]. Contemporary architectural projects that deal with local and cultural conditions and social needs in Africa
content.title_en: Afritecture : Building with the Community ; [on the occasion of the exhibition "Afritecture - Building with the Community" at the Museum of Architecture of the Technical University of Munich in the Pinakothek der Moderne, 13 September 2013 to 12 January 2014]

content.text: Beyond the Church: the opening of religious spaces since the 1950s. The spatial presence of religion marks their respective social significance. Both through the architecture of religious buildings and through their execution in public space, it underlines its status. In addition, the social and theological form of churches is formed in the space. Spaces thus have a central significance for the transformation of religion since the 1950s, which has been significantly shifted: First, classical religious spaces like churches have been given a different shape; secondly, the church occupied non-church public spaces such as streets and squares; and thirdly, diverse new spaces of religious communication in the media have emerged. Frank Bösch, born in 1969, is a PhD historian. Since 1998 he has worked as a research associate at the seminar for Middle and Modern History of Göttingen. Previously, he was responsible for research on the history of parties and society at the seminar for political science there as a member of the project group "Social Moral Milieus in Democracy and Dictatorship" (SOC), University of Bochum.
content.title_en: Beyond the Church: the opening of religious spaces since the 1950s

content.text: Longing cities: in search of urban spaces worth living. In search of urban spaces worth living: How are cities of longing constructed and communicated in the media? How do people make their living space suitable for everyday life? What are the aspirations behind technological and planning concepts for the future? The interdisciplinary contributions of the volume address these questions from the perspectives of cultural sciences, sociology, urban planning and engineering sciences.
content.title_en: Longing cities : in search of urban spaces worth living

content.text: Social Work and Urban Development : Research Perspectives, Areas of Action, Challenges ; [Aggregate book with lectures of the conference of the same name]. "The history of social work is closely linked to the becoming of the city. Different positions of professional action and research have developed. This collection presents concepts from a party, intermediate, reflexive spatial and planning-related perspective and provides an insight into the opportunities and limits of their implementation by means of case studies. In addition, future challenges such as the legal-to-city movements, guiding principles such as that of social sustainability and approaches to planning-related social work are illuminated."
content.title_en: Social work and urban development : research perspectives, fields of action, challenges ; [Aggregation book with lectures of the conference of the same name]

content.text: Luginsland. Architecture with views : [Exhibition]. The building type of the "view architecture" was created in the course of tourist developments in the 19th century and has gained increasing attractiveness. On the one hand, observation buildings, which - immigrated to the cities - serve as visitor platforms for show-lust and location marketing. On the other hand, the projects gain a new meaning in the context of ecological interest, with the aim of ascent and view into the forest's habitats, a goal which is also followed by the "tree crown paths". The publication, richly illustrated with photos, models and plans, creates a panorama of architectural interventions from the last fifteen years. Topics such as architecture and landscape, ecology and habitat or history of sight and view are dealt with as well as the interplay between architecture and art or architecture and engineering. Criterion for the selection of towers, platforms and small architectures was less of their size and prominence than their architectural quality.
content.title_en: Luginsland. Architecture with views : [Exhibition]

content.text: The book gathers contributions from various disciplines on the subject of apocalyptic and on the perception of the revelation of John in literature, art and science of modernism. The biblical-antique foundations are presented as well as their continuations in the scholarly discussion and the diverse subsequent pictorial traditions in literature and art. Individual analyses for the productive recording and processing of the biblical patterns in literature, music, graphics, in film and not least in the recent climate discussion show the apocalyptic and the apocalyptic as perception phenomena and interpretation patterns, which are used again and again in the description of scenarios of decline.
content.title_en: Falling Scenarios : Apocalyptic Thoughts in Literature, Art and Science ; [this volume gathers the lectures of a lecture series held in the winter semester 2010/2011 ... at the Landau site]

Architecture, Germany - France 1800 - 2000", which will be shown from 30 March to 21 July 2013 at the Musée d'Art Moderne et Contemporain de la Ville de Strasbourg and then at the German Architecture Museum in Frankfurt am Main from 3 October 2013 to 12 January 2014]

content.text: Energy and space. Environmental impacts and the scarcity of fossil fuels are important topics of energy and environmental policy discussion. These are closely linked to questions about energy saving potential and energy efficiency as well as the expansion of renewable energy sources in both analytical and strategic perspectives. The role of spatial planning as both a cause of excessive energy demand and as a mediator of renewable energy potentials is often not sufficiently recognised. Therefore, the contributions in this volume address important problems at the local, regional and national level and provide integrated planning recommendations for discussion.
content.title_en: Energy and space

content.text: New spaces for art: International Architecture Competition Kunsthalle Mannheim. 29 architectural offices from all over the world took part in the competition for the new building of the Kunsthalle Mannheim in 2012. The chair of the prize-winning jury assessed the quality of the submitted designs as a »mirror of the current architectural developments of the world«. The publication presents the versatile ideas of the architects with numerous illustrations of the original plans and thus delivers the status quo of current museum architecture. The winning design of the Hamburg architectural office gmp (Gerkan, Marg and Partner) convinces with a symbolic appearance, a breathtaking space experience and intelligent functional quality. By 2017, a »Schatzhaus« for the Mannheim collection of modern and contemporary art will be created in the heart of Mannheim. The highly complex building task »Museum« is a royal discipline, which is also examined with emphasis by museum researchers.
content.title_en: New spaces for art : International Architecture Competition Kunsthalle Mannheim

content.text: Performance, reliability and reliability assessment of communication networks and distributed systems : 7. GI/ITG workshop MMBnet 2013, 5-6 September 2013. The aim of the workshop is to show further developments of the basics and tools for measurement and modelling and to report on experiences in interesting application studies (on computer networks or distributed applications). We welcome also innovative contributions that bridge the gap between the hitherto often separate
content.title_en: Performance, reliability and reliability assessment of communication networks and distributed systems : 7. GI/ITG workshop MMBnet 2013, 5/6 September 2013

content.text: Medicine and Technology: Risks and Consequences of Technological Progress: [Results of a Workshop]. Modern science and technology have greatly expanded our scope for action, as exemplarily demonstrated by the broad public discussion on prenatal diagnostics. The consequences of technological progress call for our own behaviour to be aligned to certain ethical standards. The Ethics Commission "Safe Energy Supply" contributes to the "Consclusions of Safe Energy Supply", which is of daily importance in times of catastrophic accidents such as 2011 in Fukushima (Japan), as well as the Research Ethics Commissions and the Clinical Ethics Committees, which are to regulate responsible handling in the context of medical research and care. Medicine and technology span a wide thematic spectrum here; think only of the risks of intensive medicine and the risk assessments in the current research field of synthetic biology. Generally, one considers the possibilities of technological progress, whether in the field of atomic energy, in the field of genetic engineering or in the field of practical medicine in general – the question of riskless medicine and technology. In this volume, Volume 1, entitled "Praxisfelder Academie AG presents the results in the workshops.
content.title_en: Medicine and technology : Risks and consequences of technological progress : [Workshop results]

content.text: Natura 2000 in the forest : habitat types, conservation status, management ; Reports and results of the symposium of the same name by the Federal Office for Nature Conservation (BfN) in cooperation with the Alfred Toepfer Academy for Nature Conservation (NNA) in Schneverdingen from 18 to 21 September 2011. Central Europe would naturally be almost completely covered by forest. Today, about one third of the area of Germany's forest is covered. Forests therefore play a special role in nature conservation with their species and habitats - especially in the implementation of the EU's Fauna-Flora-Habitats Directive (FFH) with the aim of creating a coherent network of European protected areas called "Natura 2000". On the other hand, almost the entire forest area in Germany is used for forestry purposes and is subject to further, diverse usage requirements.
content.title_en: Natura 2000 in the forest : habitat types, conservation status, management ; Presentations and results of the symposium of the same name by the Federal Office for Nature Conservation (BfN) in cooperation with the Alfred Toepfer Academy for Nature Conservation (NNA) in Schneverdingen from 18 to 21 September 2011

content.text: Rebirth of tree giants: Reproduction of valuable woody plants as an instrument of garden conservation and conservation; documentation of an interdisciplinary conference of the Stiftung Fürst-Pückler-Museum Park and Schloss Branitz, Fürst-Pückler-Park Branitz in Cottbus, 11 - 13 April 2013. Historical gardens, parks, cemeteries and cultural landscapes are strongly influenced by their often impressive old woody plants. This is indispensable both as a design element and as a habitat of diverse, often threatened species. However, sooner or later a death of valuable woody plants cannot be avoided. - - In this context, the question arises as to what extent special genetic properties of woody plants can be documented or when and by which propagation methods a gene preservation from garden heritage conservation and conservation can be sought. This topic is addressed in the form of numerous interdisciplinary contributions from theory and practice.
content.title_en: Rebirth of tree giants : Reproduction of valuable wood as an instrument of garden heritage conservation and conservation ; Documentation of an interdisciplinary conference of the Stiftung Fürst-Pückler-Museum Park and Schloss Britz, Fürst-Pückler-Park Branitz in Cottbus, 11 - 13 April 2013

content.text: Ethical challenges in Web 2.0: [Referates and correspondents of the interdisciplinary conference "Ethical challenges in Web 2.0"]. The Internet is permeating more and more important social areas such as business, politics, media and culture. Private contacts are also often maintained online. The Internet with its numerous services and its unlimited informational wealth thus becomes a challenging and important field of social-thic reflection and socio-political design. The central question from a social-thic point of view is how freedom and fair participation in Web 2.0 can be realized
content.title_en: Ethical challenges in Web 2.0 : [Referates and correpres of the interdisciplinary conference "Ethical challenges in Web 2.0"]

content.text: Animals on castles and early castles. "Closed by narrow walls, enclosed by cattle stables, gun sheds, powder chambers and gun stands (..). Everywhere in the house it smells of powder, cattle and dogs. (.) Sheep bleak, cattle roar, dogs bark." Thus, the humanist Ulrich von Hutten describes the cramped life on a castle at the end of the Middle Ages. The book is dedicated to castles and castles as an animal food point, whether for riding animals, slaughter animals or for the dog.
content.title_en: Animals on castles and early castles

content.text: The environmental assessment of biogas plants is based on the ecological assessment of the crop yield. [...] A motivation for this study is in particular the consideration of the low-saxon conditions in the ecological assessment. The biogas plant systems in the different regions of Lower Saxony differ primarily from one another by the available or used substrate types. While in the arable region of South Lower Saxony no economic fertiliser is available as a substrate, the utilization of manure from resident livestock farms does not pose a problem for the plants in the processing and mixed region. The plant from the dairy livestock region is characterized by the fact that grass silage is used as a substrate from the grassland that predominates in the region. The availability of alternative energy crops in this region is lower, as the arable areas for the cultivation of livestock feed are proven. The choice of the substrates used has a significant influence on the results of the ecological assessment. This effect is particularly evident in the case of the substrate fertilisers and grass silage. The use of economic fertilisers has a twofold positive effect on the ecological assessment. For the purpose of the use of the crop crops, the use of the crop is not allocated to the crop crops.
content.title_en: Life cycle assessment of biogas plants : taking into account the low Saxon conditions

content.text: Future-oriented energy concepts in municipalities: Documentation of the 18th German Congress of Local Energy Commissioners on 22-23 April 2013 in Mannheim. Energy concepts are intended to make a significant contribution to ensuring a sustainable and climate-friendly energy supply. A special importance is attached to the regional and local energy concepts, which have been established in Germany since the 1970s. They act as a link between international and national concepts on the one hand and local, small-scale concepts and individual measures on the other. Their task is to concreteise (energy-related) overarching goals spatially and at the same time to bundle municipal objectives and strategies. In addition to "future-capable energy concepts", numerous municipal examples on "energy efficiency", "energy in building management" and "cooperation, consulting and public relations" were presented and discussed at the conference in 19 different workshops.
content.title_en: Sustainable energy concepts in municipalities : Documentation of the 18th German Congress of Local Energy Commissioners on 22-23 April 2013 in Mannheim

Cologne]. Excerpt from the publishing press: The focus is on structural and design sustainability, on unused potential and on the planning of unplannable things. Architecture and urban planning, transport spaces and mobility are considered and analysed as far-reaching and comprehensive urban development topics in every respect, which always also have a social dimension.
content.title_en: Architecture in context : the development of urban habitats beyond master plan and facade discussion ; [Event plan14-prolog on the topic of "Architecture in context" from 3 to 6 October 2013... Cologne]

content.text: Building and showing : from the history and present of Kunsthalle Karlsruhe; [on the occasion of the exhibition "Building and showing. From the history and present of Kunsthalle Karlsruhe" in the Staatliche Kunsthalle Karlsruhe from 5 June to 21 September 2014]. Information from the publishing news - - Building and showing : From the history and present of Kunsthalle Karlsruhe - - This publication tells the history of Karlsruhe Kunsthalle in a different way: not as a history of the collections, but as a history of architecture and museum presentation. In 1846 it was opened as a complete work of art from architecture, painting and sculpture. BAUEN und ZEIGEN provides insights into the history of a constantly changing institution. The catalogue contains 19 contributions by authors from art and architectural history, archaeology, ancient philology, history and architecture as well as two photographic series on the Kunsthalle by Candida Höfer and Barbara Klemm.
content.title_en: Building and showing : from the history and present of the Kunsthalle Karlsruhe ; [on the occasion of the exhibition "Building and showing. From the history and present of the Kunsthalle Karlsruhe" in the Staatliche Kunsthalle Karlsruhe from 5 June to 21 September 2014]

content.text: Roads from early history to modern times: Transport routes - cultural carriers - Habitat; Acts of the Interdisciplinary Colloquium Cologne, February 2011. Streets were the keys to the opening of new spaces and the exchange of goods and knowledge at all times. As a connecting element between landscapes, peoples and cultures, they are among the cornerstones of social and economic development. The aim of the Colloquium was to discuss the phenomenon of road interdisciplinaryly and from different perspectives. A particular concern was to go beyond the nearby presentation of individual road paths, magistrals or road categories and to look at both the spatial and sociological dimensions of the road transport construction plant. How is the Cultural Carrier Road perceived in various temporal periods, in antiquity or in the Middle Ages? What importance did traveling have? What was involved in the risks and difficulties involved in mobility? What is the character of the present, but above all what is the future of the road? The authors of this volume discuss these questions and try to show possible answers to these questions?
content.title_en: Roads from early history to modernism : Transport routes - Culture carrier - Habitat ; Documents of the Interdisciplinary Colloquium Cologne, February 2011

content.text: Demographic change: sustainable wastewater concepts. Sustainable wastewater concepts for cities and rural structures are the central thread of this DWA technical book. In twenty articles, experienced practitioners from municipalities as well as experts from teaching and research present their solutions and strategies. From the decentralized sanitary solution or extinguishing water supply to the coordination of spatial and infrastructure planning to the alternative contribution and fee model, the content of the paper is varied. Concrete examples from Sonneberg, Weißwasser or Osthessen also show how demographic change has already arrived in our country and how it is reacted to.
content.title_en: Demographic change: sustainable wastewater concepts

content.text: »Your purposes are not ours«: for the cooperation practice between theatre and school in the Berlin model project »JUMP & RUN«. What does theater want in school and what does school want in theatre? What does it mean to think of artistic processes as educational processes at the same time? - This volume takes the Berlin cooperation project >>Jump & Run - Schule as a system<< (2011/12) as an opportunity to make tangible different needs, interests and understandings that precede and influence cooperation between theatre and school. Images and texts from work processes and stage presentations also offer an insight into different school realities.
content.title_en: »Your purposes are not ours.« : to the cooperation practice between theatre and school in the Berlin model project »JUMP & RUN«

Catalogue ... on the occasion of the exhibition "Kunst und Keksdose. 125 Jahre Bahlsen" from 17 July to 9 November 2014 at the Bröhan Museum, Berlin]. "The exhibition will show over 250 exhibits from a large private collection [Collection Felix Brusberg, Berlin] as well as from the company archive [Bahlsen Archive, Hannover (Dr. Birgit Nachtwey)]." (backside of the back cover) For whom does the name Bahlsen not mean a piece of sweet childhood memories? But the popular cookies are not only delicious, but always valuable packed: already around the turn of the century, the company founder Hermann Bahlsen recognized the importance of a corporate identity and consistently relied on cooperation with outstanding artists for the design of the cookie boxes and boxes. (Verlagsinformation)
content.title_en: Art and cookie box : 125 years Bahlsen ; [... Catalogue ... on the occasion of the exhibition "Art and cookie box. 125 years Bahlsen" from July 17 to November 9, 2014 at the Bröhan Museum, Berlin]

content.text: Frankfurt: Buildings and Visions since 1945; [on the occasion of the exhibition "Hemmelstürmend. Hochhausstadt Frankfurt", 8 November 2014 - 19 April 1015, Deutsches Architekturmuseum, Dezernat für Kultur und Wissenschaft, Stadt Frankfurt am Main] : buildings and visions since 1945. "How and why did Frankfurt grow to the heights? Frankfurt: High-rise City Frankfurt asks itself this question and offers an overview of the city's skyscraper history: from reconstruction after 1945 to the house struggle in the Westend to the present time of global financial markets."
content.title_en: Frankfurt: Buildings and Visions since 1945; [on the occasion of the exhibition "Hemmelstürmend. Frankfurt: Hochhausstadt", 8 November 2014 - 19 April 1015, German Architecture Museum, Department of Culture and Science, City of Frankfurt am Main] : buildings and visions since 1945

content.title_en: Knowledge value Color

content.text: School society : from between them to the learning room ; 30 school buildings in comparison. The rooms of a school reflect the common nature and ideals of the respective society for which they were designed and built. The social life of the micro-society school takes place from time to time in the common spaces, the spaces of the school between which the rooms are combined with absolute determination (class rooms, specialist rooms, etc.): movement rooms, space extensions, spaces under open sky. The framework for action in between forms the framework for the school society. Starting from the drawing of 30 architecturally important school buildings from the past 90 years, architects, educators and learning researchers reflect on the backgrounds, conditions and possibilities for the development of the communal spaces in schools from between them to the learning room. With contributions by Herman Hertzberger, Kazuhiro Kojima, Almut Grüntuch-Ernst, Rolf Schuster, Heidemarie Kemnitz, Barbara Zschiesche, Dirk E. Haas, Michael Schwarz, Henrike Rabe, Marika Schmidt and students of the TU Braunschweig.
content.title_en: School society : from between to learning room ; 30 school buildings compared

content.text: The office: to rationalize the interior, 1880-1960. With the second industrial revolution, the service sector is beginning to grow significantly. At the end of the 19th century, the number of employees in banks, trade, industries and insurance companies is increasing. The rationalization of these companies establishes a specialized and at the same time universal space, which is becoming the operational center of both the private sector and the public administration: machines, furniture and people come together in the office - form and function are combined. The contributions of the volume show the office as a space of rationalization as well as the imaginary, which is still regarded as "the real focus of the habitat" (Walter Benjamin), as the center of administrative and social life.
content.title_en: The office : to rationalize the interior, 1880-1960

content.text: Hot to cold : an odyssey of architectural adaptation. "From the desert to the polar circle - possibilities of adaptive architecture. According to the international bestseller YES IS MORE, BIG, the Bjarke Ingels Group, is now working with HOT TO COLD to demonstrate that extreme environmental conditions, given nature or made by man, can be understood as a challenge and that innovative design and intelligent materials enable architectural solutions that point far beyond the present. Created as part of an exhibition at the National Building Museum in Washington, HOT TO COLD shows how buildings can function as integrated ecosystems in an environmentally and economically sound way."
content.title_en: Hot to cold : an odyssey of architectural adaptation

content.text: The aim of this volume is to unlock the creative and knowledge-building potential that is connected with such usages. We combine concrete meanings and functions with artifacts. They serve as tools for our daily actions. But what consequences do it have when they are used 'inappropriately'? How do 'appropriate' and 'irappropriate' ways of use differ at all? Based on case studies from various thematic contexts and disciplinary perspectives, the volume looks at a wide range of practices that revolve around the question of misuse of purpose. A common starting point is that tension relationship that is evident in the way of speaking from the misinterpretation of purpose: on the one hand, we combine with its violations of rules and normations. On the other hand, it is the 'irappropriate' use that is at the beginning of an exploratory approach to artifacts and helps to facilitate new meanings and readings.
content.title_en: Disturbance : 'irappropriate' use as a cultural practice

content.text: History learn in digital change: [a book project in the Open Peer Review]; [Munich conference "History Learning digital 2013"]. Biographical note: Marko Demantowsky, Pädagogische Hochschule FHNW, Basel; Christoph Pallaske, Universität zu Köln. Main description: Young people communicate through social networks, and seek information and opinion online. They participate publicly in real-time social debates. These radical changes in their life worlds have implications for their views of history and for the collective historical culture. Thus, historical instruction is facing entirely new challenges. The contributors to this volume submitted to an open review process prior to publication. Main description: The life world of the growing world has been subject to profound change for years. The audience has been repeatedly researching in digital networks and events.
content.title_en: Learning history in digital transformation : [a book project in the Open Peer Review] ; [Munich conference "Learning history digital 2013"]

content.text: Exhibition and transfer in the Museum of the Present. Exhibition and transfer in the Museum of the Present - How does museum work change when exhibitions and conveying are understood as an integrated concept? - Museums in the context of critical museology question their social role and design themselves as places of knowledge exchange and a participatory link between history and the present. Mediation is understood as an independent practice, which questions, expands and changes exhibitions and institutions. - The volume gathers contributions from international representatives of different museum types, which provide insight into the diverse positionings and translation of the >> great designs < < today into tomorrow's practice.
content.title_en: Exhibition and conveying in the Museum of the Present

content.text: Mattress/Matrize : Furnishing of Subject and Society : Concepts in Art and Architecture. The mattress is the basic element of living, the thing of our everyday life on which we sleep, love, laziness, dream, healthy and die. It is the epitome of intimacy and physicality and at the same time an agent of normation in subjectivation processes and social relations. In this volume, the mattress serves as a theoretical figure to consider the mattress and the associated embossing processes and knowledge complexes in the supposedly privateest place.
content.title_en: Mattress/Matrize : Furnishing of Subject and Society : Concepts in Art and Architecture

content.text: 15. Internationale Stuttgarter Symposium: Automobil und Motorentechnik. An ever-increasing collection of information is necessary today to understand the increasingly complex technology of today's motor vehicles. Functions, working methods, components and systems are developing rapidly. In ever-faster cycles, current knowledge is spreading from conferences, conferences and symposia to the professional world. This series of proceedings offers quick access to this information, which has set itself the task of putting together the special knowledge required for understanding cutting-edge technology around the automobile in the systematics of conferences and conferences and as a book in Springer.com as well as electronically in SpringerLink and Springer for professionals. The content Motorsport.- Hybrid.- Automotive process and production technologies.- Driving dynamics.- Networking and architecture.- Small motors and test.- Diesel engines.- Diagnosis and test.- Aerodynamics.- Recharging.- Thermomanagement.- Plug-in Hybrid.- Exhaustächsachhandung.- FVVV Projekte.- Fahrzeugsysteme. E-Motorsport.-Begriken.
content.title_en: 15th International Stuttgart Symposium : Automotive and Engine Technology

content.text: Welding in maritime engineering and engineering : 15th conference, 22 and 23 April 2015 in Hamburg. The welding work at the Retheklappbrücke will be discussed in one of the lectures, as well as the installation of 100 m high grid masts for wind turbines and the construction of assembly aids for rotor blades. The conference will be initiated with the presentation of standards for manufacturers and for production control, important elements for welding technology as a cross-sectional discipline. The operational strength of thin-walled welds plays an increasing role in the construction, as well as quality assurance and innovative welding processes. Lectures on damage assessment, repair of a large-scale aluminium construction and welding of nickel alloys round off the program.
content.title_en: Welding in maritime engineering and engineering : 15th conference, 22 and 23 April 2015 in Hamburg

content.text: The questions of ethics and ethics of the economy are discussed in the article on the topic of the economic ethics of the economy. Ingo Pies presents the research program of an economic theory of morality. Peter Weise shows how the interactions of people can generate norms and behavioural irregularities in a evolutionary and self-organizational way. Joachim Wiemeyer's contribution to the order of the labour market tries to explain the discrepancy between the dominant economic approach and the prevailing social justice concepts. Volker Arnold shows in a model of international tax competition why it is reasonable for efficiency reasons to tax labour and capital income differently. Udo Ebert discusses the guiding principle of a larenz-faire taxation fundamental principles of budget control. Hans-Peter Weikard examines the question whether in a reposition-financed pension insurance the ethical contribution to the institution's burden of the economy should be on the burden of the burden of the economy.
content.title_en: Economic ethical perspectives ; 5: Methodological approaches, problems of tax and distribution justice, regulatory issues

content.text: The German Labour Market and Employment Policy is often argued that work is generally scarce and that it is increasingly scarce in the future. In order to increase the number of employees, the overall volume of work to be put into practice must therefore be divided into a larger number of workers. Since such redistribution is mostly not cost-neutral, it runs the risk of creating less than more employment in the long term. This disappointing finding should not lead to the assumption that the problem of a high unemployment rate is fundamentally insoluble. Does the international comparison show that in other economies, new jobs could be created on a large scale. It is therefore without doubt worthwhile to look closely at the successes of these countries, in order to recognize what was left out in their own economy or what was wrong here. -- The annual meeting of the Economic Policy Committee in the Association for Social Policy, which took place from 23 to 25 March 1999 in Bayreuth, the new issue of employment is being addressed in a more effective manner.
content.title_en: Labour market and employment : Germany in an international comparison

content.title_en: Games - free play

content.text: Under the GrassNarbe: Freiraumgestaltungen in Niedersachsen during the Nazi dictatorship as a theme of conservation of monuments: Documentation of the conference from 26-29 March 2014 in Hanover. "Increasingly grass grows over the structural and green planning legacy of the Nazi dictatorship. Often only remains of these backdrops often testify to gigantic mass productions. With the conference "Unter der GrassNarbe" the view was directed towards a part of the incomplete past management. Here the central questions were how this legacy is represented today and which of these objects are preserved in the sense of monument protection and monument preservation." (Verlagsinformation) Increasingly grass grows over the structural and green planning legacy of the Nazi dictatorship. Often only remains of these backdrops often testify to gigantic mass productions. With the conference "Unter der GrasNarbe" the view was directed to a part of the unfinished past consideration.

content.text: Visitors to the exhibition will be invited to visit the museum. The exhibition will be held in the following year. The exhibition will be held in the German language, with the aim of giving new impetus to the discussion on methods and strategies for the visitor retention in the museum. This will open up the potential for visitor integration and visitor retention that has been untapped in many museums in the German-speaking countries. As documented in the publication, there are many practical experiences in museums and in the economy, some of which have been long-standing experience in the field of visitor and customer loyalty. For the readers of the exhibition, the well-filled and practically tested »instrument box«, which modern business administration provides for the problem of customer loyalty, is opened and the solutions are presented with reference to museums and other cultural institutions.
content.title_en: Visitors to the exhibition will be regular guests! : new and creative ways to connect visitors : [Conference volume on the event of the same name of the training centre Abbey Brauweiler/Rheinisches Archiv- und Museumamt on 12/13 November 1998]

content.text: Local talks: Space and Communication in the 19th and 20th centuries. Under the slogan of the spatial turn, 'Space' is currently experiencing an unprecedented renaissance in historical science. However, other disciplines have long been involved in what has quickly become fashion there. The interdisciplinary volume therefore prepares theoretical and knowledge offerings from various neighbouring disciplines for historiographic purposes and at the same time explores the relationship between space and communication in the 19th and 20th centuries using case studies.
content.title_en: Local calls : Space and communication in the 19th and 20th centuries

content.text: World of malls : architectures of consumption. The catalogue "World of Malls" is dedicated to a building type that was invented in the United States almost 60 years ago and quickly spread around the world. Due to the increasing orientation of urban development towards car traffic, the mall became a spare space for lost urbanity. But where is the development of the shopping mall going today? On the one hand, there are still spectacular new openings in America, Asia, the United Arab Emirates and Europe. At the same time, many malls are empty, and some are being rebuilt and re-used. Hardly any other type of building is discussed so controversially: Does the shopping mall now bring the death of the city or rather promote its revival? Urban planners, economists and architectural historians such as Anette Baldauf, Robert Bruegmann, Dietrich Erben, Richard Longstreth, Alain Thierstein, June Williamson and Sophie Wolfrum investigate in their essays the transformation processes of the shopping mall from the 20th to the 21st century
content.title_en: World of malls : architectures of consumption

content.text: The first state exhibition in Brandenburg in 2014 brought the long military-used Dobrilugk Castle (now Doberlug-Kirchhain) back to the public's attention. The prerequisite for this was the comprehensive renovation of the remarkable Renaissance building, which served as a temporary side residence of the Wettin dukes of Saxony-Merseburg. The castle emerged from a Cistercian monastery founded in 1165, which still bears witness to the impressive Romanesque church and the refectory. Only now the complex ensemble can be relived in context. - In this volume 25 years of conservation work are appreciated and the latest findings of architectural and art historical, archaeological, restoration and garden historical research are presented.
content.title_en: Cistercian monastery and castle complex Dobrilugk/Doberlug : History - Research - Monument conservation

content.text: Everything is architecture? : Exhibit and research: Hans Hollein and the Museum Abteiberg : Contributions from the research project the exhibition as a draft of reality - Hans Hollein's design methodology and the symposium Hans Hollein in retrospective. The topicality of a new research, an event to discuss new research questions at the end of the exhibition Hans Hollein: Everything is architecture. at the Museum Abteiberg on 28 September 2014. The first publication on the current research work on the history of the Museum Abteiberg has been published: Contributions from the research project "The Exhibition as a Draft of Reality - Hans Hollein's Design Methodology" and the symposium HANS HOLLEIN "in retrospective". The topicality of a new research, gathered in a text and picture volume. - Published by Samuel Korn, Wilfried Kuehn and Susanne Titz, with contributions by Eva Branscome, Oliver Elser, Barbara Engelbach, Samuel Korn, Wilfried Kuehn, Andreas Rumpfhuber and Jan Verwoert as well as photo documentation of the exhibitions in Mönchengladbach and Vienna. - Realized with the support of the Federal Chancell Office Austria, the Gerdakel Henkel Foundation of the Museum of the Mönchengbach Foundation and Jan Verwoert.
