The topicality of a new research, an event to discuss new research questions at the end of the exhibition Hans Hollein: Everything is architecture. at the Museum Abteiberg on 28 September 2014

content.text: In this collection, ten experts from the Jewish museums and memorials present concepts of renovation and use developed in the German-speaking countries since the 1980s for synagogue buildings that have survived the period of National Socialism but have been deprived of their communities. The examples reflect the change of consciousness for the handling of the built Jewish heritage in the last 30 years and give an overview of the development of the national memory and memorial culture. Particular attention is paid to the appropriate securing of traces of history in the buildings such as the possibilities and challenges of museum work and historical mediation in an authentic place. With contributions by Fritz Backhaus (Jewish Museum Frankfurt/Main), Ines Beese (Old Synagogue Erfurt), Martina Edelmann (Jewish Cultural Museum Veitshöchheim), Daniela Eisenstein (Jewish Museum Franken), Karlheinz Geppert (Jedekähäässs Synagogue Baisingen), Felicitas Heimann-Jelinek (Jewish Museum Veitshöchheim), Daniela Eisenstein (Jewish Museum Hohenzyn), Karlheinz Geppert (Jewish Museum Baisingen), Martina Edelmann (Jewish (Jewish Museum for Martha, Jewish, Jewish Museum Stüxe Syn.
content.title_en: Renovated Synagogues : Space - History - Change through Memory

content.text: Sustainable energy supply and integration of storage systems: Conference volume at the NEIS 2015. The conference volume reflects the contributions of the 2015 conference with the focus on grid integration of renewable energies. The articles show the current developments and experiences on energy storage systems, grid integration and the framework conditions of energy from fluctuating sources. The conference is a forum for experts and scientists to exchange ideas for the design of a future energy supply. Particular attention is paid to the system engineering, analysis and optimization of the electricity sector. These include, for example, future strategies for improved grid integration of fluctuating energies as well as concepts for grid regulation with decentralized power plant units. In addition to the technical aspects, the conference also focuses on the economic, social and legal sides. The content of the framework conditions grid integration control power mobility applications fuel cells and thermal systems overall system The target groups scientists and experts in the field of electrical energy systems, energy technology, energy technology and energy economics Lecturers in engineering and environmental sciences The editor Prof. Dr.-Ing. habil. Detlef Schulz heads the department of Electrical Energy Systems at the University of the German Federal Armed Forces Hamburg.
content.title_en: Sustainable energy supply and integration of storage systems : Conference volume on NEIS 2015

content.text: "Self-directed, competence-oriented and open?!" / Rolf Arnold (ed.) ; Volume 2: Learning Architectures and (online) Learning Spaces. The volume approaches the title-giving topic from an interdisciplinary perspective. In their contributions, authors from architecture, pedagogics, philosophy, history and library science consider learning spaces, which are complemented by empirical studies on physical learning spaces at universities and on campus design. In addition, university actors take a look at the design of virtual learning environments.
content.title_en: "Self-directed, competence-oriented and open?!" / Rolf Arnold (ed.) ; Volume 2: Learning Architectures and (Online) Learning Spaces

content.text: The German Federal Government's Cemeterys: Discover and shape cultural heritage: Contributions of the conference "Historical Cemeterys in Germany" on June 12 and 13 in Kassel (Museum of Sepulcural Culture) and additional contributions. New publication shows cultural and rural significance of historical cemeteries and opportunities for civic engagement. - - The richly illustrated publication contains beside contributions on usage strategies, the exploration and the preservation of historical cemeteries in particular case studies for historical cemeteries and their elements, such as the cemetery entrance, tombs and mausoleums. In addition, the opportunities for this special cultural property are dealt with from an architectural and cultural point of view. - - - The German Federal Homeland and Environment (BHU) appointed as cultural monument of 2015 are a special cultural heritage and landscape element. They are not only important in their role as memorial sites, whose grave monuments are sufficiently used by historical sources, but also as retreat areas for people, animals and plants. Thus the facilities also contribute to biological diversity and to the healthy climate in cities and serve as recreation space for visitors. - Despite these diverse significances, the graveyards are not only used for historical purposes.
content.title_en: Cemeteries in Germany : Discovering and shaping cultural heritage : Contributions of the conference "Historical Cemeteries in Germany" on 12 and 13 June in Kassel (Museum of Sepulcural Culture) and additional contributions

content.text: Limits of Transgression: Controversies about transculture, transgender and transspecies. Transgender, transculturality, transnationality - concepts of trans experience a political and scientific economic cycle. In these contexts, the demand for an opening of sociocultural identities arises. However, the fluid borders of national, social and physical spaces threaten to solidify once again in traditions and neo-racisms: values of the bourgeois small family as well as right-wing populist positions are not only repeatedly addressed, but reproduced in various media and social channels. The contributions of the band therefore ask: Which processes are essential to transconcepts - and what normative boundaries are they breaking?
content.title_en: Limits of crossing : Controversies over transculture, transgender and transspecies

content.text: Wehrhahn Line : Continuum and Editing : an interdisciplinary project of architects, engineers, artists and the capital of Düsseldorf : continuum and cut : an interdisciplinary project by Architects, Engineers, Aristes, and the City of Düsseldorf. An interdisciplinary project of architects, engineers, artists and the capital of Düsseldorf
content.title_en: Wehrhahn Line : Continuum and Editing : an interdisciplinary project by architects, engineers, artists and the capital of Düsseldorf : continuum and cut : an interdisciplinary project by Architects, Engineers, Aristes, and the City of Düsseldorf

content.text: The People on the Track ... : State reports on population moods in communism. Germany - Eastern Europe - China. What does the People Think What Topics and What Problems Move the People What opinions do the people of the political elite have These questions always concern the rulers. While in pluralistic societies the media or surveys can answer such questions, the rulers in dictatorships must take other ways to get an idea of the population mood. They also resort to intelligence or secret police methods. Mood reports from domestic intelligence services were therefore among the most important sources of information in dictatorships of state and party leadership. This also applies to the GDR, in which the Ministry of State Security regularly informed the SED leadership about the mood in the country. The present volume puts these mood reports in the broader context of the history of the 20th century. In addition to information from the GDR state security service, the contributions also cover mood reports from other communist dictatorships such as the Soviet Union, Bulgaria, China or CSSR.
content.title_en: The people on the trail ... : State coverage of population moods in communism. Germany - Eastern Europe - China

content.text: Asian gardens in the West: papers of the conference "Asian Gardens in the West", organized by Benrath Palace and Park Foundation and Heinrich-Heine-University Dusseldorf, October 1-3, 2015. Asian gardens are usually considered mystical, particularly aesthetic and exotic. They have long been firmly established in garden theory, but are also often re-built and inserted into western garden productions. Quite fundamentally for the current popularity of these gardens and for their interpretation is the examination of Japanese gardens since the mid-19th century. Japanese gardens seem to reflect a natural love and fine aesthetics so convincingly that in the past 140 years outside Japan several hundred such gardens were built. However, Japanese gardens are far from being the only example of the spread of an Asian image through garden art. Already in the 18th century there was a Chinese fashion in Europe. Chinese gardens lost their appeal, however, because the Chinese empire was considered sick and backward in the age of the beginning imperialism. Meanwhile, however, many Chinese gardens are again established in the West. Japan and China as the leading garden culture of the Asian world.
content.title_en: Asian gardens in the West : papers of the conference "Asian Gardens in the West", organized by Benrath Palace and Park Foundation and Heinrich-Heine-University Dusseldorf, October 1-3, 2015

content.text: Design for X - Contributions to the 27th DfX Symposium October 2016. The DfX Symposium offers young scientists from the field of product development a platform for the presentation of new ideas and approaches. The conference volume includes the contributions of the 27th DfX Symposium 2016 in Jesteburg near Hamburg.
content.title_en: Design for X - Contributions to the 27th DfX Symposium October 2016

content.text: Autonomy and human rights at the end of life: Basics, experiences, reflections from practice. Autonomy has become a central concept of the medical ethical discourse of the last years: How can it be implemented at the end of life? What practices, institutional and social policy frameworks stand in the way of this? And are there other human rights, which are particularly endangered at the end of life, besides the human rights law-based law of self-determination? Answers to this are given by experts from the fields of human rights, medical law, philosophy, medical ethics, literature, internal medicine, palliative and legal medicine as well as the nursing and health sciences. The volume is rounded off by an interview with the disability activist Dinah Radtke on the »surprising experience of quality of life« with people who depend on assistance and technical devices.
content.title_en: Autonomy and human rights at the end of life : basics, experiences, reflections from practice

content.text: Quartier und Gesundheit : Impulse on a cross-cutting topic in science, politics and practice. The authors of this volume are addressing the district in its increasingly important function for the health of the population. They are looking at the question of how the connection between district development and health promotion can be conceptualized, because a systematic consideration of this relationship has rarely been made. The setting approach, which is favored from politics, practice and the health sciences, plays a major role here. The book provides perspectives from theory and practice as well as interpretations from different disciplines.
content.title_en: Quarter and Health : Impulse on a cross-cutting topic in science, politics and practice

content.text: The architect Ernst Zinsser : Models of his buildings in Hanover. The architect Ernst Zinsser has shaped the city's image with his buildings, which were built between 1937 and 1970 in Hanover. The buildings are considered exemplary for post-war modernism in Germany and give a comprehensive overview of the construction tasks of this era. They are characterized by the detailed facades typical of the period and the successful design of foyers and entrance situations. During a seminar at the Institute for Design and Building Teaching, Prof. Zvonko Turkali, students of the Faculty of Architecture and Landscape at Leibniz University Hannover analyzed the work of the architect Ernst Zinsser and created models of his buildings. This book, which appears for the exhibition of the models in the rooms of the Chamber of Architects of Lower Saxony, pays tribute to the work of the great Hanoverian architect and complements the model presentation with the picture and plan material of the buildings.
content.title_en: The architect Ernst Zinsser : Models of his buildings in Hanover

content.text: SoilEstimatesValues : our use of raw materials. This publication provides an insight into the versatility of mineral raw materials. The topic is examined from different perspectives: geology and environment, technology, economics, sociology and state regulation mechanisms. The complexity and major challenges are clearly presented, possible solutions are presented. Because many ideas for a sustainable use of our raw materials are already thought and implemented in society, but there is still room for manoeuvre upwards. And we are all called to help shape this scope.
content.title_en: SoilEstimatesValues : our use of raw materials

content.text: The contributions of this volume enable comparisons of different advanced academic processes - in addition to the care in the therapeutic professions, early education and social work. Care courses are largely completed by experienced specialists. Can a 'academic' professional identity develop on this basis? This would be the basis for a successful professionalization project of nursing academics, which results in a sufficient quantity of highly distinguished employment relationships. The contributions collected here enable comparison with further open-ended academicization processes in the therapeutic professions and early education as well as with the far advanced professionalization of social work.
content.title_en: Academization of care : professional identities and potential for professionalization in comparison of social and health professions

content.text: The digital cooperative bank: strategic challenges and implementation. Introduction and overview -- Conceptual considerations and strategies / Leontin K. Grafmüller, Matthias Ra, Kathrin M. Möslein The -- cooperative bank on the web 2.0 / Tanja Jovanovic, Kai-Ingo Voigt -- Impact of digitalization on cooperative banks: a business model perspective / Matthias Fischer -- Omnichannel and customer orientation in the digital branch bank / Norbert Huber -- Interruption between consulting quality and digitalization -- Implementation and practical examples / Jörg Bruch -- Digital transformation in the banking environment in the practical example Easycredit/Teambank AG / Stefan Schindler -- The bank branch of the future as a link between virtual and real world / Gerhard Walther -- Practical implementation of a digitalization strategy : concrete results and quick win using the example of VR bank Mittelfranken West eG -- How will a bank become more innovative? : the iterative innovation model of Volksbank Bühl -- Authors
content.title_en: The digital cooperative bank: strategic challenges and implementation

content.text: Triumph without victory: Rome's end in Germania. Starting from the triumphal procession of the general Germanicus on 26.05.17 AD, a demolition of the history of the Roman custom of military triumph is given, with many contemporary representations. Review: On 26.05.17 AD, the general Germanicus moved in triumph through Rome. This time also marks the end of the right-wing Rhenish conquests. The explanation for the latter is astonishing, but conclusive and is explained simultaneously with many other aspects of the Germanic policy of the Romans in the volume. Starting from Germanicus, a demolition of the history of the Roman custom of military triumphal processions is presented, with many contemporary representations. A very knowledgeable and detailed, but always well understandable, quality-made volume on the occasion of an exhibition on the subject of the museum Haltern am See. It is not only widely recommended here, but also as a supplement to the literature on the interesting personality of the field ruler, to whom an exhibition was recently dedicated, e.g. "I Germanicus" (2015).
content.title_en: Triumph without victory : Rome's end in Germania

content.text: The University of the Future : XI. University Symposium 22-23 October 2015, in the Great Hall of Ludwig-Maximilians-University Munich. Is the future of learning and research digital? And how does demographic change change the university? Are there soon only online courses instead of crowded lecture halls? And what effects does it have when research results are available directly around the world? Those responsible from politics, science and practice discussed this from 22-23 October 2015. The XI. University Symposium "The University of the Future" is being held by the Hanns Martin Schleyer Foundation and the Heinz Nixdorf Foundation together with the LMU this year.
content.title_en: The University of the Future : XI. University Symposium 22-23 October 2015, in the Great Hall of Ludwig Maximilian University Munich

content.text: History built up: historical authenticity in the urban area. In processes of urban and regional identity formation, references to historical authenticity, for example of preserved monuments and old cities, take a central role. The volume focuses on the significance of the concept of authenticity in various disciplines such as city history, architectural history, preservation of monuments and tourism history. Using German and international examples, the contributions show the ambiguity of authenticity claims and interpret them against the background of social debates about the importance of the past as well as political and economic interests. The context of action is examined by actors in politics and associations, architects and urban planners as well as the city society itself. The focus is on the 20th century with special consideration of the history of the past after 1945.
content.title_en: Built history : historical authenticity in urban areas

content.text: Intelligent agents and the right. The use of robots in many areas of life is a new focus of the law: the clearest possible allocation of responsibility. As a technological innovation, the digitization of certain processes raises the question of the appropriateness of our liability concepts. If intelligent agents, whether as robot cars, prostheses or irrigation systems, cause damage because they do not properly absorb data in autonomous mode, misinterpret or react inappropriately, the question arises: Are people behind the machine imprisoned? The question of responsibility for intelligent agents is neither new, nor is it limited to legal science. It has already been discussed in Roman law and is currently engaged in technology assessment. The present volume spans the spectrum from antiquity to modernity and from basic questions on application in the insurance industry, intelligent traffic or smart homes.
content.title_en: Intelligent agents and the right

content.text: Bikes! : reinvent the bicycle. The graphic text volume, which was created from an exhibition in Leipzig's "Grasi Museum für Angewandte Kunst" presents, in addition to essays on the transport-political role of the bicycle, attractive, innovative wheels for all kinds of purposes. Review: There are many pictorial volumes that present historical and current models such as "Fascination Fahrrad" (2007), "Cyclopedia" (2911), "Velo Evolution" (2014) of the "Bicycles" (2015) but the "Bikes" from an exhibition in Leipzig goes beyond a directory and deals with the future of the bicycle. This happens first of all through essays, in which, for example, the Braunschweig professor S. Rammler (see "Schubumkehr", 2015) presents the model of Copenhagen or the victory march of the e-bikes is treated. The following are roughly ordered, on 1-2 pages with text and photo elegantly presented bicycle portraits, which show how colorfully this is suitable for all kinds of purposes today. The spectrum ranges from folding bicycles, innovative burden models, send attractive to the band-bound of bicycles and manufacturers often recommend the bicycle-related.
content.title_en: Bikes! : reinvent the bike

content.text: Secret networks in the military 1700–1945. The army is a central power factor in the state, military information is generally protected by law. The military also forms a social system with its own norms, rituals and symbols. The hierarchical structure and strong professional ethos characterize the military to this day. Within this framework, secret networks of military members with different codes of conduct were formed. They often aroused the suspicion of being directed against the military system or the state. The authors of the band explore the interactions between secret federation organizations, secretaries, conspirators and the military – from Masons and Illuminati to the Stauffenberg Circle.
content.title_en: Secret networks in the military 1700–1945

content.text: Excerpting - Compilation - Trading : Transformations of knowledge between late antiquity and early Middle Ages. The phenomenon of transformation and tradition of traditional knowledge levels is so striking in almost every epoch of European history as in the hinge phase between antiquity and the Middle Ages. Over a period of great instability, highly complex knowledge corresponding to the difference between late Roman society was transformed, reduced and reorganized. In addition, in the literature field, but also in scientific texts and in the legal corpora, different techniques and strategies of quantitative compression and reduction were used. From the perspective of different disciplines, the contributions of the volume illuminate these diverse reduction processes in Gaul, Spain and Italy from the 4th to the 8th century and in particular examine the question of how to reduce complexity and to shift complexity through the distortion, compilation and selective traditional processes. New approaches to the evaluation of late antiquity and early middle ages with antique knowledge were revealed, as well as innovative and creative practices with which knowledge stocks were examined in a fruitful manner.
content.title_en: Experpieren - Compilieren - Tradieren : Transformations of knowledge between late antiquity and early Middle Ages

content.text: Water vs. urbanscape: exploring integrated water-urban arrangements. Floods, floods, water shortages, contaminated groundwater etc. are problems that many cities have always struggled with. But can the ratio of -water and -city be thought differently than opposite? How can the water be given more space in the city and at the same time the quality of the public urban space be improved? In research and practice of urban design, the concept of integrated water management has gained ever more importance since the 1990s. Water vs. Urban Scape? presents promising new approaches to integrating water into the urban landscape. The volume examines various international examples with their respective specific socio-spatial conditions in terms of their respective design possibilities: the diffuse urbanization in the north-east of Italy and in Flanders, the booming cities of Shanghai and Istanbul or the expanding city of Oslo, the informal urbanization of Kigali and the suburbanization of Perth. In a second part, various integrated and decentralized water management systems are played out for the capital city's urbanization of the age.
content.title_en: Water vs. urbanscape : exploring integrated water-urban arrangements

content.text: All want to live: just, social, affordable. Taking into account the historical development, the accompanying volume to an exhibition shows comprehensively, systematically and intelligibly how affordable living can be realized. (2-3)
content.title_en: All want to live: just, social, affordable

content.title_en: The political economy of the energy transition: Germany and Spain in the context of multiple crisis dynamics in Europe

content.text: Ownership of satellites : 4th Luxembourg workshop on space and satellite communication law. The work, written by international authors from the field of science and practice of space law, deals in essence with problems of the property right to satellites, their transmission and liability in the event of damage.In addition, the registration of space objects under UN framework conditions and the allocation of frequencies are discussed.The publication is an important contribution to the theoretical debate on the law of space, but is also an important instrument for the legal profession in the financial and insurance sector.
content.title_en: Ownership of satellites : 4th Luxembourg workshop on space and satellite communication law

content.title_en: Flexibility in the EU and beyond : how much differentiation can European integration bear?

content.text: Shrey eagles in agricultural policy (including agricultural environment measures, ELER) : Examples and instruments for protecting the shrey eagle : Conference volume for the 2nd Shrey eagle symposium of the German Wildlife Foundation from 04 to 06 September 2015 in Chorin. Shrey eagles and other bird species are threatened by structural change in the landscapes in Germany. With the change of permanent grassland, the intensive use of land on remaining grassland and the elimination of compulsory set-aside, many food areas have been lost for red kites, meadow worts and mouse buzzard. Within the conference, solutions were sought for the protection of shrey eagles in the management of agricultural and forestry areas. Subjects discussed include: habitats of the shrey eagle in Germany; Shrey eagles in practice (including: forest management, conservation of contract nature, risks from wind energy plants); Shrey eagle in agricultural policy (including: agricultural environment measures, ELER)
content.title_en: Land use of eagles: Examples and instruments for the protection of eagles : Conference volume for the 2nd eagle symposium of the German Wildlife Foundation from 04 to 06 September 2015 in Chorin

content.text: Service architectures : between service corridor and ambient intelligence. "The book offers various views behind the scenes of power and into the existing service constellations, which are made possible by architectural facilities. Here, a historical and interdisciplinary arc is stretched from the ancient Roman villas to the service function of corridors, the 'smart homes' of the present to the concept of architecture in software development."--
content.title_en: Service architectures : between service corridor and ambient intelligence

content.text: Visionaries and everyday heroes : Engineers - Building - Future. From inventors, entrepreneurs, problem solvers and geest ages. Civil engineering and construction engineers : the emergence of the professions / Bill Addis -- Hull + Space. To the development of the Zeiss-Dywidag-Schalenbauweise / Cengiz Dicleli -- Mobility + Transport. Fixed railway tracks / Stephan Freudenstein The exciting and versatile range of services of 'engineers in construction' is rarely perceived as such in the public sphere. The construction industry is not only one of the key industries in economic but also in social and social terms: without buildings and infrastructure our modern life is simply unimaginable. The aim of the publication is therefore to represent the profession of engineer ? representative of the entire industry ? as it is: fascinating, creative, comprehensive and innovative.0Engineer personalities and their innovations are represented against the background of the respective social, economic and political influences ? coming from the history with the focus on current projects
content.title_en: Visionaries and everyday heroes : Engineers - Building - Future

content.text: According to the general view, the findings of science differ from life-worldly judgements primarily because of their objectivity. However, it would be a misunderstanding to assume that scientists only dealt with the facts of this world and otherwise worked without preconditions. Research motivation and questioning, methodology and language, hypotheses and, in some cases, beliefs also shape their results. This does not make the sciences per se unbelievable; but the constant reflection of the knowledge requirements belongs to the core business of serious science. In this volume, the disciplines themselves come to the fore - renowned scientists reflect on the assumptions and thinking requirements with which their own discipline works. The subjects biology, chemistry, climate economics, cosmology, mathematics, physics, psychology, sociology and theology are represented.
content.title_en: How objective is science?

content.text: Together! : the new architecture of the community: with projects by ifau, Jesko Fezer and Heide & von Beckerath, Michael Matltzan Architecture, ON design partners, pool Architekten, Ryue Nishizawa and many others. Housing is a scarce resource - this is becoming increasingly evident in recent years. The real estate prices in the metropolises rise, classical concepts of housing cannot meet the needs any more. These challenges have triggered a quiet revolution in contemporary architecture: building and living in a collective. "Together! The New Architecture of the community" is the first exhibition that comprehensively illuminates this topic and makes it tangible in space. Using models, films and apartments on a scale of 1:1, it presents a variety of examples from Europe, Asia and the USA. Historical forerunners at the same time illustrate the history of the communal architecture - from the reform ideas of the 19th century to the hippie and house squatter scene, which took place with the slogan "Make love, not lofts".
content.title_en: Together! : the new architecture of the community : with projects by ifau, Jesko Fezer and Heide & von Beckerath, Michael Matltzan Architecture, ON design partners, pool architects, Ryue Nishizawa and many others

content.text: Software takes command: Challenges of "Datafiction" for media education in theory and practice. Algorithms and data analyses are increasingly affecting society, culture and social interaction. Given that social and digital participation are linked and that the digital ecosystem of most users is limited to a manageable number of services, which are also in the hands of a few companies, urgent questions arise both about the future of freedom of expression and opinion formation as well as the sovereign handling of media. These calculation methods are also risky, because on the basis of which predictions are made, which contain a potential for discrimination. Sure: Whoever programs, designs and offers codes and software, currently has enormous cultural and economic power. For society as well as media education, new challenges arise. The volume of communication policy begins with theoretical perspectives on datafiction, their consequences for the decision-making and freeness of action by people and possible consequences for media education. Subsequently, concrete media education methods are presented, the abstractness of complexity, the data collection becomes uncomplicated, the data collection becomes more and more important for the development of data.
content.title_en: Software takes command: Challenges of "Datafiction" for media education in theory and practice
